section.name: s42C
section.heading: Authority’s consent required in respect of persons proposing to become shadow directors

subsection.content: A person must not, on or after the relevant date, become a shadow director of an approved trustee unless the Authority has, on the application of the trustee, given prior written consent to the person’s becoming such a shadow director.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the consent of the Authority under this section must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in a form approved by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain such information, and be accompanied by such documents, as are specified in the form.

subsection.content: The Authority may only give consent if it is satisfied that the person in relation to whom the application is made is of good reputation and character and, in particular, has not been found guilty, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere, of an offence involving fraud or dishonesty.

The Authority may give its consent subject to such reasonable conditions as the Authority may impose on the approved trustee and the person proposing to become a shadow director of the approved trustee, and may at any time by notice in writing served on the trustee or shadow director, amend or revoke any such conditions or impose new conditions as may be reasonable in the circumstances.
A person who becomes a shadow director of an approved trustee in contravention of subsection (1) must not give instructions to any director of the trustee.

If a person gives instructions to a director of an approved trustee in contravention of subsection (5), the director must, within 3 specified working days after receiving the instructions, by notice in writing inform the Authority. (9 of 2016 s. 16)

section.name: s42D
section.heading: Authority’s consent required in respect of persons proposing to become substantial shareholders

subsection.content: A person must not, on or after the relevant date, become a substantial shareholder of an approved trustee unless the Authority has, on the application of the trustee, given prior written consent to the person’s becoming such a substantial shareholder.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: becomes a substantial shareholder of an approved trustee in contravention of subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: did not know the act or circumstances by virtue of which he became such a substantial shareholder were such as to have that effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subsequently becomes aware of the fact that he has become such a shareholder,

subsection.continued: he must, within 3 specified working days after becoming aware of that fact, serve a notice in writing on the trustee and the Authority stating that he has become such a shareholder. (9 of 2016 s. 17)

subsection.content: An approved trustee must, within 3 specified working days after becoming aware that a person has become its substantial shareholder in contravention of subsection (1), apply to the Authority for its consent to the person’s continuing to be its substantial shareholder. (9 of 2016 s. 17)

subsection.leadIn: An application for the consent of the Authority under this section must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in a form approved by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain such information, and be accompanied by such documents, as are specified in the form.

subsection.content: The Authority may only give consent if it is satisfied that the person in relation to whom the application is made is of good reputation and character and, in particular, has not been found guilty, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere, of an offence involving fraud or dishonesty.

The Authority may give its consent subject to such reasonable conditions as the Authority may impose on the approved trustee and the person who has become or is proposing to become a substantial shareholder of the approved trustee, and may at any time by notice in writing served on the trustee or substantial shareholder, amend or revoke any such conditions or impose new conditions as may be reasonable in the circumstances.

Subject to subsection (9), a person who becomes a substantial shareholder of an approved trustee in contravention of subsection (1) must not exercise or purport to exercise any voting rights in respect of the person’s shares specified in subsection (8).

subsection.leadIn: The shares referred to in subsection (7) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the person concerned is a natural person, all the shares in the trustee that are held by the person or his associate, close relative or employee, or by a company of which the person is a director, or by his nominee, and by virtue of which the person is a substantial shareholder of the trustee, but does not include any such shares so held immediately before the person became such a shareholder; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the person concerned is a company, all the shares in the trustee that are held by the company, its associate or an employee of its associate, or by its nominee, and by virtue of which the company is a substantial shareholder of the trustee, but does not include any such shares so held immediately before the person became such a shareholder.

subsection.content: Subsection (7) ceases to apply in relation to the shares of a substantial shareholder if an application made in relation to him under subsection (3) is approved by the Authority.

section.name: s42E
section.heading: Authority may object to existing controllers

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may serve a notice on a controller of an approved trustee, other than a person who has become such a controller in contravention of this Part, objecting to his continuing to be a controller of the trustee on the ground that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: he—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is no longer a person of good reputation and character; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has been found guilty, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere, of an offence involving fraud or dishonesty; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: his continuing to be a controller of the trustee is not in the interests of the members of the scheme administered by the trustee.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must, before serving a notice of objection on a controller, serve a preliminary notice in writing on him stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the Authority intends to serve a notice of objection on him;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ground on which the Authority intends to serve the notice; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that he may make representations in writing to the Authority within 1 month from the date of service of the preliminary notice.

subsection.content: The Authority must take into consideration any representations made in the manner specified in subsection (2)(c) before serving a notice of objection.

The Authority is not obliged to disclose to the controller or approved trustee any particulars of the ground on which the Authority intends to serve, or serves, a notice of objection on the controller.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: include in the notice of objection the ground on which the Authority serves the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify in the notice the date from which the controller is to cease to be a controller of the approved trustee (specified date).

subsection.content: When the Authority serves a notice of objection, the Authority must also serve a copy of the notice on the approved trustee concerned.
Where a notice of objection is served on an officer of an approved trustee, the trustee must, not later than the specified date, terminate his appointment with effect from the specified date.
An approved trustee is not required to comply with subsection (7) if the officer has tendered his resignation and the resignation takes effect on or before the specified date.
Where a notice of objection is served on a shadow director of an approved trustee, the shadow director must not give instructions to any director of the trustee from the specified date.

If a person gives instructions to a director of an approved trustee in contravention of subsection (9), the director must, within 3 specified working days after receiving the instructions, by notice in writing inform the Authority. (9 of 2016 s. 18)

section.name: s42F
section.heading: Authority’s power to give directions in relation to substantial shareholders

subsection.leadIn: The power under subsection (2) is exercisable where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person has become a substantial shareholder of an approved trustee in contravention of section 42D;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice of objection is served on a substantial shareholder of an approved trustee under section 42E; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person continues to be a substantial shareholder of an approved trustee despite a notice of objection served on him under section 42E.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may by notice in writing direct the approved trustee to do any one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not to permit or acquiesce in the involvement of the substantial shareholder concerned in the management of the business of the trustee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to deem void and of no effect any votes cast by the substantial shareholder concerned and any of the persons specified in subsection (3) at any meeting of the trustee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to reconvene any such meeting for voting anew on the business on which the votes were cast;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to take such other reasonable steps as it may specify in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The persons referred to in subsection (2)(b) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who is a connected person of the substantial shareholder concerned and who, together with the shareholder, controls at least 15% of the voting shares of the approved trustee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who is a nominee of the substantial shareholder concerned and through whom the shareholder controls at least 15% of the voting shares of the approved trustee.

def.name: ConnectedPerson
def.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(a), connected person (有關連者)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a substantial shareholder who is a natural person, means his associate, close relative or employee or a company of which he is a director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a substantial shareholder who is a company, means its associate or an employee of its associate.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the operation of subsection (2), where a person has become a substantial shareholder of an approved trustee in contravention of section 42D, the Authority may by notice in writing direct the substantial shareholder—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to reduce, within such reasonable time as the Authority may require, the interest in shares by virtue of which he became a substantial shareholder of the trustee to the extent that he is no longer a substantial shareholder of the trustee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to take such other reasonable steps as the Authority may specify in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the operation of subsection (2), where the Authority serves a notice of objection on a substantial shareholder of an approved trustee under section 42E, the Authority may by notice in writing, given at the same time as the notice of objection is served or at a later date, direct the substantial shareholder—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to reduce, within such reasonable time as the Authority may require, the interest in shares by virtue of which he is a substantial shareholder of the trustee to the extent that he is no longer a substantial shareholder of the trustee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to take such other reasonable steps as the Authority may specify in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If a person fails to comply with any direction under subsection (2), (5) or (6), the Authority may, by originating summons or originating motion, make an application to the Court in respect of the failure, and the Court may inquire into the case and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Court is satisfied that there is no reasonable excuse for the person not to comply with the direction, order the person to comply with the direction within the period specified by the Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Court is satisfied that the failure was without reasonable excuse, punish the person, and any other person knowingly involved in the failure, in the same manner as if he and, where applicable, that other person had been guilty of contempt of court.

subsection.content: An originating summons under subsection (7) must be in Form No. 10 in Appendix A to the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A).

section.name: s43
section.heading: Approved trustee’s general duties with respect to administration of scheme
section.leadIn: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must perform the following duties with respect to the administration of the scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the duty to exercise a level of care, skill, diligence and prudence that may reasonably be expected of a prudent person who is acting in a similar capacity and who is familiar with the operation of registered schemes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the duty to make use of all relevant knowledge and skill that the trustee may be reasonably expected to have because of the trustee’s business or occupation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the duty to ensure that the funds of the scheme are invested in different investments so as to minimize the risk of losses of those funds, unless in particular circumstances it is prudent not to do so;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the duty to act in the interest of the scheme members and not in the trustee’s own interest;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the duty to act in accordance with the governing rules of the scheme;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the duty to supervise and exercise proper control over all service providers appointed or engaged for the purposes of the scheme.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Approved trustee to appoint investment manager

subsection.leadIn: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an investment manager is appointed to manage the investment of the funds of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contract for the appointment of the investment manager complies with Schedule 2.

subsection.leadIn: The trustee does not have to comply with subsection (1) in relation to a constituent fund of the scheme if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the accrued benefits of the constituent fund are invested only in a single approved pooled investment fund, or in a single approved index-tracking collective investment scheme, that is specified in the offering document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the trustee has obtained the prior approval of the Authority that compliance with subsection (1) is not required in relation to the fund. (1 of 2008 s. 35)

subsection.leadIn: A person is eligible to be appointed as an investment manager only if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a company incorporated in Hong Kong or a re-domiciled company; and (14 of 2025 s. 235)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has a paid up share capital of not less than $10,000,000 and net assets of at least the same amount; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is a corporation licensed to carry on, or an authorized financial institution registered for carrying on, a business in asset management under Part V of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571). (5 of 2002 s. 407)

subsection.leadIn: In appointing an investment manager, the trustee must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the selection and appointment of the investment manager is recorded in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is no conflict of interest between the investment manager and other persons who have a contractual relationship with the trustee, or any other trustee, that could prejudice the interests of scheme members; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the investment manager has the resources (including human resources) necessary to carry on business as an investment manager; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the investment manager has in place adequate controls and safeguards with respect to the investment of funds of the scheme so as to ensure that the interests of scheme members will be properly protected.

subsection.content: The trustee may appoint a person as an investment manager in respect of the scheme only if the person is independent of the trustee and of the custodian of the scheme assets and of any delegate of the custodian. (L.N. 223 of 2000)

subsection.def: In subsection (2), approved index-tracking collective investment scheme (核准緊貼指數集體投資計劃) means an index-tracking collective investment scheme within the meaning of section 1 of Schedule 1 that is approved by the Authority for the purposes of section 6A of that Schedule. (1 of 2008 s. 35)

section.name: s45
section.heading: Delegation of investment management functions

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that the contract for the appointment of an investment manager prohibits the manager from delegating the management of the investment of the funds of the scheme to a person other than to a company or corporation or partnership of companies or corporations that is solvent and complies with subsection (3) or (4).

subsection.leadIn: If the contract allows the investment manager to delegate its functions with respect to managing the investment of the funds of the scheme, the trustee must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a delegation of any of those functions can be made only with the approval of the trustee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the delegation is in writing; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the delegate is a company or corporation or partnership of companies or corporations that is solvent and complies with subsection (3) or (4); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the manager will continue to be bound by the contract between the trustee and the manager and to be responsible for the proper supervision and control of the delegate and the management of the investment of the funds of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: A company or corporation or partnership of companies or corporations complies with this subsection if it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an associate of the investment manager of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a corporation licensed to carry on, or an authorized financial institution registered for carrying on, a business in asset management under Part V of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571). (5 of 2002 s. 407)

subsection.leadIn: A company or corporation or partnership of companies or corporations complies with this subsection if it is authorized, by a regulatory authority recognized by the Authority, to carry on business as an investment adviser under the law of a place other than Hong Kong and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is an associate of the investment manager of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is an associate of a corporation licensed to carry on, or an authorized financial institution registered for carrying on, a business in asset management under Part V of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); or (5 of 2002 s. 407)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is a corporation licensed to carry on, or an authorized financial institution registered for carrying on, a business in asset management under Part V of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) and maintains an office in Hong Kong. (5 of 2002 s. 407)

subsection.content: If an investment manager appointed in respect of a registered scheme is allowed to delegate the manager’s functions in relation to the scheme, the approved trustee of the scheme must ensure that the functions are delegated only to a person who is independent of the trustee and of the custodian of the scheme assets and of any delegate of the custodian.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Independence of investment manager

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 44 and 45, an investment manager, or the delegate of an investment manager, is independent of the approved trustee of the relevant scheme and of the custodian of the scheme assets and a delegate of the custodian of the scheme assets only if— (L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the manager or delegate is not an associate of the trustee or custodian or the delegate of the custodian; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no person is a controller of both the manager or delegate and the trustee or custodian or the delegate of the custodian or any associate of the trustee or custodian or the delegate of the custodian; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the manager or delegate acts independently of the trustee and custodian and the delegate of the custodian in their dealings with the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: If an investment manager, or a delegate of an investment manager, and the approved trustee, or the custodian of the scheme assets or the delegate of the custodian of the scheme assets, are subsidiaries of— (L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a substantial financial institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a holding company of a substantial financial institution,

subsection.continued: they may nevertheless be regarded as being independent of each other if they comply with subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: An investment manager, or a delegate of an investment manager, and the approved trustee, or the custodian of the scheme assets or the delegate of the custodian of the scheme assets, comply with this subsection if— (L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: neither of them is a subsidiary of the other; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no person is a director of both of them; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: both of them give an undertaking to the Authority by deed, or by a document of like effect acceptable to the Authority, to act independently of each other in their dealings with the scheme. (1 of 2008 s. 6)

section.name: s47
section.heading: Investment management contract

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that there is in force between the trustee and the investment manager appointed in respect of the scheme an investment management contract that specifies the obligations of that manager with respect to the investment of funds of the scheme.
The contract must comply with Schedule 2.

subsection.leadIn: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must not appoint an investment manager in respect of the scheme unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the trustee has given an undertaking by deed, or by a document of like effect, to notify in writing the manager of any matters that the trustee regards as pertinent to the manager’s appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manager has given an undertaking by deed, or by a document of like effect, to notify in writing the trustee of any changes to matters referred to in paragraph (a) within 30 days after those changes have occurred. (1 of 2008 s. 7)

subsection.content: Despite anything in the governing rules of the scheme, any provision of an investment management contract relating to the scheme that purports to exempt the investment manager from liability for negligence or fraud, or to limit that liability, is void.

An investment management contract may permit the investment manager to engage an associate of that manager or an associate of the approved trustee as an agent for the purpose of acquiring or disposing of securities for or in relation to the scheme, but, if it does so, the contract must provide that no more than half of the total value of the commissions or other agency rewards paid for those transactions is to be paid to the associate, or the associate together with other associates of that manager or associates of the approved trustee, during a financial period of the scheme. (L.N. 223 of 2000)

section.name: s48
section.heading: Approved trustee to ensure compliance with prescribed capital adequacy requirements
section.content: A company must ensure that the prescribed capital adequacy requirements are complied with at all times while it is an approved trustee.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Duties of approved trustee with respect to investment of scheme funds

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that any investment manager appointed in respect of the scheme, and any delegate of that manager, act in the interests of the scheme members and do not collude with other persons as regards any transaction relating to the investment of the funds for the scheme.

The trustee must ensure that, if a transaction involving the acquisition of an asset for or in relation to the scheme is entered into between relevant persons, the consideration to be paid for the asset is not greater than the prevailing market price.

The trustee must ensure that, if a transaction involving the disposal or lending of an asset for or in relation to the scheme is entered into between relevant persons, the consideration to be paid for the asset is not less than the prevailing market price.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (2) and (3), the following persons are relevant persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the approved trustee and any service provider appointed or engaged for the purposes of the scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the participating employers of scheme members;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all associates of any of those participating employers, of any scheme member, or of any service provider appointed or engaged for the purposes of the scheme.

subsection.content: The trustee must also ensure that service providers appointed or engaged for the purposes of the scheme and their associates do not retain any payment or benefit from a third party, either directly or indirectly, derived from the acquisition or disposal or lending of scheme assets.
Subsection (5) does not prevent the third party from providing the service providers and their associates with goods or services that are of demonstrable benefit to the scheme or scheme members.

subsection.leadIn: The trustee must also ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any investment manager appointed for the purposes of the scheme, and any delegate of that manager, do not acquire or dispose of securities for those purposes at brokerage rates that exceed the customary institutional full-service brokerage rates generally applicable to the acquisition and disposal of securities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the acquisition or disposal of securities for those purposes is effected in accordance with the best commercial practice applicable to the preparation and execution of financial transactions.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Approved trustee to appoint custodian of scheme assets

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the approved trustee of a registered scheme must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: appoint an eligible person to be the custodian of the scheme assets; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure that the scheme assets are kept by, or are under the control of, such a person.

subsection.content: The trustee is not required to comply with subsection (1) if the trustee is an eligible person. In that case, the trustee may undertake the functions of custodian of the scheme assets itself.

If the trustee appoints a custodian in respect of the scheme, it must enter into a custodial agreement with the custodian setting out the functions of the custodian with respect to the scheme’s assets. The agreement must comply with the requirements with respect to custodial agreements in Part 6.
For the purposes of this section, a person is an eligible person if the person satisfies the eligibility requirements for a custodian of scheme assets specified in Part 6.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Restrictions on entering into repurchase agreements

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that the funds of the scheme are not applied for the purpose of entering into a repurchase agreement unless the agreement is entered into by the custodian of the scheme assets.

If the authority to enter into repurchase agreements in respect of a registered scheme is to be delegated to a custodian appointed in respect of the scheme, that authority must be included in the custodial agreement entered into with the custodian in accordance with section 50.

subsection.leadIn: The trustee must ensure that, in relation to each constituent fund of the scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a repurchase agreement relating to assets of the fund is entered into only if the amount of the consideration (including the value of any collateral security) given for the relevant security exceeds the value of the security; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no more than 10 per cent of the assets of the fund are the subject of repurchase agreements at any one time; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no more than 50 per cent of the securities of the same issue held among the assets of the fund are the subject of repurchase agreements at any one time.

subsection.content: The trustee must ensure that the scheme assets are not the subject of a reverse repurchase agreement.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a repurchase agreement, in relation to the approved trustee of a registered scheme, is an agreement under which the trustee agrees to sell a debt security to a person and to repurchase it from that person at a specified date in the future for an agreed price, subject to the amount of consideration (including the value of any collateral security) provided by that person during the period of the agreement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reverse repurchase agreement, in relation to the approved trustee of a registered scheme, is an agreement under which the trustee agrees to buy a debt security from a person and to resell it to that person at a specified date in the future for an agreed price.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Restrictions on lending of scheme securities

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that no securities held in respect of the scheme are lent (whether with or without consideration) except in accordance with an agreement entered into by the custodian of the scheme assets and the borrower of the securities.

If the authority to enter into security lending agreements in respect of a registered scheme is to be delegated to a custodian appointed in respect of the scheme, that authority must be included in the custodial agreement entered into with the custodian in accordance with section 50.

subsection.leadIn: The trustee must ensure that, in relation to each constituent fund of the scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a security lending agreement relating to securities held in respect of the fund is entered into only if the amount of the consideration (including the value of any collateral security) given for the securities exceeds the value of those securities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no more than 10 per cent of the assets of the fund are the subject of security lending agreements at any one time; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no more than 50 per cent of securities of the same issue, or of the same kind, held in respect of the fund are the subject of security lending agreements at any one time.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, a security lending agreement is an agreement under which one party to the agreement agrees to lend a security to another party to the agreement in consideration for the payment of a fee and a collateral security.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Duty of approved trustee with respect to investing in financial futures contracts and financial option contracts

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that the funds of the scheme are not applied for the acquisition of financial futures contracts or financial option contracts, unless there is established and maintained in respect of the scheme an effective system for monitoring the risks inherent in dealing in contracts of those kinds.

If financial futures contracts or financial option contracts are acquired for the purposes of the scheme and an investment manager has been appointed in respect of the scheme, the trustee must ensure that the investment manager, and, where the investment manager has delegated any of that manager’s functions, the delegate, provide written reports to the trustee at regular intervals with respect to the performance of those contracts. Those reports must include particulars as to the extent to which the funds of the scheme are exposed to the risk of incurring losses because of the holding of those contracts.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Approved trustee to provide information to scheme members

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that, within 60 days after a person becomes a scheme member, the person is provided with a document containing information relating to the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: The document must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: include a general description of the scheme, including its terms and the fees and charges payable under the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the scheme comprises 2 or more constituent funds, specify particulars of those funds; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the person (if any) designated by the trustee as the scheme contact person, either by name or by reference to the person’s position or job description, and the means by which the person can be contacted.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Approved trustee to provide scheme members with annual benefit statements

subsection.leadIn: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that— (40 of 2021 s. 54)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 3 months after each financial period of the scheme, each scheme member is provided with a benefit statement setting out the member’s position with respect to the scheme as at the end of that period, whether or not the auditing of the financial statements of the scheme for that period has been completed then; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there are any subsequent audit adjustments made to a benefit statement affecting the member’s balance, the member is notified in writing within 30 days after the trustee becomes aware of those audit adjustments.

subsection.content: If a financial period of a registered scheme is extended to more than 12 months, the approved trustee of the scheme must also ensure that within 3 months after the end of the first 12 months of the financial period, each scheme member is provided with a benefit statement setting out the member’s position with respect to the scheme as at the end of that first 12-month period (first 12-month period).

subsection.leadIn: A scheme member’s benefit statement must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify the name of the member, the name of the scheme and the name of the approved trustee of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the total contributions that have been paid to the scheme in respect of the member during the prescribed period and specify, in so far as it is within the knowledge of the trustee, any contribution periods for which contributions that were required to be paid in respect of the member have not been paid; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the value of accrued benefits of the member as at the beginning of the prescribed period and also the value of accrued benefits of the member as at the end of that period; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the member is a self-employed person, specify the total contributions paid to the trustee by the scheme member during the prescribed period; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the member is not a self-employed person, specify the total contributions paid to the trustee by the member’s employer during the prescribed period; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: give particulars of amounts transferred to or from the scheme during the prescribed period; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: give an estimate of the return on the member’s investments in each account in the scheme over the prescribed period; and (40 of 2021 s. 54)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: give an estimate of the cumulative return on the member’s investments in each account in the scheme over the period that begins on the account opening date and ends on the last day of the prescribed period (entire period); and (40 of 2021 s. 54)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: give an estimate of the annualized return on the member’s investments in each account in the scheme over the entire period; and (40 of 2021 s. 54)

paragraph.name: fa
paragraph.content: contain the information specified by the Authority; and (1 of 2008 s. 50)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (4), be printed in both the Chinese language and the English language; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: be prepared on an accrual basis, except that contributions and items relating to contributions not yet received by the approved trustee of the scheme may be included on a cash basis.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: Without affecting subsection (3), a benefit statement required to be provided under subsection (1)(a) to a member of a registered scheme for a financial period of the scheme must also—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify the applicable FER for the relevant corresponding period of each relevant fund in which the member invested at any time during the financial period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give an estimate of the fees charged in respect of each account in the scheme during the financial period, including an estimate of the fee charged under each type of fee specified by the Authority. (40 of 2021 s. 54)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: An estimate required to be given under subsection (3)(faa) or (faab) or (3AA)(b) is to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determined in the manner specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expressed both in Hong Kong dollars and as a percentage. (40 of 2021 s. 54)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: An estimate required to be given under subsection (3)(faac) is to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determined in the manner specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expressed as a percentage. (40 of 2021 s. 54)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(b), (c) and (f), the benefit statement of a scheme member with a TVC account must provide separate information with respect to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the tax deductible voluntary contributions paid by the member into the account; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: all accrued benefits—

subparagraph.content: derived from those contributions; and
transferred to the account in accordance with Part 12. (7 of 2019 s. 18)

subsection.content: The name of the member may be printed on the benefit statement in either the Chinese language or the English language, unless the member, by written notice, requires the trustee to print that name in both of those languages.

subsection.leadIn: If voluntary contributions to a registered scheme are paid by or in respect of a scheme member, subsection (3) is not complied with unless, in relation to the matters referred to in paragraphs (b), (c), (d), (e), (f) and (fa) of that subsection, the statement provides separate information with respect to— (1 of 2008 s. 50; 40 of 2021 s. 54)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the mandatory contributions paid by or in respect of the member, and the accrued benefits derived from those mandatory contributions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the voluntary contributions paid by or in respect of the member, and the accrued benefits derived from those voluntary contributions.

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme is not required to comply with subsection (1) or (2) in relation to a person who has ceased to be a scheme member during the period specified in subsection (8) and whose accrued benefits have been transferred to another registered scheme in accordance with Part 12 of this Regulation or have been paid in accordance with section 15 of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The period specified for subsection (7) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the compliance with subsection (1)—the period of 3 months after a financial period of the registered scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the compliance with subsection (2)—the period of 3 months after the end of the first 12 months of a financial period of the registered scheme. (40 of 2021 s. 54)

subsection.content: Subsection (3)(faa), (faab) and (faac) only applies to a benefit statement that sets out a scheme member’s position as at the end of a financial period, or the first 12 months of a financial period, of the registered scheme that begins on or after the commencement of section 19S of the Ordinance. (40 of 2021 s. 54)

Subsection (3AA) only applies to a benefit statement that sets out a scheme member’s position as at the end of a financial period of the registered scheme that begins on or after the commencement mentioned in subsection (9). (40 of 2021 s. 54)

subsection.leadIn: For a scheme member’s benefit statement that relates to a financial period mentioned in subsection (10)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (3AA)(a) does not apply to a relevant fund in which the member invested at any time during the financial period if the relevant corresponding period of the relevant fund begins on the inception date of that fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any fees incurred in the investment of the member in a relevant fund to which paragraph (a) applies are not to be taken into account when determining an estimate under subsection (3AA)(b) for the benefit statement. (40 of 2021 s. 54)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: applicable FER (適用FER), in relation to a relevant corresponding period of a relevant fund in which a member of a registered scheme has invested, means—(a)the audited fund expense ratio submitted to the Authority under section 19Y of the Ordinance (audited FER) for the relevant corresponding period of the relevant fund; or(b)(if at the time of preparing the benefit statement, the audited FER for the relevant corresponding period of the relevant fund is not available) the most recently available fund expense ratio determined by the approved trustee of the scheme in accordance with Schedule 13 to the Ordinance for the relevant corresponding period;
corresponding period (相應期間) has the meaning given by section 19T(1) of the Ordinance;
fees (費用) include charges;
inception date (成立日) has the meaning given by section 19T(1) of the Ordinance;

relevant corresponding period (相關相應期間), in relation to a relevant fund in which a member of a registered scheme has invested, means the corresponding period, or the part of the corresponding period, of the relevant fund that coincides with a financial period of the scheme;
relevant fund (相關基金), in relation to a member of a registered scheme, means a constituent fund of the scheme in which the member has invested. (40 of 2021 s. 54)

section.name: s57
section.heading: Approved trustee to assist participating employers and scheme members

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must, as far as reasonably practicable, provide all assistance necessary to ensure that scheme members and participating employers are able to participate effectively in the operation of the scheme.

For the purposes of subsection (1), the trustee may designate a person as a scheme contact person, either by name or by reference to the person’s position or job description, and specify the means by which the person can be contacted.

subsection.leadIn: The assistance referred to in subsection (1) means assistance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in answering inquires in respect of the scheme, including those relating to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the total amount of the contributions received by the trustee in respect of a scheme member and the dates on which those contributions were received or the date on which a contribution was last received; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any information contained in any document that the trustee has given to scheme members or participating employers; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in dealing with complaints from scheme members or participating employers.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Approved trustee to inform scheme members etc. of changes of business particulars

subsection.content: As soon as practicable and in any case not later than 7 days after a change occurs to the business name, address, telephone number or facsimile number of the approved trustee of a registered scheme, the trustee must, by written notice, inform the scheme members and participating employers of the change.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Approved trustee to ensure presence of independent trustee at meetings
section.leadIn: The approved trustee of an employer sponsored scheme must ensure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the independent trustee of the scheme is, as far as reasonably practicable, present at all meetings of the trustees; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that any decision taken at a meeting of the trustees at which the independent trustee is absent does not have effect until it is acknowledged in writing by that trustee.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Disclosure of conflicts of interests

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after a natural person who is an approved trustee of a registered scheme becomes aware of any matter that gives rise or is likely to give rise—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a conflict of interest between the person’s duties as a trustee of the scheme and either the person’s other duties as a trustee or the person’s personal interests; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is an independent trustee, to the suspension or revocation by the Authority of the person’s approval as a trustee,

subsection.continued: the person must disclose the matter by giving written notice of the matter to each of the other persons who are approved trustees of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after a person who is an officer of a company that is an approved trustee of a registered scheme becomes aware of any matter that gives rise or is likely to give rise—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a conflict of interest between the person’s duties in relation to the scheme as an officer of the company and either the person’s other duties as an officer of the company or the person’s personal interests; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the officer is an independent director, to the suspension or revocation by the Authority of the company’s approval as a trustee,

subsection.continued: the person must disclose the matter by giving written notice of the matter to the company and to each of the other officers of the company and, if the trustee includes natural person, to each of those persons.

subsection.leadIn: An approved trustee to or in relation to which a disclosure is made under this section must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: record the disclosure in a record kept for the purpose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure that the record is kept available at all reasonable hours for inspection by the Authority or any scheme member on request.

subsection.content: A failure to comply with this section does not invalidate any decision of the approved trustee concerned.
This section does not apply to or in respect of an interest of a person in a matter or thing which arises merely because the person is a contributor to a provident fund scheme.

subsection.leadIn: If a person has disclosed the nature of a conflict of interest concerning a matter in accordance with subsection (1), the person must not, unless the other trustees agree—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be present during any deliberation of those persons or the company with respect to the matter; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take part in any decision of the approved trustee with respect to the matter.

subsection.leadIn: If an officer of a company has disclosed the nature of a conflict of interest concerning a matter in accordance with subsection (2), the officer must not, unless the directors of the company agree—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be present during any deliberation of the company with respect to the matter; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take part in any decision of the company with respect to the matter.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a person has a personal interest in a matter if, because of the matter or circumstances relating to the matter—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person has obtained or is able to obtain, whether directly or indirectly, a pecuniary or other advantage; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person has conferred or is able to confer a benefit on—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a relative or friend; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body of which the person is a member or with which the person has a close connection; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any other person to whom the person is under an obligation, whether legal or moral.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Approved trustee to notify Authority of events of significant nature

subsection.leadIn: If the approved trustee of a registered scheme becomes aware of the occurrence of an event of significant nature, the trustee must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not later than the third specified working day after becoming aware of the event, give written notice to the Authority setting out particulars of the event (except an event specified in the guidelines as an event to which this paragraph shall not apply); (9 of 2016 s. 19)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: keep a record of particulars of the event;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.leadIn: give written notice to the Authority—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: setting out such further or better particulars of the event as the Authority requires; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as soon as is practicable after the Authority makes that requirement. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: The reference in subsection (1) to an event of significant nature includes (but is not limited to) the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any event that causes the approved trustee to contravene the Ordinance, the governing rules of the scheme or a condition to which the approval of the approved trustee as such is subject; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any material change to the approved trustee’s capacity or ability to act as an approved trustee, including—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
iii
subparagraph.content: if the approved trustee is or includes a natural person, any of the matters specified in subsection (4); and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the cancellation, expiry or other termination of the insurance in respect of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b)(ii), the matters to be specified are—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the discontinuation of continuous financial support provided to the approved trustee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any change or proposed change of any controller of the approved trustee; (14 of 2025 s. 236)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any change or proposed change in the approved trustee’s domicile. (14 of 2025 s. 236)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b)(iii), the matters to be specified are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the death or incapacity of the person or circumstances affecting the ability to carry out the person’s duties;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the cancellation, expiry or other termination of the performance guarantee in respect of the person.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Amendments to governing rules of registered scheme not to take effect without Authority’s approval

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2A), an approved trustee of a registered scheme must notify the Authority in writing of any amendment proposed to be made to the governing rules of the scheme and lodge with the Authority a copy of the proposed amendment.
Subject to subsection (2A), an amendment to the governing rules of the scheme does not take effect until the Authority has given written notice to the trustee that the Authority has approved it.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: In respect of an amendment proposed to be made or made to the governing rules in respect of or by a participation agreement of a registered scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), subsections (1) and (2) shall not apply unless the amendment relates to mandatory contributions or voluntary contributions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsections (1) and (2) shall not apply if the amendment is in a form approved by the Authority for the purposes of this section. (2 of 2002 s. 21)

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to an amendment to the governing rules of a registered scheme includes a reference to addition of new provisions, or substitution or omission of existing provisions, of those rules.

section.name: s63A
section.heading: Amendments to offering documents require Authority’s approval

subsection.content: An approved trustee of a registered scheme must notify the Authority in writing of any amendment proposed to be made to the offering document of the scheme and lodge with the Authority a copy of the proposed amendment.

Any amendment to the offering document of the scheme shall not be made available to scheme members, prospective scheme members, participating employers or prospective participating employers until the Authority has given written notice to the trustee that the Authority has approved it.

In this section, a reference to an amendment to the offering document of a registered scheme includes a reference to addition of new provisions, or substitution or omission of existing provisions, of the document.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Approved trustee to ensure separation of scheme assets

subsection.leadIn: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that the scheme assets—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are administered and dealt with as trust property by service providers appointed or engaged by the trustee for the purposes of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are held, recorded or otherwise controlled in accordance with the market practices that are currently prevailing in the place where the scheme assets are held, recorded or otherwise controlled, and in such manner as is prudent in the circumstances; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: are applied only for the purposes of the scheme.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) has effect irrespective of whether or not the trustee has appointed a custodian or other service provider to perform functions with respect to the scheme assets.

subsection.leadIn: The trustee must also ensure that the scheme assets are separately recorded in the records required to be kept in respect of the scheme and, in particular, are distinguished—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from the trustee’s personal assets; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: from any assets held by the trustee for the benefit of a participating employer or any other person.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Approved trustee to ensure that scheme assets are not improperly encumbered

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that the scheme assets are not subject to any encumbrance, other than an encumbrance to which this subsection does not apply.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to an encumbrance that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is created for the purpose of securing an amount borrowed to enable accrued benefits to be paid to or in respect of scheme members, and then only if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amount borrowed (together with any other borrowings made for the same purpose) does not exceed 10 per cent of the market value of the scheme assets at the time of the borrowing; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the borrowing is not part of a series of borrowings; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: at the time the borrowing was made, it was unlikely that the period of the borrowing would exceed 90 days; or (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is created for the purpose of securing an amount borrowed to settle a transaction relating to the acquisition of scheme assets, and then only if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amount borrowed (together with any other borrowings made for the same purpose) does not exceed 10 per cent of the market value of the scheme assets at the time of the borrowing; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the borrowing is not part of a series of borrowings; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: at the time the borrowing was made, it was unlikely that the period of the borrowing would exceed 7 working days; and (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: at the time the decision to enter into the transaction was made, it was unlikely that the borrowing would be necessary; or (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is created for the purpose of securing a claim for payment of fees for the safe custody or administration of the scheme assets by a central securities depository or a delegate of a custodian; or (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000; 1 of 2008 s. 11)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is created for the purpose of acquiring a financial futures contract pursuant to section 14 of Schedule 1 or a currency forward contract pursuant to section 15 of Schedule 1; or (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is created by the operation of law in Hong Kong or in a place outside Hong Kong. (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000)

subsection.content: Any encumbrance created over scheme assets of a registered scheme is void to the extent that it is inconsistent with subsection (2).

For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that any encumbrance created over the scheme assets of a registered scheme that is, at the time of creation, consistent with the exception under subsection (2) shall remain valid throughout the period for which the borrowing concerned remains outstanding. (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000)

section.name: s66
section.heading: Approved trustee permitted to deduct from scheme members’ accounts amount in respect of administrative expenses

subsection.content: Subject to this Regulation and section 34DD of the Ordinance, the approved trustee of a registered scheme may periodically deduct from each scheme member’s account with the scheme fees for administrative expenses. (9 of 2016 s. 20; 40 of 2021 s. 58)
Subsection (1) applies subject to sections 19U and 19Z of the Ordinance. (40 of 2021 s. 58)

section.name: s66A
section.heading: Interest to be received where a scheme’s assets are placed on deposit
section.leadIn: Where a scheme’s assets are placed on deposit, then the approved trustee must ensure that the rate of interest received for the deposit is reasonable in all the circumstances of the case taking into account the rate of interest available in the relevant market—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time of the deposit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for deposits of like amount and nature.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Offences
section.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement or duty imposed on that person by section 43, 44, 45, 46, 47, 49, 50, 51, 52, 53(1), 64 or 65 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s67A
section.heading: Transitional provisions for Part 5—Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Amendment) Ordinance 2015

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a relevant employee of a participating employer becomes a member of a registered scheme before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on the commencement date—

subparagraph.content: the period of 60 days after the employee becomes such a member has yet to expire; and
the employee has not been given a membership certificate under section 55 of the pre-amended Regulation.

subsection.content: The employee must be given a notice of participation that complies with section 31(4A) within the 60-day period.
Subsection (2) does not apply in relation to a casual employee who is a member of an industry scheme.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which section 28 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Amendment) Ordinance 2015 (1 of 2015) comes into operation;
pre-amended Regulation (《未修訂規例》) means this Regulation as in force immediately before the commencement date.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Eligibility for appointment as custodian

subsection.leadIn: A person is eligible to be a custodian of scheme assets only if the person is one of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized financial institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a registered trust company that has a paid up share capital of not less than $150,000,000 and net assets of not less than the same amount; (14 of 2025 s. 237)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a registered trust company that complies with subsection (2). (14 of 2025 s. 237)

subsection.leadIn: A registered trust company complies with this subsection if it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has a paid up share capital of not less than $50,000,000 and net assets of not less than the same amount; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is an associate of either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a company or corporation that complies with subsection (3) and provides continuous financial support to the registered trust company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a company or corporation having a subsidiary that complies with subsection (3) and provides continuous financial support to the registered trust company. (L.N. 223 of 2000)

subsection.leadIn: A company or corporation complies with this subsection if it is— (L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized financial institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a registered trust company that has a paid up share capital of not less than $150,000,000 and net assets of not less than the same amount; or (14 of 2025 s. 237)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an authorized insurer that has a paid up share capital of not less than $150,000,000 and net assets of not less than the same amount; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an approved overseas bank, an approved overseas insurer or an approved overseas trust company that complies with subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: An approved overseas bank, an approved overseas insurer or an approved overseas trust company complies with this subsection if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it has a paid up capital of at least US$200,000,000 or an amount in another foreign currency equivalent to that amount; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it satisfies a minimum credit rating set by the Authority, based on the credit rating as determined by an approved credit rating agency.

subsection.leadIn: A company or corporation or a subsidiary of a company or corporation provides continuous financial support to a registered trust company for the purposes of subsection (2)(b)(i) and (ii) if it gives an undertaking to the Authority by deed, or by a document of like effect acceptable to the Authority, that it— (L.N. 223 of 2000; 1 of 2008 s. 8)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: will, if so required by the Authority, subscribe sufficient additional capital of not more than $50,000,000 when the paid up share capital or net assets of the trust company become less than that amount; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: will not, without the approval of the Authority, do any act to dispose of, or authorize the disposal or issue of, any part of the share capital or assets of the trust company as a result of which the trust company ceases to be its associate. (L.N. 223 of 2000)

subsection.content: A person is not eligible to be a custodian of scheme assets unless the person has a sufficient presence and control in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: A person has a sufficient presence and control in Hong Kong if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person complies with subsection (9); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has sufficient expertise and management resources in Hong Kong to conduct its business operations effectively; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Hong Kong chief executive officer of the person ordinarily resides in Hong Kong. (32 of 2000 s. 48)

subsection.leadIn: A person complies with this subsection if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s day-to-day business activities relating to the person’s business in Hong Kong (including the keeping of its records relating to those activities) are conducted wholly in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case where those activities are not conducted wholly in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: they are conducted under the person’s supervision and control in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: sufficient records of those activities are kept at a place or places so that those records can be readily accessible in Hong Kong to enable an audit of them to be carried out.

subsection.content: A person is not eligible to be a custodian of scheme assets unless the person and all delegates of the person are independent of each investment manager appointed in respect of the scheme and of all delegates of the investment manager.

Nothing in this section requires the approved trustee of a registered scheme to appoint a person to be a custodian of the scheme assets if the trustee satisfies the eligibility requirements of this section.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Custodial agreement

subsection.content: If the approved trustee of a registered scheme appoints a custodian to administer the scheme assets, the trustee must ensure that the contract for the appointment of the custodian incorporates a custodial agreement that complies with Schedule 3.

If the approved trustee of a registered scheme does not appoint a custodian to administer the scheme assets, the trustee must give an undertaking to the Authority by deed, or by a document of like effect acceptable to the Authority. The undertaking must incorporate the terms of a custodial agreement that complies with Schedule 3. (1 of 2008 s. 9)

If the approved trustee of a registered scheme has appointed a custodian of the scheme assets, that trustee must take all reasonable steps to ensure that the custodian complies with the terms of the relevant custodial agreement.
An approved trustee who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with this section commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Temporary custodian

subsection.leadIn: The approved trustee of a registered scheme may act as a temporary custodian of scheme assets even though the trustee would not, apart from this section, be eligible to be a custodian of scheme assets, or has appointed an eligible person to be a custodian of the scheme assets, but only for the sole purpose of temporarily keeping—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contributions and other payments received for the purposes of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: payments required or permitted to be made from the funds of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: When acting as a temporary custodian of scheme assets, an approved trustee must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: comply with the requirements set out in subsection (4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after receiving contributions and other amounts from an employer or any other person for the purposes of the scheme, pay them to the custodian; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after receiving the payments from a custodian of the scheme assets for the purpose of paying accrued benefits or other amounts of money, pay them to the persons entitled to receive them.

subsection.content: In so acting, the trustee must apply the same care, skill, diligence and prudence as may be reasonably expected of a prudent person who has custody of scheme assets.

subsection.leadIn: The requirements referred to in subsection (2)(a) are as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the scheme assets must be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: administered and dealt with as trust property; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: records of the scheme assets must be kept separate from all other assets of the trustee, including any assets held by the trustee for the benefit of a participating employer or any other person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the scheme assets must not be subject to an encumbrance, except in any of the circumstances set out in subsection (5); (1 of 2008 s. 12)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the scheme assets must be applied only for the purpose of the registered scheme.

subsection.leadIn: The circumstances referred to in subsection (4)(c) are as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where the encumbrance is created for the purpose of securing an amount borrowed to enable accrued benefits to be paid to or in respect of scheme members, but only if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amount borrowed (together with any other borrowings made for the same purpose) does not exceed 10 per cent of the market value of the scheme assets at the time of the borrowing; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the borrowing is not part of a series of borrowings; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: at the time the borrowing was made, it was unlikely that the period of borrowing would exceed 90 days;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the encumbrance is created for the purpose of securing an amount borrowed to settle a transaction relating to the acquisition of scheme assets, but only if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amount borrowed (together with any other borrowings made for the same purpose) does not exceed 10 per cent of the market value of the scheme assets at the time of the borrowing; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the borrowing is not part of a series of borrowings; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: at the time the borrowing was made, it was unlikely that the period of borrowing would exceed 7 working days; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: at the time the decision to enter into the transaction was made, it was unlikely that the borrowing would be necessary;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the encumbrance is created for the purpose of securing a claim for payment of fees for the safe custody or administration of the scheme assets by a central securities depository or a delegate of a custodian;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where the encumbrance is created for the purpose of acquiring a financial futures contract pursuant to section 14 of Schedule 1 or a currency forward contract pursuant to section 15 of Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: where the encumbrance is created by operation of law (whether the law of Hong Kong or of a place outside Hong Kong). (1 of 2008 s. 12)

subsection.content: An encumbrance created over scheme assets is void to the extent to which it is inconsistent with this section.
An approved trustee who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Eligibility of delegate of custodian

subsection.leadIn: A person is not eligible to be a delegate of a custodian of scheme assets unless the person— (2 of 2002 s. 21)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: would be eligible to be a custodian of scheme assets;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is an approved overseas bank or approved overseas trust company which complies with section 68(4); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is an overseas bank or overseas trust company that is a subsidiary or related company of an entity described in subsection (1A). (1 of 2008 s. 53)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The entity referred to in subsection (1)(c) is an approved overseas bank, an approved overseas trust company, an authorized financial institution or a registered trust company, that— (14 of 2025 s. 238)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has a paid up capital of not less than US$200,000,000 or an equivalent amount in another currency; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: satisfies a minimum credit rating set by the Authority based on a credit rating determined by an approved credit rating agency. (1 of 2008 s. 53)

subsection.leadIn: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the custodian of scheme assets is appointed under section 50(1), the contract for the appointment prohibits the custodian from delegating the custodian’s function as a custodian to a person who is not eligible under subsection (1) to be a delegate of the custodian;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the trustee is the custodian of the scheme assets in accordance with section 50(2), the trustee does not delegate the trustee’s function as a custodian to a person who is not eligible under subsection (1) to be a delegate of the custodian. (2 of 2002 s. 21)

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement imposed on the trustee by subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5. (2 of 2002 s. 21)
For the purposes of subsection (1)(c), a company is a related company of another company if both are subsidiaries of a third company. (1 of 2008 s. 53)

section.name: s72
section.heading: Subcustodial agreement

subsection.content: Any agreement entered into between a custodian of scheme assets and another person providing for any of the custodian’s functions to be delegated to that other person must include the same requirements as those specified in Schedule 3. For the purpose of applying Schedule 3 to the agreement, references to the trustee are to be construed as references to the custodian and references to the custodian are to be construed as references to the delegate. (2 of 2002 s. 21)

subsection.leadIn: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the custodian of scheme assets is appointed under section 50(1), the contract for the appointment prohibits the custodian from entering into an agreement with a person providing for any of the custodian’s functions to be delegated to that person unless the agreement complies with subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the trustee is the custodian of the scheme assets in accordance with section 50(2), the trustee does not enter into an agreement with a person providing for any of the custodian’s functions to be delegated to that person unless the agreement complies with subsection (1). (2 of 2002 s. 21)

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement imposed on the trustee by subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5. (2 of 2002 s. 21)

section.name: s73
section.heading: Use of central securities depository

subsection.content: An agreement entered into between the approved trustee of a registered scheme and a custodian of scheme assets or between the custodian and a delegate of the custodian may provide for scheme assets to be held in a central securities depository.
A central securities depository is not to be regarded as a custodian carrying on business in Hong Kong or its delegates for the purpose of this section.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Provisions Applicable to Service Providers Generally

section.name: s74
section.heading: Approved trustee to review service providers’ reports

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must require each service provider appointed or engaged by the trustee to submit to the trustee such reports as will enable the trustee to perform the trustee’s duties under the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The reports that the trustee must require include (but are not limited to)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a report of any material event ; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an annual report that complies with subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: An event is a material event for the purposes of subsection (2)(a) if it involves—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a material change, or a proposal for a material change, relating to the eligibility of the service provider; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a material breach of the obligations of the service provider.

subsection.leadIn: The trustee must require a service provider to submit a report of a material event—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after the event occurs; or

paragraph.name: b
