paragraph.content: if it involves a proposal for a material change relating to the eligibility of the service provider, as soon as practicable after the service provider becomes aware of the event.

subsection.leadIn: An annual report complies with this subsection if it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contains a copy of the audited profit and loss account and of the balance sheet for the financial year of the service provider that ends on or before the relevant financial period of the scheme, together with a copy of the auditor’s report on those documents and the directors’ report for that year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is accompanied by a report by the auditor of the service provider stating whether or not, in the auditor’s normal course of duties, the auditor had become aware of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any failure of the service provider to comply with the service provider’s obligations under the contract of appointment or engagement entered into between the trustee and the service provider; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any false declaration made by the service provider to the trustee or any other person,

paragraph.continued: and if so, give particulars of the failure or false declaration.

subsection.content: The trustee must require a service provider to submit an annual report at least 2 months before the deadline after each financial period relating to the scheme.
The trustee must carefully review the reports submitted to the trustee by the service provider.

If the trustee doubts the truth or accuracy of a report submitted by a service provider in accordance with a requirement made under this section, the trustee must make such inquiries as may be necessary to ascertain whether or not the service provider has properly performed the obligations that it owes to the trustee.

subsection.leadIn: If, after inquiry, the trustee is not satisfied that the service provider has performed the obligations owed to the trustee, the trustee must either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: terminate the appointment or engagement of the service provider; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take such steps as are necessary to ensure that the failure of the service provider to perform those obligations is rectified (in so far as it can be rectified) and, as far as practicable, does not recur.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Service suppliers to report certain matters to Authority

subsection.leadIn: If, in the course of performing its obligations relating to a registered scheme, a service supplier— (40 of 2021 s. 59)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.leadIn: becomes aware that the approved trustee of the scheme is not complying with any of the following provisions of the Ordinance—

subparagraph.content: section 27(2A);
section 34DB(1)(a), (b), (c) or (d);
section 34DD(1) or (4);
section 34DH(1) or (2);
section 34DI(1) or (2);
section 34DK(2);
section 34DM; or (9 of 2016 s. 21)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: becomes aware that the approved trustee of the scheme is not complying with section 77 or 78; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: identifies any transaction that, in the service supplier’s opinion, is or has resulted in a misappropriation of the funds of the scheme or the scheme assets; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: (if the service supplier is a service provider) identifies any payment from the funds of the scheme that, in the service supplier’s opinion, is materially prejudicial to the interests of scheme members or is in contravention of section 14 or 15 of the Ordinance or of a regulation made for the purposes of either of those sections; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: except in the circumstances specified in subsection (3), becomes aware that the scheme assets are or have been mixed with the funds of the trustee (otherwise than in accordance with the Ordinance) or the assets of any other person; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: (if the service supplier is a service provider) identifies any matter that causes the service supplier to form an opinion that the requirements specified in the guidelines (if any) made by the Authority under section 28 of the Ordinance with respect to forbidden investment practices and the requirements of sections 37(2), 51 and 52 and Part 10 of, and Schedule 1 to, this Regulation have not been complied with in all material respects,

subsection.continued: except as permitted by subsection (4), it is the duty of the service supplier to report the matter immediately to the Authority by written notice.

subsection.content: A service provider is not required to comply with subsection (1) with respect to a payment referred to in paragraph (c) of that subsection if the trustee has fully reimbursed the scheme as soon as practicable after the payment was brought to the trustee’s notice.

subsection.leadIn: The circumstances referred to in subsection (1)(d) arise when a custodian of the scheme assets—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is also the holder of assets of one or more other registered schemes or other financial schemes or undertakings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: mixes scheme assets with those other assets; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: keeps a separate account of the scheme assets and those other assets in such a way as to enable them to be separately identified.

subsection.leadIn: Before reporting a matter to the Authority in accordance with subsection (1), the service supplier may, by written notice given to the trustee— (40 of 2021 s. 59)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: bring the matter to the trustee’s attention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: request the trustee to provide the service supplier with an explanation of the matter and the related circumstances; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require the trustee to rectify the matter within such period as the service supplier considers to be reasonable.

subsection.continued: The service supplier is not required to report the matter to the Authority if the trustee complies with the request and requirement in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The service supplier must not give a notice under subsection (4)— (40 of 2021 s. 59)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the matter concerned relates to a transaction that, in the service supplier’s opinion is or has resulted in a material misappropriation of the funds of the scheme or the scheme assets; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if bringing the matter to the attention of the trustee could reasonably be expected to affect the interests of scheme members detrimentally.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ServiceSupplier
def.leadIn: service supplier (服務供應者), in relation to a registered scheme, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a service provider; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the system operator of an electronic MPF system. (40 of 2021 s. 59)

section.name: s76
section.heading: Power of Authority on becoming aware of matters reported under section 75

subsection.content: If, on receiving a report under section 75 or otherwise becoming aware of a matter referred to in that section, the Authority is of the opinion that the matter is capable of being rectified, the Authority may, by written notice given to the trustee concerned, direct the trustee to rectify the matter at the trustee’s own expense within such period as is specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: After giving a direction under subsection (1), the Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by written notice given to the auditor of the scheme, request the auditor, as soon as practicable after the end of the period specified in the notice and at the expense of the trustee, to provide the Authority with a report as to whether or not the trustee has rectified the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attach to that notice a copy of the notice given to the trustee containing the direction.

subsection.content: An approved trustee who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a direction given by the Authority under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Proper accounting records to be kept

subsection.leadIn: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: such accounting records are kept so as to correctly record and explain all transactions concerning the scheme and the financial position of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: those records are so kept that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: financial statements showing a true and fair view of the financial transactions of the scheme during each financial period and of the disposition of its assets and liabilities at the end of each financial period can be prepared from time to time; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: those financial statements can be conveniently and properly audited in accordance with this Regulation.

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that the accounting records of the scheme are kept in writing in either the Chinese language or the English language or, if not kept in either of those languages, in a form that is readily accessible and readily convertible to writing in either of those languages.

The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that the accounting records of the scheme are kept at a place or places so that those records can be readily accessible in Hong Kong for the purpose of enabling the Authority to discharge its duties from time to time.

The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that, at all reasonable times and without charge, the accounting records of the scheme are made available for inspection by the Authority, either in writing in the Chinese language or the English language or in a form readily convertible to writing in either of those languages.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Separate accounts for each scheme member

subsection.content: An approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that, as part of its accounting records, a separate account is established and maintained for each scheme member specifying the member’s accrued benefits.

subsection.leadIn: The trustee must ensure that a scheme member’s accrued benefits specified in the member’s account reflect the difference between—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the aggregate amount of all the items listed in subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: The items referred to in subsection (2)(a) are as follows—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: all contributions paid to the scheme by the member;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any amount transferred to the account in accordance with Part 12;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any investment income of the scheme that is attributable to the member’s accrued benefits;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: any other sums payable to the account under the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The items referred to in subsection (2)(b) are as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: accrued benefits that have been paid to or in respect of the member;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: any amounts transferred from the account in accordance with Part 12;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other amounts payable under the Ordinance from the account;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any amount by which the value of the scheme investments attributable to the member’s accrued benefits has depreciated.

subsection.content: The trustee must ensure that each member’s account is kept in such a manner that the market value of the accrued benefits of a member can be ascertained at least once each month.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of a scheme member who is a relevant employee of a participating employer, the trustee must arrange for the member’s contribution account to be divided into the following sub-accounts—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a sub-account specifying—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the contributions paid in respect of the member by the member’s current employer as mandatory contributions;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any contribution surcharges paid by the member’s employer on arrears if the relevant income of the employee is less than the minimum level of relevant income and there is not a sub-account as referred to in paragraph (b);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the member’s minimum MPF benefits (if any), to which section 5(1) of Schedule 2 to the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Exemption) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. B) applies, transferred to the scheme which are attributable to the current employer’s contributions;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the income or profits arising from any investments of the contributions, surcharges and benefits mentioned in any of subparagraphs (i), (ii) and (iii), but taking into account any losses in respect of the investments and any amounts paid in respect of the member; (2 of 2002 s. 21)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a sub-account specifying—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the member’s contributions paid by the member’s current employer on behalf of the member as mandatory contributions;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: any contribution surcharges paid by the member’s employer on arrears if—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the relevant income of the employee is not less than the minimum level of relevant income;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the contributions have been made under subparagraph (i) in respect of the member; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the minimum MPF benefits have been transferred under subparagraph (iii) in respect of the member;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the member’s minimum MPF benefits (if any), to which section 5(1) of Schedule 2 to the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Exemption) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. B) applies, transferred to the scheme which are attributable to the employee’s contributions of the current employment;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the income or profits arising from any investments of the contributions, surcharges and benefits mentioned in any of subparagraphs (i), (ii) and (iii), but taking into account any losses in respect of the investments and any amounts paid in respect of the member; (2 of 2002 s. 21)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a sub-account specifying—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: all mandatory contributions paid by or in respect of the member that are attributable to the member’s former employments or former self-employments and transferred to the member’s contribution account in accordance with Part 12, and any contribution surcharges paid in respect of any such mandatory contributions; (18 of 2008 s. 17)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the member’s minimum MPF benefits (if any), to which section 5(1) of Schedule 2 to the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Exemption) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. B) applies, transferred to the scheme which are attributable to his former employments;

subparagraph.name: iia
subparagraph.content: all mandatory contributions paid by or in respect of the member that are attributable to the member’s former employments or former self-employments, and any contribution surcharges paid in respect of any such mandatory contributions, other than mandatory contributions or contribution surcharges mentioned in subparagraph (i) or (ii); (18 of 2008 s. 17)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the income or profits arising from any investments of the contributions, surcharges and benefits mentioned in any of subparagraphs (i), (ii) and (iia), but taking into account any losses in respect of the investments and any amounts paid in respect of the member; (2 of 2002 s. 21)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the special contributions (if any) paid in respect of the member and the income or profits arising from any investments of those contributions, but taking into account any losses in respect of the investments and any amounts paid in respect of the member; (30 of 2008 s. 8)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a sub-account specifying—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the voluntary contributions (if any) paid in respect of the member by the member’s current employer;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount (other than minimum MPF benefits to which section 5(1) of Schedule 2 to the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Exemption) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. B) applies), if any, transferred to the scheme in respect of the member from an ORSO exempted scheme or an ORSO registered scheme which are attributable to the current employer’s contributions;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the income or profits arising from any investments of the contributions and amount mentioned in any of subparagraphs (i) and (ii), but taking into account any losses in respect of the investments and any amounts paid in respect of the member; (2 of 2002 s. 21)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: a sub-account specifying—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the voluntary contributions (if any) paid by the member while employed by the member’s current employer;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount (other than minimum MPF benefits to which section 5(1) of Schedule 2 to the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Exemption) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. B) applies), if any, transferred to the scheme in respect of the member from an ORSO exempted scheme or an ORSO registered scheme which are attributable to the employee’s contributions of the current employment;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the income or profits arising from any investments of the contributions and amount mentioned in any of subparagraphs (i) and (ii), but taking into account any losses in respect of the investments and any amounts paid in respect of the member; (2 of 2002 s. 21)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: a sub-account specifying—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: all voluntary contributions paid by or in respect of the member that are attributable to the member’s former employments or former self-employments and transferred to the member’s contribution account; (18 of 2008 s. 17)

subparagraph.name: ia
subparagraph.content: all voluntary contributions paid by or in respect of the member that are attributable to the member’s former employments or former self-employments, other than voluntary contributions mentioned in subparagraph (i); (18 of 2008 s. 17)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount (other than minimum MPF benefits to which section 5(1) of Schedule 2 to the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Exemption) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. B) applies), if any, transferred to the scheme in respect of the member from an ORSO exempted scheme or an ORSO registered scheme which are attributable to the member’s former employments;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the income or profits arising from any investments of the contributions and amount mentioned in any of subparagraphs (i), (ia) and (ii), but taking into account any losses in respect of the investments and any amounts paid in respect of the member. (2 of 2002 s. 21; 18 of 2008 s. 17; 1 of 2015 s. 30)

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.leadIn: Where section 12A(6A) and (6B) of the Ordinance is applicable in the case of an employer and an employee, then, for the purposes of that case—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any reference to “current employer” in subsection (6)(a), (b), (d) or (e) shall include the previous employer mentioned in section 12A(6A) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any reference to “current employment” in subsection (6)(b) or (e) shall include employment with the previous employer mentioned in section 12A(6A) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any reference to “former employments” in subsection (6)(c) or (f) shall not include employment with the previous employer mentioned in section 12A(6A) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any reference to “former employer” in subsection (6)(c) or (f) shall not include the previous employer mentioned in section 12A(6A) of the Ordinance. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: In the case of a scheme member who is a self-employed person, the trustee must arrange for the member’s contribution account to be divided into the following sub-accounts—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a sub-account specifying the member’s mandatory contributions paid by the member while self-employed, any contribution surcharges paid by the member on arrears, and the income or profits arising from any investments of those contributions and surcharges, but taking into account any losses in respect of the investments and any amounts paid in respect of the member; (2 of 2002 s. 21)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a sub-account specifying—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: all mandatory contributions paid by or in respect of the member that are attributable to the member’s former employments or former self-employments and transferred to the member’s contribution account in accordance with Part 12, and any contribution surcharges paid in respect of any such mandatory contributions; (18 of 2008 s. 17)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the member’s minimum MPF benefits (if any), to which section 5(1) of Schedule 2 to the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Exemption) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. B) applies, transferred to the scheme;

subparagraph.name: iia
subparagraph.content: all mandatory contributions paid by or in respect of the member that are attributable to the member’s former employments or former self-employments, and any contribution surcharges paid in respect of any such mandatory contributions, other than mandatory contributions or contribution surcharges mentioned in subparagraph (i) or (ii); (18 of 2008 s. 17)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the income or profits arising from any investments of the contributions, surcharges and benefits mentioned in any of subparagraphs (i), (ii) and (iia), but taking into account any losses in respect of the investments and any amounts paid in respect of the member; (2 of 2002 s. 21; 18 of 2008 s. 17)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the special contributions (if any) paid in respect of the member and the income or profits arising from any investments of those contributions, but taking into account any losses in respect of the investments and any amounts paid in respect of the member; (30 of 2008 s. 8)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a sub-account specifying the voluntary contributions (if any) paid by the member while self-employed and the income or profits arising from any investments of those contributions, but taking into account any losses in respect of the investments and any amounts paid in respect of the member; (2 of 2002 s. 21)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a sub-account specifying—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: all voluntary contributions paid by or in respect of the member and transferred to the member’s contribution account;

subparagraph.name: ia
subparagraph.content: all voluntary contributions paid by or in respect of the member that are attributable to the member’s former employments or former self-employments, other than voluntary contributions mentioned in subparagraph (i); (18 of 2008 s. 17)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount (other than minimum MPF benefits to which section 5(1) of Schedule 2 to the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Exemption) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. B) applies), if any, transferred to the scheme in respect of the member from an ORSO exempted scheme or an ORSO registered scheme;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the member’s income or profits arising from any investments of the contributions and amount mentioned in any of subparagraphs (i), (ia) and (ii), but taking into account any losses in respect of the investments and any amounts paid in respect of the member. (2 of 2002 s. 21; 18 of 2008 s. 17; 1 of 2015 s. 30)

subsection.leadIn: In the case of a scheme member who holds a personal account in the scheme, the trustee must arrange for the member’s personal account to be divided into the following sub-accounts— (11 of 2009 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a sub-account specifying—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: all mandatory contributions paid by or in respect of the member that are attributable to the member’s current employments or former employments or former self-employments and transferred to the member’s personal account in accordance with Part 12, and any contribution surcharges paid in respect of any such mandatory contributions; (18 of 2008 s. 17)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the member’s minimum MPF benefits (if any), to which section 5(1) of Schedule 2 to the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Exemption) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. B) applies, transferred to the scheme;

subparagraph.name: iia
subparagraph.content: all mandatory contributions paid by or in respect of the member that are attributable to the member’s former employments or former self-employments, and any contribution surcharges paid in respect of any such mandatory contributions, other than mandatory contributions or contribution surcharges mentioned in subparagraph (i) or (ii); (18 of 2008 s. 17)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the income or profits arising from any investments of the contributions, surcharges and benefits mentioned in any of subparagraphs (i), (ii) and (iia), but taking into account any losses in respect of the investments and any amounts paid in respect of the member; (2 of 2002 s. 21)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the special contributions (if any) paid in respect of the member and the income or profits arising from any investments of those contributions, but taking into account any losses in respect of the investments and any amounts paid in respect of the member; (30 of 2008 s. 8)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a sub-account specifying—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: all voluntary contributions paid by or in respect of the member and transferred to the member’s personal account;

subparagraph.name: ia
subparagraph.content: all voluntary contributions paid by or in respect of the member that are attributable to the member’s former employments or former self-employments, other than voluntary contributions mentioned in subparagraph (i); (18 of 2008 s. 17)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount (other than minimum MPF benefits to which section 5(1) of Schedule 2 to the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Exemption) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. B) applies), if any, transferred to the scheme in respect of the member from an ORSO exempted scheme or an ORSO registered scheme;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the member’s income or profits arising from any investments of the contributions and amount mentioned in any of subparagraphs (i), (ia) and (ii), but taking into account any losses in respect of the investments and any amounts paid in respect of the member. (2 of 2002 s. 21; 18 of 2008 s. 17; 11 of 2009 s. 14; 1 of 2015 s. 30)

subsection.name: 8A
subsection.leadIn: In the case of a scheme member who holds a TVC account in the scheme, the trustee must arrange for the account to specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all tax deductible voluntary contributions paid by the member into the account;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: all accrued benefits—

subparagraph.content: derived from those contributions; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the income or profits arising from any investments of those contributions and accrued benefits, with any losses in respect of the investments and any amounts paid in respect of the member being taken into account. (7 of 2019 s. 20)

subsection.content: The trustee must ensure that each member’s account is kept in such a manner that the amounts relating to a scheme member’s account are recorded in the appropriate sub-accounts of that account.
For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that this section does not operate to require the trustee to divide a member’s sub-account into any further sub-accounts. (2 of 2002 s. 21)

section.name: s79
section.heading: Financial period of registered scheme

subsection.content: Except as provided by subsection (2), the approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that the first financial period of the scheme is the period beginning with the date on which the scheme was registered under section 21 or 21A of the Ordinance and ending on a date determined by the trustee. The date so determined must be a date not more than 12 months from the date of registration of the scheme or such later date as the approved trustee, with the prior approval of the Authority, so determines. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: If the scheme was, immediately before it became registered under the Ordinance, an occupational retirement scheme registered under the Occupational Retirement Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 426)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the first day of the first financial period of the scheme is to be determined by the approved trustee but that day must not be a date later than the day on which the scheme became registered under the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the last day of the first financial period of the scheme is to be determined by the approved trustee but that day must be a date not more than 12 months from the first day of that period or such later date as the approved trustee, with the prior approval of the Authority, so determines. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: The trustee must ensure that every subsequent financial period of the scheme is to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period ending on each anniversary of the date determined under subsection (1) or (2)(b), as the case may be; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a different date for the end of a financial period is approved under subsection (4), the period ending on that date and then on each anniversary of that date.

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme may, with the prior approval of the Authority, determine a different date for the end of the financial period of the scheme.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Approved trustee to prepare statement of accounting policies

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after becoming the approved trustee of a registered scheme, the trustee must prepare a statement of accounting policies specifying the accounting policies to be followed in preparing financial statements for the scheme under section 81.

The statement must specify the basis on which the assets of the registered scheme are valued or are to be valued and the basis on which amounts are or are to be regarded as income from the investment of those assets.
The trustee may, from time to time, substitute for a statement of accounting policies a new statement of accounting policies or vary a statement so prepared or substituted.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Approved trustee to prepare financial statements

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must, before the deadline after a financial period of the scheme, cause to be made out a balance sheet as at the last day of the period that gives a true and fair view of the financial position of the scheme on that day. The balance sheet must specify the assets and liabilities of the scheme on that day. Obligations in respect of benefits that will become payable to scheme members after that day are not to be regarded as liabilities for that purpose.

subsection.leadIn: The trustee must also, before that deadline, cause to be made out a statement of account for the relevant financial period that gives a true and fair view of the scheme’s financial transactions for that period. The statement must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fees for administrative expenses deducted or deductible by the trustee from scheme members’ accounts under this Regulation; and

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the total returns derived from investing the funds of the scheme (taking into account any capital appreciation and depreciation); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the total amount of accrued benefits that were paid, and of accrued benefits that became payable but were not paid, to or in respect of scheme members; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the amount of accrued benefits transferred to and from the scheme,

subsection.continued: during the financial period.

subsection.leadIn: Before preparing the relevant financial statements, the trustee must take reasonable steps—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to recover all outstanding debts in relation to the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to cause all known bad debts relating to the scheme to be written off and adequate provision to be made for doubtful debts.

subsection.content: If the financial statements relating to a registered scheme made out in accordance with this section would not otherwise give a true and fair view of the financial position and transactions of the scheme, the trustee must add such information and explanations as will give a true and fair view of the financial position and transactions.
The trustee must ensure that a statement of the accounting policies followed in preparing the financial statements is included in or attached to the statements.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Auditor’s report to be attached to financial statements
section.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must take all reasonable steps to ensure that, before the deadline for each financial period of the scheme, the auditor’s report on the financial statements prepared for that period is attached to, or endorsed on, those statements.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Financial statements to state whether applicable accounting guideline has been complied with

subsection.content: If the financial statements for a registered scheme purport to be prepared in accordance with the applicable accounting guideline, the approved trustee of the scheme must ensure that those statements include a declaration to that effect.

If the financial statements relating to the scheme do not purport to be prepared in accordance with the applicable accounting guideline in any material respect, the trustee must ensure that those statements include a declaration to that effect. The declaration must specify in what respect those statements depart from that guideline.

section.name: s84
section.heading: Comparative amounts to be included in financial statements
section.leadIn: If a particular amount is specified in a financial statement made out for a financial period of a registered scheme, the approved trustee of the scheme must ensure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the corresponding amount for the immediately preceding financial period (if any) of the scheme is shown in the statement in such a way as to allow easy comparison between the first-mentioned amount and the corresponding amount; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the first-mentioned amount has been determined on a different basis from the corresponding amount and the different basis materially affects the determination of the corresponding amount—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: that particulars of the adjustment and the reasons for it are disclosed in a note to the financial statement.

section.name: s85
section.heading: Signing of financial statements
section.leadIn: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that financial statements relating to the scheme are signed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the trustee is or includes a company, by at least 2 directors of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the trustee consists wholly of natural persons, by at least 2 of those persons, including the independent trustee.

section.name: s86
section.heading: Scheme report to be prepared

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must, for each financial period of the scheme, ensure that a scheme report is prepared for the scheme in accordance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The scheme report must include the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a commentary as to the financial development of the scheme consistent with the financial statements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: particulars of any changes that have been made to the governing rules of the scheme since the end of the immediately preceding financial period of the scheme or, if there was no such period, since the scheme became registered;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: such other information as is, in the trustee’s opinion, necessary to provide the scheme members with a proper understanding of the scheme and its operation.

subsection.leadIn: The scheme report must also—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify how and from whom scheme members can obtain further information about the scheme and its operation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give particulars of the auditor of the financial statements made out in respect of the scheme for the financial period and of any service provider, bank, legal adviser, broker or other agent appointed or engaged by the trustee for the purposes of the scheme during that period; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if any of the particulars referred to in paragraph (b) have changed during the financial period, give particulars of the changes; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if any of the persons referred to in paragraph (b) was an associate of the trustee during the financial period—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: specify that fact; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the trustee is or includes a company, give particulars of the persons who were controllers of that associate during that period; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: if the trustee is or includes a company, give—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: particulars of the directors of the company who were holding office at the end of the financial period; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: particulars of appointments and terminations of appointment of directors of the company during that period (including the dates of those appointments and terminations of appointment); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: if the trustee consists of or includes natural persons—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: give particulars of those persons who were approved trustees of the scheme at the end of the financial period; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: specify which of those trustees was the independent trustee of the scheme during the financial period; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: give particulars of appointments and terminations of appointment of those trustees during that period (including the dates of those appointments and terminations of appointment).

def.name: Particulars
def.leadIn: For the purpose of subsection (3), particulars (詳情), in relation to a person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s name; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s business address or, if the person is a natural person and does not have a place of business in Hong Kong, the person’s residential address.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Investment report to be prepared

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must, for each financial period of the scheme, ensure that an investment report is prepared for the scheme in accordance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The investment report must also include the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an analysis of the investments held by the trustee in respect of the scheme and particulars of the income derived from those investments during the financial period concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a commentary by the trustee on the analysis;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: particulars of the investment policy followed by the trustee during that financial period and any change in the statement of investment policy that will materially affect the risk attached to the investments of the scheme;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for that financial period and for each of the 2 immediately preceding financial periods (if any) of each constituent fund of the scheme—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amount of net income (excluding capital appreciation or depreciation) derived from the investment of the funds of the scheme; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount by which the value of the scheme assets has appreciated or depreciated during the financial period; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the value of the scheme assets derived from the investment of the funds of the scheme as ascertained in accordance with the applicable accounting guideline.

subsection.leadIn: The information referred to in subsection (2) must be adequate to ensure that scheme members are provided with a proper understanding of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the investments made in respect of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the net return derived from those investments (excluding any appreciation or depreciation of the value of the scheme assets attributable to those investments); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the appreciation or depreciation of the value of the scheme assets attributable to those investments.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Approved trustee to comply with sections 86 and 87 before deadline
section.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must comply with sections 86 and 87 for each financial period of the scheme before the deadline after the end of that period.

section.name: s89
section.heading: Approved trustee to ensure preparation of consolidated report

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after the scheme report and investment report have been prepared for a financial period of a registered scheme, the approved trustee of the scheme must publish a consolidated report consisting of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the financial statements of the scheme made up for that period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the auditor’s report on those statements;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the scheme report prepared for that period in accordance with section 86;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the investment report prepared for that period in accordance with section 87.

subsection.content: A consolidated report may include such other information relating to the scheme and its administration as the trustee considers appropriate.
The consolidated report must be printed in a Chinese language version and an English language version.

section.name: s90
section.heading: Scheme members may request for copies of consolidated reports

subsection.content: A scheme member may request the approved trustee of the scheme for a copy of the consolidated report published by the trustee in respect of the scheme for any specified financial period within 7 years preceding the date of the request. The copy must be in either the Chinese language or the English language, according to the member’s election as specified in the request.

As soon as practicable after receiving a request under subsection (1), the trustee must arrange to give to the scheme member who made the request a copy of the consolidated report requested by that member.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Register of scheme members to be kept

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that a register of scheme members is established and kept in accordance with this section.

The register must specify the name of each scheme member, the member’s residential address, the member’s date of birth and whether the scheme member is a self-employed person or a relevant employee of a participating employer and, if the member is such an employee, the name and business address of the employer.
The register may also specify in relation to a scheme member such other particulars as the trustee thinks appropriate.

section.name: s92
section.heading: Other records to be kept

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that all records in respect of the management of the scheme (other than accounting records) are so kept as will correctly record and explain the operation of the scheme.
The provisions in section 77(2) to (4) apply to those records as if they were accounting records.

section.name: s93
section.heading: Period for which accounting and other records are to be kept
section.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that an accounting or other record required to be kept in respect of the scheme is kept for at least 7 years after the end of the financial period in which the record is made or, if the record relates to a person’s membership of the scheme, for at least 7 years after the person ceases to be a scheme member.

section.name: s94
section.heading: Offences
section.content: An approved trustee who fails to comply with a requirement or duty imposed on approved trustees by section 77 or 78 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s95
section.heading: Approved trustee to ensure financial statements are audited

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that the scheme’s financial statements for a financial period are audited as required by this Part before the deadline after that period.
An approved trustee who fails to take all reasonable steps to comply with, or to secure compliance with, this section commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s96
section.heading: Approved trustee to appoint auditor to audit scheme accounts

subsection.content: Within 3 months after the day on which a provident fund scheme is registered under section 21 or 21A of the Ordinance, or within such extended period as the Authority allows, the approved trustee of the scheme must appoint at least 1 person as auditor of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: An auditor of a registered scheme appointed under this section holds office until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: death (in the case of a natural person), dissolution (in the case of a firm that is not reconstituted) or commencement of winding up (in the case of a company); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: removal or resignation from office in accordance with section 99; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the auditor was appointed for a specified period, the expiry of that period; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the auditor ceases, in accordance with this Part, to be qualified to be auditor of a registered scheme.

subsection.content: Within 30 days after a vacancy occurs in the office of auditor of a registered scheme, or within such extended period as the Authority allows, the trustee must, if there is no surviving or continuing auditor of the scheme, appoint another auditor to fill the vacancy.
While a vacancy in the office of auditor of the scheme continues, the surviving or continuing auditor (if any) of the scheme may act.

subsection.leadIn: The trustee must appoint as auditor of the scheme only a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has consented to act as auditor of the scheme by written notice given to the trustee before the appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not withdrawn the consent by similar notice.

subsection.content: If the trustee appoints an auditor of the scheme in contravention of subsection (5), the purported appointment has no effect.
An approved trustee who fails to take all reasonable steps to comply with a requirement of this section commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s97
section.heading: Functions of Authority where approved trustee fails to appoint auditor under section 96

subsection.content: An approved trustee of a registered scheme who fails to appoint an auditor of the scheme as required by section 96 must notify the Authority in writing within 7 days after the day by which the appointment was required to be made.

At any time before the end of the period within which a trustee is required to appoint an auditor under section 96, the trustee may apply in writing to the Authority to extend that period on the grounds that the trustee claims to be unable to comply with the requirement within that period.

On receiving an application under subsection (2), the Authority may extend the period for appointment of an auditor of the scheme for a further period not exceeding 30 days, but only if satisfied that the trustee’s claim is justified.

subsection.leadIn: On becoming aware that the approved trustee of a registered scheme has failed to appoint an auditor of the scheme as required by section 96 (whether as a result of the receipt of a notice under subsection (1) or not), the Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: appoint as auditor of the scheme 1 or more persons who consent to be appointed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the fees to be paid to the auditor.

subsection.content: The approved trustee of the scheme concerned is required to pay the fees referred to in subsection (4)(b) in accordance with section 101.
An approved trustee who fails to take all reasonable steps to comply with a requirement of this section commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s98
section.heading: Qualifications for auditor

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (5), (7) and (8), a person is qualified to be an auditor of registered schemes if the person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an accounting practice unit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: recognized by the Authority as having a qualification in accounting equivalent to that of a certified public accountant (practising) as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588). (23 of 2004 s. 56; L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: A person must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: consent to be appointed as auditor of a registered scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: act as auditor of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prepare a report required by this Regulation to be prepared by an auditor of a registered scheme,

subsection.continued: unless the person is qualified to be an auditor of registered schemes.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) does not prevent a person who is not qualified as an auditor from participating in the preparation of a report required by this Regulation so long as the person is under the supervision of a person who is so qualified.

subsection.leadIn: A firm must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: consent to be appointed as auditors of a registered scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: act as auditors of such a scheme; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prepare a report required by this Regulation required to be prepared by an auditor of a registered scheme,

subsection.continued: unless at least one of the partners of the firm is a person qualified to be an auditor of registered schemes.

subsection.leadIn: If the approved trustee of a registered scheme is a company, a person is not qualified to be auditor of the scheme if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a controller of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a partner, employer or employee of such a controller; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is a partner or employee of an employee of such a controller.

subsection.content: If the approved trustee of a registered scheme is a company, then, for the purposes of this section, a person is taken to be a controller of the trustee if the person is a controller of a company that is an associate of the trustee.

If the approved trustee of a registered scheme consists of trustees all of whom are natural persons, a person is not qualified to be auditor of the scheme if the person is a partner, employer or employee of any of those persons.

subsection.leadIn: If the approved trustee of a registered scheme consists of trustees one or more of whom is a company and the remainder are natural persons, a person is not qualified to be auditor of the scheme if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a controller of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a partner, employer or employee of such a controller; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is a partner or employee of an employee of such a controller; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is a partner, employer or employee of any of those natural persons.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, a person is not a controller of an approved trustee that is a company only because the person is a liquidator of the company or of an associated company. (1 of 2008 s. 54)

If a person who is the auditor of a registered scheme knowingly disqualifies himself, herself or itself from acting as auditor of the scheme while the appointment continues, that person must immediately resign from the office of auditor of the scheme in accordance with section 99(4). The notice must be given within 7 days after the disqualification.

If a partner of a firm that is appointed auditor of a registered scheme knowingly disqualifies the firm from acting as auditor of the scheme while the appointment continues, that partner must immediately cause the firm to resign from the office of auditor of the scheme in accordance with section 99(4). The notice must be given within 7 days after the disqualification.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with this section commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s99
section.heading: Removal and resignation of auditor

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme may, subject to subsection (2), remove an auditor of the scheme from office.

subsection.leadIn: The removal of an auditor of a registered scheme by the approved trustee of the scheme has effect only if the trustee, within 2 specified working days after the removal— (9 of 2016 s. 22)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: informs the Authority, by written notice, of the removal and the reasons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: serves a copy of the notice on the auditor.

subsection.content: An auditor must, within 2 specified working days after receiving a copy of the notice, inform the Authority, by written notice, of the reasons as to why, in the auditor’s opinion, the auditor was removed from office. (9 of 2016 s. 22)
An auditor of a registered scheme may, by written notice given to the approved trustee of the scheme, resign as auditor of the scheme.

If an auditor of a registered scheme who has been appointed for a specified period does not wish to seek reappointment for a further period, the auditor must, by written notice given to the approved trustee of the scheme, inform the trustee of the auditor’s wish not to be reappointed.

subsection.leadIn: A notice given for the purposes of subsection (4) or (5) must include or be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement to the effect that, to the best of the auditor’s knowledge and belief, there are no circumstances relating to the resignation or decision not to seek reappointment that would prejudicially affect the interests of scheme members to a material extent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the notice does not include such a statement or if the notice includes a statement to the contrary effect, a statement specifying the circumstances that gave rise to the resignation or decision not to seek reappointment.

subsection.content: If a notice given for the purposes of subsection (4) or (5) includes a statement of the kind referred to in subsection (6)(a), the trustee must, within 7 specified working days after receiving the notice, give the Authority a copy of the notice. (9 of 2016 s. 22)

If a notice given for the purposes of subsection (4) or (5) includes a statement of the kind referred to in subsection (6)(b), the auditor must, within 2 specified working days after giving the notice to the trustee, give the Authority a copy of the notice. (9 of 2016 s. 22)

If, on the retirement or withdrawal of a partner from the firm, the firm would no longer be capable of acting as auditor of a registered scheme because of section 98(4), the firm must resign from office by written notice given to the approved trustee of the scheme in accordance with subsection (4). The notice must be given within 7 days after the retirement or withdrawal of the partner from the firm.

section.name: s100
section.heading: Effect of winding up on office of auditor
section.content: If a registered scheme is being wound up, the auditor of the scheme ceases to hold office on the commencement of the winding up.

section.name: s101
section.heading: Fees and expenses of auditor
section.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme is required to pay the reasonable fees and expenses of an auditor of the scheme from the funds of the scheme.

section.name: s102
section.heading: Auditor to report on financial statements etc.

subsection.content: The auditor of a registered scheme must report to the approved trustee of the scheme on the financial statements of the scheme and on the scheme’s accounting records and other records relating to the scheme. The report must be given to the trustee within sufficient time to enable the trustee to comply with section 110.

subsection.leadIn: An auditor must, in a report under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: state whether or not the financial statements relating to the scheme are in the auditor’s opinion properly drawn up—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: in accordance with sections 80, 81, 83 and 84 in all material respects,

paragraph.continued: and, if not, specify in what respects those statements are, in the auditor’s opinion, not properly drawn up; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state whether or not, in the auditor’s opinion, proper accounting and other records were kept during the relevant financial period in respect of the funds of the scheme, the scheme assets and all financial transactions entered into in relation to the scheme and, if not, specify in what respects those records were, in the auditor’s opinion, not kept; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state whether or not the scheme assets were at the end of that period encumbered by any encumbrance, otherwise than as permitted by this Regulation, and, if they were, give particulars of the encumbrance; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: state whether or not, in the auditor’s opinion, the requirements specified in the guidelines (if any) made by the Authority under section 28 of the Ordinance with respect to forbidden investment practices and the requirements of sections 37(2), 51 and 52 and Part 10 of, and Schedule 1 to, this Regulation have been complied with in all material respects as at—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the end of that period; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: 2 other dates in that period nominated by the auditor,

paragraph.continued: and, if not, specify to what extent those requirements have, in the auditor’s opinion, not been complied with; and (9 of 2016 s. 23)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: state whether or not, in the auditor’s opinion, the requirements under sections 34DB(1)(a), (b), (c) and (d), 34DD(1) and (4), 34DI(1) and (2), 34DJ(2), (3), (4) and (5) and 34DK(2) of the Ordinance have been complied with in all material respects as at— (40 of 2021 s. 60)

subparagraph.content: the end of that period; and
2 other dates in that period nominated by the auditor,

paragraph.continued: and, if not, specify to what extent, in the auditor’s opinion, those requirements have not been complied with. (9 of 2016 s. 23)

subsection.content: The intervening period between the 2 dates referred to in subsection (2)(d)(ii) or (e)(ii) must be not less than 3 months or, if the Authority has in a particular case allowed a shorter period, not less than that period. (9 of 2016 s. 23)
The auditor may include in the auditor’s report such explanations and qualifications as the auditor thinks relevant.
The auditor’s report must be attached to, or endorsed on, the financial statements.

section.name: s103
section.heading: Auditor to report certain matters to Authority

subsection.leadIn: If, in the course of performing the auditor’s duties under this Part, the auditor of a registered scheme—

paragraph.name: a
ab
paragraph.leadIn: becomes aware that the approved trustee of the scheme is not complying with any of the following provisions of the Ordinance—

subparagraph.content: section 34DB(1)(a), (b), (c) or (d);
section 34DD(1) or (4);
section 34DI(1) or (2);
section 34DK(2); or (9 of 2016 s. 24)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: becomes aware that the approved trustee of the scheme is not complying with section 77 or 78; or

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: identifies any payment from the funds of the scheme that, in the auditor’s opinion, is materially prejudicial to the interests of scheme members or is in contravention of section 14 or 15 of the Ordinance or of a regulation made for the purposes of either of those sections; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: except in the circumstances specified in subsection (3), becomes aware that the scheme assets are or have been mixed with the funds of the trustee (otherwise than in accordance with the Ordinance) or the assets of any other person; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: identifies any matter that causes the auditor to form an opinion that the requirements specified in the guidelines (if any) made by the Authority under section 28 of the Ordinance with respect to forbidden investment practices and the requirements of sections 37(2), 51 and 52 and Part 10 of, and Schedule 1 to, this Regulation have not been complied with in all material respects, (40 of 2021 s. 61)

subsection.continued: except as permitted by subsection (4), it is the duty of the auditor to report the matter immediately to the Authority by written notice.

subsection.content: The auditor is not required to comply with subsection (1) with respect to a payment referred to in paragraph (d) of that subsection if the trustee has fully reimbursed the scheme as soon as practicable after the payment was brought to the trustee’s notice.

subsection.leadIn: The circumstances referred to in subsection (1)(e) arise when a custodian of the scheme assets—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is also the holder of assets of one or more other registered schemes or other financial schemes or undertakings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: mixes scheme assets with those other assets; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: keeps a separate account of the scheme assets and those other assets in such a way as to enable them to be separately identified.

subsection.leadIn: Before reporting a matter to the Authority in accordance with subsection (1), the auditor may, by written notice given to the trustee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: bring the matter to the trustee’s attention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: request the trustee to provide the auditor with an explanation of the matter and the related circumstances; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require the trustee to rectify the matter within such period as the auditor considers to be reasonable.

subsection.continued: The auditor is not required to report the matter to the Authority if the trustee complies with the request and requirement in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The auditor must not give a notice under subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the matter concerned relates to a transaction that, in the auditor’s opinion is or has resulted in a material misappropriation of the funds of the scheme or the scheme assets; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if bringing the matter to the attention of the trustee could reasonably be expected to affect the interests of scheme members detrimentally.

section.name: s104
section.heading: Power of Authority on becoming aware of matters reported under section 103

subsection.content: If, on receiving a report made under section 103 or otherwise becoming aware of a matter referred to in that section, the Authority is of the opinion that the matter is capable of being rectified, the Authority may, by written notice given to the trustee concerned, direct the trustee to rectify the matter at the trustee’s own expense within such period as is specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after giving a direction under subsection (1), the Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by written notice given to the auditor, request the auditor, as soon as practicable after the end of the period specified in the notice and at the expense of the trustee, to provide the Authority with a further report as to whether or not the trustee has rectified the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attach to that notice a copy of the notice given to the trustee containing the direction.

subsection.content: An approved trustee who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a direction given by the Authority under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.
It is the duty of an auditor to comply with a request made to the auditor in accordance with subsection (2).

section.name: s105
section.heading: Access of auditor to scheme records
section.leadIn: The auditor of a registered scheme is entitled—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to have access at all reasonable times to the accounting records and other records that are required to be kept in relation to the scheme by— (40 of 2021 s. 62)

subparagraph.content: the trustee;
the system operator of an electronic MPF system; or
a service provider appointed or engaged by the trustee for the purposes of the scheme; (40 of 2021 s. 62)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the trustee is or includes a company, to have access at all reasonable times to the accounting records and other records that the company is required by law to keep; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to require from the trustee, the system operator and any such service provider such information and explanations as the auditor needs in order to perform a duty imposed on the auditor by this Part or Part 9. (40 of 2021 s. 62)

section.name: s106
section.heading: Auditor’s opinion with respect to information and explanations

subsection.content: In performing a duty under this Part or Part 9, the auditor of a registered scheme must form an opinion as to whether the auditor has obtained all the information and explanations that the auditor has required.

subsection.leadIn: When forming an opinion for the purposes of making a report under section 102 or 103, the auditor may treat—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: information contained in a remittance statement lodged with the trustee of the scheme in respect of a scheme member who is a relevant employee of a participating employer in accordance with Part 11; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: particulars given to the trustee in accordance with Part 11 by a scheme member who is a self-employed person,

subsection.continued: as conclusive evidence as to the amount of the member’s relevant income.

section.name: s107
section.heading: Obstruction of auditor

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to the following persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an approved trustee of a registered scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any service provider appointed or engaged for the purposes of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: A person to whom this section applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must allow the auditor of the scheme access to all accounting records and other records relating to the scheme and to the approved trustee of the scheme that are in the person’s possession; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must give any information or explanation to the auditor as and when reasonably required by the auditor; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must not obstruct, hinder or delay the auditor in the performance of the auditor’s duties or the exercise of the auditor’s powers.

subsection.content: A person to whom this section applies who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

section.name: s108
section.heading: Certain statements of auditor not admissible evidence
section.leadIn: A statement made by an auditor of a registered scheme in a notice given by the auditor to the Authority under this Part, or made in answer to an inquiry by the Authority arising from the giving of the notice, or as to the reasons for the auditor’s removal or resignation from office or not seeking reappointment as auditor of the scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not admissible in evidence in any civil or criminal proceedings against the auditor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may not be made the ground of a prosecution or other legal proceedings against the auditor.

section.name: s109
section.heading: Approved trustee to lodge trustee’s return with Authority

subsection.content: If the approved trustee of a registered scheme is or includes a company, the company must, within 6 months after each relevant period, lodge with the Authority for that period a trustee’s return that complies with this section.

If the approved trustee consists of or includes natural persons, each of those persons must, within 6 months after each relevant period, lodge with the Authority for that period a trustee’s return that complies with this section.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, the relevant period is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a company, the financial year of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a natural person, the financial period of the registered scheme in respect of which the person is a trustee or, if the person is a trustee in respect of 2 or more registered schemes, one of those schemes nominated by the person and notified in writing to the Authority.

subsection.content: A nomination referred to in subsection (3)(b) may be varied in respect of a later relevant period only with the consent of the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: A trustee’s return must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement as to whether or not the particulars specified in subsection (6) have changed in relation to the trustee during the relevant period and, if those particulars have changed during that period, a statement specifying the changes; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a declaration—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the trustee continues to satisfy the requirements for approval as a trustee under section 20 of the Ordinance and has, during the relevant period, complied with all conditions specified in the notice of approval given to the trustee in accordance with that section; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the trustee does not continue to satisfy all of those requirements or has not, during that period, complied with all of those conditions, that the trustee continues to satisfy those requirements and to comply with those conditions with the exception of those requirements and conditions specified in the declaration.

subsection.leadIn: The following are the particulars referred to in subsection (5)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: particulars of the address of the company’s principal place of business in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: if the appointment of the auditor relating to the trustee was terminated during the relevant period (whether by resignation or by any other means), particulars of the termination and of any other auditor appointed to replace that auditor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a natural person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: particulars of the address of the person’s principal place of business in Hong Kong, unless subparagraph (ii) applies;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the person’s residential address if the person does not have a place of business in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: If the trustee is or includes a company, the trustee must attach to the return the following documents—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the trustee is not a non-Hong Kong company, a copy of the financial statements, or the balance sheet and profit and loss account, of the company relating to the immediately preceding financial year of the company, together with a copy of the auditor’s report on the documents and a copy of the directors’ report for that year, all of which must be prepared in accordance with Part 9 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) or Part IV of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 32) as in force from time to time before the commencement date* of section 2 of Schedule 9 to the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), as the case may be; (30 of 2004 s. 3; 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the trustee is a non-Hong Kong company, a copy of the balance sheet and profit and loss account of the company relating to the immediately preceding financial year of the company, together with a copy of the auditor’s report on those documents and a copy of the directors’ report for that year, all of which must be prepared in a form and language, and must contain the particulars, as required by the Authority by written notice to the trustee; (30 of 2004 s. 3; 1 of 2015 s. 31)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the trustee is a company that is provided with continuous financial support from a substantial financial institution, a copy of the balance sheet and profit and loss account of the institution relating to the immediately preceding financial year of the institution, together with a copy of the auditor’s report on those documents and a copy of the directors’ report for that year.

subsection.leadIn: If the trustee is a natural person, the person must attach to the return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: evidence that the person has in force, and had in force for the whole of the relevant period, a performance guarantee with an authorized financial institution or an authorized insurer securing the performance by the person of the duties imposed by or under the Ordinance on an approved trustee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the guarantee was varied during the relevant period, a copy of the variation.

subsection.leadIn: A trustee’s return must be signed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a company, by at least 2 directors of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a natural person, by that person.

section.name: s110
section.heading: Requirements in section 22A of the Ordinance

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 22A(1) of the Ordinance, the date is the deadline after each financial period relating to the registered scheme concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The following information is the information that must be included in the annual statement required to be lodged under section 22A of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement as to whether or not the trustee has, during the relevant financial period, become aware of any failures by persons appointed or engaged as service providers for the purposes of the scheme to comply with the obligations imposed on them with respect to the scheme and, if the trustee has become aware of any such failures, a statement giving particulars of those failures and any rectification of those failures;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement as to whether or not the trustee is aware of any events of a significant nature relating to the scheme that occurred during the relevant financial period but have not been reported to the Authority and, if the trustee is aware of any such events, a statement specifying those events;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a statement as to whether or not, in so far as it is within the knowledge of the trustee, the provisions of the Ordinance and of the governing rules of the scheme have been complied with in all material respects in respect of the scheme during the relevant financial period and, if within the knowledge of the trustee, those provisions have not been so complied with, a statement giving particulars of the failures to comply with those provisions; (40 of 2021 s. 63)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: such other information as may be prescribed for the purposes of this section by the guidelines.

subsection.leadIn: The following documents are documents that must accompany the annual statement required to be lodged under section 22A of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the consolidated report published in respect of the scheme for the relevant financial period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: evidence that the trustee has in force, and had in force for the whole of the relevant financial period, adequate insurance that will indemnify scheme members against losses that the members could incur as a result of the administration of the scheme by the trustee or by any service provider appointed or engaged to provide services for the purposes of the scheme and, if the insurance was varied during that period, particulars of the variation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a declaration that the trustee has, during the relevant financial period, supervised, and exercised proper control over, all service providers appointed or engaged for the purposes of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: The annual statement must be signed—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the trustee consists wholly of natural persons, by at least 2 of those persons, including the independent trustee.

section.name: s111
section.heading: Meaning of relevant period for the purposes of sections 112, 113 and 116

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 112, 113 and 116—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the trustee concerned is the approved trustee of only one registered scheme, the relevant period is the financial period of that scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
