paragraph.leadIn: if the trustee is the approved trustee of 2 or more registered schemes and a report prepared for the purposes of section 112 relates to 2 or more of those schemes, the relevant period is whichever of the following periods is nominated by the trustee and notified in writing to the Authority—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the financial period of one of those schemes specified by the trustee;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the financial year of the trustee.

subsection.content: A nomination referred to in subsection (1)(b) may be varied in respect of a later relevant period only with the consent of the Authority.

section.name: s112
section.heading: Approved trustee to report on control objectives and internal control measures

subsection.leadIn: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must, before the deadline after each relevant period, lodge with the Authority for that period a report specifying—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the control objectives of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the major procedures and internal control measures for achieving those objectives.

subsection.content: If the trustee is the approved trustee of 2 or more registered schemes and the control objectives and procedures and internal control measures for those schemes are the same for each scheme, the trustee may lodge a single report in respect of all of the schemes.
A report lodged under this section must be accompanied by an auditor’s report prepared in accordance with section 113.

subsection.leadIn: The report must be signed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the trustee is or includes a company, by at least 2 directors of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the trustee consists wholly of natural persons, by at least 2 of those persons, including the independent trustee.

subsection.leadIn: The approved trustee of an employed sponsored scheme is not required to comply with this section during a relevant period if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it has no more than 1 000 members throughout the immediately preceding relevant period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is exempted by the Authority under subsection (6).

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may grant the approved trustee of an employer sponsored scheme an exemption for the purposes of subsection (5) if satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a substantial portion of the immediately preceding relevant period, the scheme had no more than 1 000 members; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the scheme will not have, or is unlikely to have, more than 1 000 members during the current relevant period of the scheme.

section.name: s113
section.heading: Duty of auditor in respect of approved trustee’s report under section 112

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after preparing a report for the purposes of section 112, the approved trustee of the scheme or schemes concerned must submit the report to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the report relates to only one scheme, the auditor of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the report relates to 2 or more schemes and the trustee specifies the financial period of one of the schemes to which the report relates as the relevant period nominated under section 111(1)(b), the auditor of that scheme; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the report relates to 2 or more schemes and the financial year of the trustee is the relevant period nominated under section 111(1)(b), the auditor of the trustee.

subsection.content: The approved trustee must allow the auditor sufficient time to comply with the requirements in subsections (3) and (6).
On receiving the report, the auditor must review the report and report in writing to the trustee on the review in accordance with subsections (4) and (5).

subsection.leadIn: The auditor’s report on the review must state the auditor’s opinion as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not appropriate control objectives were established and maintained for the scheme during the period to which the report relates; and

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: whether or not those internal control measures (if any) were likely to have been sufficiently effective to provide a reasonable assurance that the control objectives established and maintained for the scheme would be achieved if those measures were fully and properly implemented.

subsection.leadIn: The auditor’s report must also—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state whether or not, during the course of the review of the trustee’s report, the auditor became aware of any shortcomings in the internal control measures that could materially affect the operation of the scheme (including its financial position) or the financial interests of scheme members; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the auditor did become aware of any such shortcomings, specify those shortcomings.

subsection.content: The auditor must ensure that the auditor’s report prepared under this section is given to the trustee concerned in sufficient time to enable the trustee to comply with section 112(1).

section.name: s114
section.heading: Approved trustee to report on compliance with capital adequacy requirements

subsection.leadIn: In the case of an approved trustee that is or includes a company, the company must, within 6 months after the end of each financial year of the company, lodge with the Authority a report. The report must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not the prescribed capital adequacy requirements were complied with in respect of the company throughout that financial year; and

paragraph.name: b

subsection.content: The report must be accompanied by a report by the auditor of the company that has been prepared in accordance with section 115.
The report must be signed by at least 2 directors of the company.

section.name: s115
section.heading: Duty of auditor in respect of trustee’s report under section 114

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after a company has prepared a report for the purposes of section 114, the company must submit the report to its auditor.
The company must allow the auditor sufficient time to comply with the requirements in subsections (3) and (5).

subsection.leadIn: On receiving the report, the auditor must review the report and report in writing on the review to the company. The auditor’s report must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: whether or not, in the auditor’s opinion, the prescribed capital adequacy requirements were complied with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as at the end of the financial year of the company; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on 2 other dates nominated by the auditor ; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the prescribed capital adequacy requirements were not so complied with, in what respects they were not complied with.

subsection.content: The intervening period between the 2 dates referred to in subsection (3)(a)(ii) must be not less than 3 months or, if the Authority has in a particular case allowed a shorter period, not less than that period.
The auditor must ensure that the auditor’s report prepared under this section is given to the company in sufficient time to enable it to comply with section 114(1).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, the auditor of a company to which this section applies is entitled—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to have access at all reasonable times to the accounting and other records that the company is required by law to keep; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to require from the company, and from any controller or employee of the company, such information and explanations as the auditor needs in order to report under this section.

subsection.leadIn: A company to which this section applies must take all reasonable steps to ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the auditor of the company is allowed access to any accounting and other records relating to the company that are in the possession of the company or of the controller or any other controller, employee or agent of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any relevant information that are in the possession of the company or of the controller or any other controller, employee or agent of the company or explanation is given as and when required by the auditor; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the auditor is not hindered, obstructed or delayed in the performance of the auditor’s duties under this section.

subsection.content: A company that, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (7) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s116
section.heading: Power of Authority to direct approved trustee to rectify matters

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: becomes aware, whether as a result of the lodgement with it in accordance with section 109 of the auditor’s report on the accounts of a company that is or included in an approved trustee or otherwise, that those accounts have been qualified in some material respect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is of the opinion that the matter to which the qualification relates is capable of being rectified,

subsection.continued: the Authority may, by written notice given to the company, direct it to rectify the matter within such period as is specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: becomes aware, whether as a result of an auditor’s report under section 113 or otherwise, that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: appropriate control objectives were not established and maintained in respect of a registered scheme during a relevant period; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: effective internal control measures were not established and maintained for the purpose of achieving those objectives; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: there were shortcomings in the internal control measures that could materially affect the operation of the scheme (including its financial position) or the financial interests of scheme members; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is of the opinion that the matter is capable of being rectified,

subsection.continued: the Authority may, by written notice given to the approved trustee of the scheme, direct the trustee to rectify the matter within such period as is specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: becomes aware, whether as a result of an auditor’s report under section 115 or otherwise, that a company that is or included in an approved trustee has not, during a financial year of the company, complied with the prescribed capital adequacy requirements applicable to the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is of the opinion that the matter is capable of being rectified,

subsection.continued: the Authority may, by written notice given to the company, direct it to rectify the matter within such period as is specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after giving a direction under this section to rectify a matter, the Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by written notice given to the auditor concerned, request that auditor to provide the Authority, as soon as practicable after the end of the period specified in the notice and at the expense of the company or trustee concerned, with a further report as to whether or not the trustee has rectified the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attach to that notice a copy of the notice given to the company or trustee concerned containing the direction.

subsection.content: A company that is or is included in an approved trustee that, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a direction given under subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.
An approved trustee who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a direction given under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.
It is the duty of an auditor to comply with a request made to the auditor in accordance with subsection (4).

section.name: s117
section.heading: Approved trustee to lodge monthly return with Authority
section.leadIn: Within 7 specified working days after the last day of each calendar month, the approved trustee of a registered scheme must lodge with the Authority a monthly return containing— (9 of 2016 s. 25)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such information relating to the capital preservation fund,

section.continued: as may be prescribed for the purposes of this section by the guidelines.

section.name: s118
section.heading: Limitations and prohibitions as to investment in restricted investments

subsection.content: The limitations and prohibitions set out in this section are the limitations and prohibitions with which the approved trustee of an employer sponsored scheme must comply for the purposes of section 29 of the Ordinance.
Not more than 10 per cent of the total assets of each constituent fund of an employer sponsored scheme, as determined by reference to their market value, may consist of restricted securities.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the underlying securities of an approved pooled investment fund in which the assets of a constituent fund are invested; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the debt securities permitted under section 7(2)(a) or (b) of Schedule 1.

subsection.content: A loan, other than a loan made by way of a deposit with an authorized financial institution, may not be made from the assets of a constituent fund.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: RestrictedSecurities
def.leadIn: restricted securities (受限制證券) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any security of, or issued by, a participating employer or an associate of the employer, except an option issued by an associate of the employer that, if exercised, would result in an acquisition of share capital of a company or corporation other than that of the employer or associate; or (L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any security that contains an option that, if exercised, would result in the conversion of the security to shares or other securities of, or issued by, a participating employer or an associate of the employer; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any security that is an option that, if exercised, would result in the acquisition of shares or other securities of, or issued by, a participating employer or an associate of the employer.

section.name: s119
section.heading: Definitions
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: assessable profits (應評稅利潤) has the same meaning as in the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112);
business (業務) includes a business and a trade within the meaning of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112) and a profession;

def.name: MaximumLevelOfRelevantIncome
def.leadIn: maximum level of relevant income (最高有關入息水平), in relation to a self-employed person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of the maximum level of relevant income per month as specified in section 3 of Schedule 3 to the Ordinance if the person contributes to a registered scheme on a monthly basis; and

paragraph.name: b

section.def: most recent notice of assessment (最近期評稅通知書), in relation to a self-employed person, means the last notice of assessment issued to the self-employed person, or to a partnership of which the self-employed person is a member, as at the time when the person produces evidence of the person’s relevant income to the approved trustee of the scheme;
notice of assessment (評稅通知書) means a notice of assessment issued by the Commissioner of Inland Revenue in accordance with the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112);
payment period (付款期) means the period specified in a notice under section 136(1)(a); (29 of 2002 s. 14)
prescribed percentage (訂明百分比) means the percentage specified in section 7C(3) of the Ordinance;
self-employed person (自僱人士), when used in relation to a registered scheme, means a self-employed person who is a member of the scheme. (1 of 2008 s. 62)

division.name: D1
division.heading: Provisions relating to Persons Exempted under Section 4(3)(a) or (b) or 5 of the Ordinance

section.name: s120
section.heading: When the Ordinance applies to exempted employee

subsection.content: If a relevant employee who, having been exempted from the Ordinance for a limited period because of the operation of section 4(3)(a) of the Ordinance, continues to be employed by the same employer after that period, the Ordinance applies to the employee and his employer as if the employment had begun immediately after the end of that period. (1 of 2008 s. 22)

If a relevant employee who, having been exempted from the Ordinance because of the operation of section 4(3)(b) of the Ordinance, continues to be employed by the same employer after ceasing to be a member of a provident, pension, retirement or superannuation scheme (however described) of a place outside Hong Kong, the Ordinance applies to the employee and his employer as if the employment had begun on the day on which the employee ceased to be such a member. (1 of 2008 s. 22)

If a relevant employee who, having been exempted from the operation of all or any of the provisions of the Ordinance by virtue of an exemption granted under section 5 of the Ordinance, continues to be employed by the same employer after ceasing to be so exempted, the Ordinance applies to the employee and his employer as if the employment had begun on the day on which the employee ceased to be so exempted. (1 of 2008 s. 22)

section.name: s121
section.heading: When the Ordinance applies to exempted self-employed person

subsection.content: If a self-employed person who, having been exempted from the Ordinance for a limited period because of the operation of section 4(3)(a) of the Ordinance, continues to be self-employed after that period, the Ordinance applies to the person as if the self-employment had begun immediately after the end of that period. (1 of 2008 s. 23)

If a self-employed person who, having been exempted from the Ordinance because of the operation of section 4(3)(b) of the Ordinance, continues to be self-employed after ceasing to be a member of a provident, pension, retirement or superannuation scheme (however described) of a place outside Hong Kong, the Ordinance applies to the person as if the self-employment had begun on the day on which he ceased to be such a member. (1 of 2008 s. 23)

section.name: s122
section.heading: Participating employer to calculate relevant income and pay mandatory contributions

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ContributionDay
def.leadIn: contribution day (供款日)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a mandatory contribution payable by a participating employer in respect of a relevant employee who is a casual employee (other than a casual employee who is a member of an industry scheme), means, subject to subsection (4), the 10th day after the last day of— (29 of 2002 s. 14; E.R. 4 of 2019)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the relevant contribution period; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the contribution period during which the permitted period ends,

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a mandatory contribution payable by a participating employer in respect of a relevant employee (other than a casual employee), means, subject to subsection (4), the 10th day after the last day of— (E.R. 4 of 2019)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a calendar month within which the relevant contribution period ends; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the month during which the permitted period ends,

paragraph.continued: whichever is the later; and (29 of 2002 s. 14)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a mandatory contribution payable by a participating employer in respect of a casual employee who is a member of an industry scheme, means, subject to subsection (4), whichever of the following days is agreed by the participating employer and the approved trustee of the scheme concerned as the contribution day for that employee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the 10th day after the last day of the relevant contribution period; or (2 of 2002 s. 21)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the next working day (other than a Saturday) immediately subsequent to the payment of relevant income for the relevant contribution period; (L.N. 223 of 2000; 2 of 2002 s. 21)

subsection.def: contribution period (供款期) has the same meaning as in section 7A(10) of the Ordinance;
permitted period (特准限期) has the meaning given by section 7AA(11) of the Ordinance. (1 of 2015 s. 32)

subsection.leadIn: A participating employer of a registered scheme must, for each contribution period, calculate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of relevant income of each relevant employee of the employer who is a member of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of mandatory contributions that the employer must pay to the approved trustee of the scheme in respect of each relevant employee under section 7A(1)(a) or (2)(a) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount of mandatory contributions that the employer must deduct from the relevant income of each relevant employee and pay to the approved trustee of the scheme in respect of each of them under section 7A(1)(b) or (2)(b) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 7A(8) of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a participating employer in respect of a relevant employee who is a casual employee must, for each contribution period, pay the mandatory contribution to the approved trustee of the scheme in respect of each relevant employee on or before the contribution day;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a participating employer in respect of a relevant employee (other than a casual employee) must, for each contribution period which ends in the previous calendar month or during the permitted period, as the case may be, pay the mandatory contribution to the approved trustee of the scheme in respect of each relevant employee on or before the contribution day. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

subsection.content: If the contribution day as determined under subsection (1) for the purposes of subsection (3)(a) or (b) is a day specified in subsection (5) (excluded day), the contribution day is to be the next following day that is not an excluded day (40 of 2021 s. 66)

subsection.leadIn: The day specified for subsection (4) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Saturday;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a public holiday;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a gale warning day or black rainstorm warning day as defined by section 71(2) of Cap. 1; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (6)—a day on which the electronic MPF system (or any part of it) is suspended under section 19J or 19L(1)(a) or (b) of the Ordinance. (40 of 2021 s. 66)

subsection.content: Subsection (5)(d) does not apply to the payment of a mandatory contribution to the approved trustee of a registered scheme unless the suspension affects the payment. (40 of 2021 s. 66)

section.editorialNote:
__________________Editorial Notes:
1. For the transitional provision relating to the amendments made by the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Amendment) (No. 2) Ordinance 2002 (29 of 2002), see section 15 of the Amendment Ordinance.
2. For transitional provision relating to the amendments made by the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Amendment) Ordinance 2015 (1 of 2015), see Part 8 of the Amendment Ordinance.

section.name: s123
section.heading: Participating employer to provide remittance statement to approved trustee

subsection.content: When paying contributions to the approved trustee of a registered scheme, a participating employer must ensure that the contributions are accompanied by a remittance statement, in a form specified or approved by the Authority, for the contribution period or periods to which the contributions relate.

subsection.leadIn: The remittance statement must include the following information—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the amount of mandatory contributions paid under section 7A(1)(a) or (2)(a) of the Ordinance by the employer to the scheme in respect of that employee for that period or each of those periods, as the case may be;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount of mandatory contributions deducted from the employee’s relevant income under section 7A(1)(b) or (2)(b) of the Ordinance by the employer and paid to the scheme for that period or each of those periods, as the case may be;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the amount of voluntary contributions (if any) deducted from the employee’s relevant income by the employer and paid to the scheme for that period or each of those periods, as the case may be;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the amount of voluntary contributions (if any) paid by the employer to the scheme in respect of the employee for that period or each of those periods, as the case may be.

subsection.content: A participating employer in an industry scheme is not required to comply with this section in relation to a casual employee who is a member of the scheme if the employer and the approved trustee of the scheme has agreed that the contribution day in relation to the mandatory contribution payable by the employer in respect of the employee is the working day mentioned in paragraph (b)(ii) of the definition of contribution day in section 122(1). (2 of 2002 s. 21)

editorialNote.content: Editorial Note:For the transitional provision relating to the amendments made by the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Amendment) (No. 2) Ordinance 2002 (29 of 2002), see section 15 of the Amendment Ordinance.

section.name: s125
section.heading: Reporting of relevant income and basis of contribution of self-employed person

subsection.content: This section applies to a self-employed person who is a member of a registered scheme. (40 of 2021 s. 67)

subsection.leadIn: The self-employed person must, at least 30 days before the end of each financial period of the scheme, report to the trustee— (40 of 2021 s. 67)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s relevant income for the payment of mandatory contributions to the scheme for the next financial period of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the person will contribute to the scheme on a yearly or monthly basis for the next financial period of the scheme.

section.name: s126
section.heading: When relevant income of self-employed person is taken to be maximum level of that income
section.leadIn: A self-employed person’s relevant income for a financial period of the registered scheme concerned is taken to be equal to the maximum level of relevant income if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person pays for that period a mandatory contribution equal to the prescribed percentage of the maximum level of relevant income; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person does not produce evidence of relevant income in accordance with section 127(1)(c) or fails to satisfy the approved trustee of the scheme as referred to in section 128(1)(c).

section.name: s127
section.heading: Relevant income of self-employed person who produces evidence of that income

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a self-employed person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of whose business profits tax is payable under the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112) in relation to a financial period of the registered scheme concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who claims to have a relevant income less than the maximum level of relevant income for that period; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: who produces evidence of the person’s relevant income for that period to the approved trustee of the scheme.

subsection.content: If the evidence produced to the approved trustee of the scheme by the self-employed person in relation to the relevant financial period consists of, or includes, the most recent notice of assessment of the person, then, subject to subsection (3), the person’s relevant income for that period is taken to be an amount equal to the amount stated as assessable profits in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period between the date on which the most recent notice of assessment of the self-employed person was issued and the date on which the person produces the notice as evidence of the person’s relevant income exceeds 24 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person objects under section 64 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112) to the assessment stated in that notice or has appealed against that assessment in accordance with section 66, 67, 68, 69 or 69A of that Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the person may declare as relevant income for that period an amount equal to the person’s assessable profits for the preceding year of assessment calculated in accordance with Part 4 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112). (E.R. 1 of 2012)

subsection.content: If the evidence produced to the approved trustee of the scheme by the self-employed person in relation to the relevant financial period does not consist of, or include, the most recent notice of assessment of the person, the person may declare as the person’s relevant income for that period an amount equal to the person’s assessable profits for the preceding year of assessment calculated in accordance with Part 4 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112).
If the self-employed person makes the declaration referred to in subsection (3) or (4), the person’s relevant income for the relevant financial period is taken to be the amount so declared.

section.name: s128
section.heading: Relevant income of self-employed person who does not produce evidence of that income

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a self-employed person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of whose business profits tax is payable under the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112) in relation to a financial period of the registered scheme concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who claims to have a relevant income less than the maximum level of relevant income for that period; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: who satisfies the approved trustee of the scheme concerned that the person is unable to provide the approved trustee with evidence of the person’s relevant income for that period.

subsection.leadIn: If the self-employed person contributes to the scheme on a yearly basis for the relevant financial period, the person’s relevant income for that period is taken to be an amount calculated in accordance with the following formula—

tr.td: represents the amount to be determined; and

represents the basic allowance within the meaning of section 28 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112) as in force at the time when the person’s relevant income is reported in accordance with section 125; and
represents the number of whole calendar months within the relevant financial period.

subsection.leadIn: If the self-employed person contributes to the scheme on a monthly basis for the relevant financial period, the person’s relevant income per month for that period is taken to be an amount calculated in accordance with the following formula—

tr.td: represents the amount to be determined; and

represents the basic allowance within the meaning of section 28 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112) as in force at the time when the person’s relevant income is reported in accordance with section 125.

section.name: s129
section.heading: Adjustments in calculating relevant income of self-employed person

subsection.leadIn: If, for the purposes of section 127, a self-employed person’s relevant income for a financial period of the registered scheme concerned is taken to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an amount equal to the amount stated as assessable profits in a notice of assessment and the amount of those profits relates to a period shorter or longer than 12 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an amount equal to the person’s assessable profits calculated in accordance with Part 4 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112) and the amount so calculated relates to a period shorter or longer than 12 months, (E.R. 1 of 2012)

subsection.continued: that income is to be calculated by making proportional adjustments to the amount concerned.

subsection.content: If, in accordance with section 127, the amount of the relevant income of a self-employed person who contributes to the scheme concerned on a monthly basis is calculated by reference to a financial period, the relevant income is to be adjusted by dividing that amount so calculated by the number of whole months in the period.

If a self-employed person carries on business as member of a partnership, then, for the purposes of sections 127 and 128, the person’s relevant income for a financial period of the scheme concerned is to be calculated by making proportional adjustments according to the person’s share of the profits of the business for that period.

subsection.leadIn: If a self-employed person carries on 2 or more businesses, then, for the purposes of sections 127 and 128, the person’s relevant income for a financial period of the scheme concerned is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an amount equal to the aggregate of the person’s relevant income derived from all of those businesses for that period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if any of those businesses is carried on by the person in partnership with others, an amount equal to the aggregate of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person’s relevant income calculated by making proportional adjustments according to the person’s share of the profits in respect of the businesses during that period; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the person’s relevant income in respect of all of the other businesses of the person during that period.

subsection.leadIn: If a self-employed person who contributes to a registered scheme on a yearly basis becomes a scheme member otherwise than on the first day of a financial period of the scheme, the amount that the person is required to contribute to the scheme for that period is to be calculated in accordance with the following formula—

tr.td: represents the amount to be determined; and
represents the mandatory contribution that would be payable for the whole of the financial period of the scheme in which the person became a member; and
represents the number of days within the period, beginning with the day on which the person became a member of the scheme and ending with the last day of that financial period.

section.name: s130
section.heading: Net loss sustained in respect of self-employed person’s business

subsection.content: This section applies to a self-employed person who is a member of a registered scheme if the business or businesses carried on by the person have sustained a net loss in relation to a financial period of the registered scheme. (40 of 2021 s. 69)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The self-employed person may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make a written statement to the approved trustee of the registered scheme declaring that the business or businesses carried on by the person have sustained a net loss in relation to the financial period of the registered scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: discontinue payment of mandatory contributions until the relevant income in respect of the person’s business or businesses exceeds the minimum level of relevant income. (40 of 2021 s. 69)

subsection.content: The net loss must be calculated in accordance with Part 4 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112). (E.R. 1 of 2012)

section.name: s131
section.heading: Contribution period and contribution day in respect of self-employed person

subsection.content: In relation to a self-employed person who contributes to a registered scheme on a yearly basis, the prescribed period for the purposes of the definition of contribution period in section 7C(2) of the Ordinance is the year that coincides with each financial period of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a self-employed person who contributes to a registered scheme on a monthly basis, the prescribed period for the purposes of the definition of contribution period in section 7C(2) of the Ordinance is each period commencing on the day in each month specified by the person in a written notice given to the approved trustee of the scheme concerned as the commencing day and ending on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the day before the corresponding day in the following month; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is no corresponding day in the following month or if the commencing day is the last day of a month, the last day of the following month.

subsection.content: The last day of the period prescribed in this section in relation to a self-employed person is the contribution day for the self-employed person. (1 of 2015 s. 34)
However, if that last day is a day specified in subsection (5), the next following day that is not a day so specified is the contribution day for the self-employed person. (1 of 2015 s. 34)

subsection.leadIn: The day specified for subsection (4) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Saturday;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a public holiday; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a gale warning day or black rainstorm warning day as defined by section 71(2) of Cap. 1; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (6)—a day on which the electronic MPF system (or any part of it) is suspended under section 19J or 19L(1)(a) or (b) of the Ordinance. (40 of 2021 s. 70)

subsection.content: Subsection (5)(d) does not apply to a contribution required to be paid by a self-employed person under section 7C of the Ordinance unless the suspension affects the payment. (40 of 2021 s. 70)

editorialNote.content: For transitional provision relating to the amendments made by the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Amendment) Ordinance 2015 (1 of 2015), see Part 8 of the Amendment Ordinance.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Duty of Approved Trustees and Recovery of Arrears

section.name: s135A
section.heading: Approved trustee to take actions required by Authority
section.content: An approved trustee of a registered scheme must take such action as may be reasonably required by the Authority in connection with the recovery of arrears or a contribution surcharge.

section.name: s136
section.heading: Authority to give notice to defaulter

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority reasonably believes that a person has failed to pay a mandatory contribution (or any part of it) or any amount of a contribution surcharge liable to be paid by the employer or person under section 18(2) of the Ordinance (outstanding sum), the Authority must as soon as practicable serve on the person (defaulter) a written notice requiring the defaulter to do all or any of the following— (1 of 2008 s. 68; 40 of 2021 s. 73)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to pay the outstanding sum to the approved trustee of the registered scheme concerned within the period specified in the notice; (1 of 2008 s. 68)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (regardless of whether the outstanding sum relates only to a contribution surcharge liable to be paid by the defaulter) to give to the Authority an explanation with respect to the failure to pay the arrears; (40 of 2021 s. 73)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to comply with any other requirement specified in the notice;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the defaulter is a participating employer, to lodge with the trustee, when paying the outstanding sum, a remittance statement.

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply if there is any of the circumstances specified in subsection (1A). (40 of 2021 s. 73)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The circumstances referred to in subsection (1AA) are as follows— (40 of 2021 s. 73)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority is reasonably satisfied that the defaulter cannot be located;

paragraph.name: b
f
paragraph.content: service of a notice under subsection (1) is not reasonably practicable in all the circumstances of the case. (1 of 2008 s. 68)

subsection.content: A person who, having been served a notice requiring an explanation under subsection (1)(b), fails to comply with the requirement within the period specified in the notice is taken to have acknowledged that the person has failed to pay the arrears.
A defaulter must comply with a requirement of a notice served on the defaulter under this section.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Other Duties of Employers and Self-employed Persons

section.name: s139
section.heading: Participating employer to give monthly pay-records to scheme members

subsection.leadIn: A participating employer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prepare a pay-record for each month in respect of each relevant employee of the employer who is a scheme member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure that the record is given to the employee not later than 7 working days after the payment, or the last payment if there is more than 1 payment, of mandatory contributions during the month concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A pay-record must contain the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of each payment of relevant income paid to the employee by the employer during the month;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of each mandatory contribution paid by the employer in respect of the employee during the month;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount of each mandatory contribution deducted in respect of the employee during the month;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the amount (if any) of each voluntary contribution paid by the employer in respect of the employee during the month;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the amount (if any) of each voluntary contribution deducted in respect of the employee during the month;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the date on which the contributions were paid to the approved trustee of the registered scheme concerned.

subsection.content: A pay-record must either be in writing or in a form that enables the information contained in it to be easily read by the employees.

A participating employer in an industry scheme is not required to comply with this section in relation to a casual employee who is a member of the scheme if the employer and the approved trustee of the scheme have agreed that the contribution day in relation to the mandatory contribution payable by the employer in respect of the employee is the working day mentioned in paragraph (b)(ii) of the definition of contribution day in section 122(1). (2 of 2002 s. 21; E.R. 4 of 2019)

section.name: s140
section.heading: Employers to keep records

subsection.content: An employer of a relevant employee must ensure that a record of each payment of relevant income made by the employer to the employee is kept in respect of the employee until at least 6 months after the payment is made.

subsection.leadIn: The record referred to in subsection (1) must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the total amount of each payment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the respective amounts of the items making up each payment as described under paragraph (a) of the definition of relevant income in section 2 of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date on which each payment is made.

subsection.content: An employer of a relevant employee must ensure that a record of the date on which the employee’s employment with the employer began is kept in respect of the employee until at least 6 months after that employment ceases.

subsection.leadIn: An employer of a relevant employee who is a member of a registered scheme must ensure that records of the following particulars are kept in respect of the employee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and correspondence address of the employee, and the date on which the employee’s employment with the employer began; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the notice of election (if any) given by the employee under section 4 or 15 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Exemption) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. B); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the notice (if any) given by the employee authorizing the employer to deduct voluntary contributions from the relevant income of the employee for payment to the registered scheme.

subsection.content: The records referred to in subsection (4) must be kept until at least 6 months after the employee’s employment with the employer ceases.

An employer of a relevant employee who is a member of a registered scheme must ensure that the information required to be included in the remittance statement is kept in respect of the employee until at least 7 years after the date of the remittance statement.
An employer is not required to comply with this section in relation to a casual employee who is a member of an industry scheme.
An employer who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with this section commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s141
section.heading: Participating employer to respond to inquiries relating to registered scheme
section.content: A participating employer must, as soon as reasonably practicable after receiving an inquiry from a relevant employee of the employer regarding contributions that have been made or are required to be made in respect of the employee to a registered scheme, reply to the inquiry. The reply may be given orally unless the employee requires it to be given in writing.

section.name: s142
section.heading: Self-employed person to notify trustee of change of particulars
section.content: A self-employed person who is a member of a registered scheme must give written notice to the approved trustee of the scheme of any change of the person’s residential address, business address, electronic mail address (if any), telephone number or facsimile number (if any) within 30 days of the change.

section.name: s143
section.heading: Participating employer to notify trustee of certain information

subsection.content: A participating employer in a registered scheme must give written notice to the approved trustee of the scheme of the date of payment of relevant income of each relevant employee of the employer when the employee becomes a scheme member.

subsection.leadIn: A participating employer in a registered scheme must give written notice to the approved trustee of the scheme of any change of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the employer’s business address, electronic mail address (if any), telephone number or facsimile number (if any); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the residential address, electronic mail address (if any), telephone number or date of payment of relevant income of each relevant employee of the employer; and (29 of 2002 s. 14)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the employer’s name, (29 of 2002 s. 14; 1 of 2015 s. 35; 40 of 2021 s. 76)

subsection.continued: within 30 days of the change.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, a reference to a relevant employee does not include a reference to a casual employee who is a member of an industry scheme.

section.name: s143A
section.heading: Participating employer to give certain document or information to employee

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an approved trustee of a registered scheme—

subparagraph.content: is required under the Ordinance (including its subsidiary legislation) to give (however described) a member of the scheme any document or information; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the member concerned is an employee of a participating employer; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the trustee, with the consent of the participating employer, gives (however described) the employer, or arranges to give (however described) to the employer, the document or information.

subsection.content: The participating employer must ensure that the document or information is given to the employee within 7 working days after the employer has received the document or information from the trustee.

section.name: s144
section.heading: Definitions

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: transferee trustee (承轉受託人) means the approved trustee of the registered scheme to which the accrued benefits of a member of another registered scheme are to be transferred in accordance with an election made under this Part;

transferor trustee (轉移受託人) means the approved trustee of the registered scheme from which the accrued benefits of a member of the scheme are to be transferred, whether to another registered scheme or to another account within the same scheme, in accordance with an election made under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to an election made under this Part or under any particular provision in this Part includes a reference to an election taken to have been so made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a person being notified under this Part or under any particular provision in this Part includes a reference to the person taken to have been so notified.

section.name: s145
section.heading: Transfer of accrued benefits of member of employer sponsored scheme

subsection.leadIn: If accrued benefits of an employee are held in a contribution account in an employer sponsored scheme and the employee ceases to be employed by the participating employer concerned in the scheme, the employee must, subject to subsection (2), elect to have those benefits transferred to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an account in a master trust scheme nominated by the employee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an existing account of the employee in an industry scheme.

subsection.content: If an employee who is a member of an employer sponsored scheme ceases to be employed by the participating employer concerned in the scheme and subsequently becomes employed by another employer, the employee may, instead of making an election under subsection (1), elect to have the employee’s accrued benefits in the scheme transferred to the contribution account in the registered scheme in which the new employer is participating in relation to that employee.
An election under subsection (1) is effective when written notice of the election is given to the transferee trustee concerned.
An election under subsection (2) is effective when written notice of the election is given to the transferee trustee concerned or to the employee’s new employer.
As soon as practicable after the new employer has received a notice of election given under subsection (4), that employer must give written notice of the election to the transferee trustee concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The former employer must, by written notice given within 30 days after the cessation of employment of the casual employee concerned, inform the approved trustee of the employer sponsored scheme concerned— (29 of 2002 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of the employee’s cessation of employment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of the date on which the employment ceased.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (6) is taken to have been complied with if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information to be included in the notice referred to in that subsection is included in the remittance statement that the former employer lodged with the approved trustee of the employer sponsored scheme concerned immediately following the casual employee’s cessation of employment; and (29 of 2002 s. 14)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that remittance statement is lodged with the approved trustee within 30 days after the cessation of employment.

subsection.name: 7A
subsection.leadIn: The former employer must in respect of a relevant employee (other than a casual employee)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the remittance statement that the former employer is required to lodge with the approved trustee of the employer sponsored scheme concerned in respect of the contribution period that ends immediately following the employee’s cessation of employment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by written notice given to the approved trustee of the employer sponsored scheme concerned no later than the date on which that remittance statement is required to be lodged,

subsection.continued: inform the approved trustee—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: of the employee’s cessation of employment; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: of the date on which the employment ceased. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

subsection.name: 7B
subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (6) or (7A) is not complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the approved trustee of the employer sponsored scheme concerned is satisfied that the former employer cannot be located or refuses to comply with subsection (6) or (7A),

subsection.continued: the approved trustee may accept a written notice given by the employee concerned as evidence of the employee’s cessation of employment and the date of cessation. (1 of 2008 s. 24)

subsection.name: 7C
subsection.content: The notice referred to in subsection (7B) must be given by way of a statutory declaration in a form approved by the Authority. (1 of 2008 s. 24)

subsection.leadIn: If an employee fails to notify an election in accordance with this section within 3 months after the approved trustee of the employer sponsored scheme concerned has been notified, by the employee’s former employer or by the employee, that the employee has ceased to be employed by the former employer— (1 of 2008 s. 24)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the employee is taken at the end of that period to have elected to have the employee’s accrued benefits in the scheme transferred to a personal account in a master trust scheme nominated by the transferor trustee concerned and administered by either that trustee or another approved trustee; and (11 of 2009 s. 15)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the transferor trustee is taken at the end of that period to have been notified of the election.

subsection.content: This section shall not apply to or in relation to an election mentioned in section 12A(6A) and (6B) of the Ordinance or any concomitant transfer of the accrued benefits of an employee. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

section.name: s145A
section.heading: Disposal of unclaimed benefits in employer sponsored scheme

subsection.content: Subsection (2) applies in relation to accrued benefits in an employer sponsored scheme.

If, after having taken the reasonable steps specified in the operating rules, the approved trustee of the scheme is unable to locate the person who is entitled to the accrued benefits, the trustee must, within the period specified in subsection (3), transfer the benefits to a master trust scheme nominated by the employer concerned or in accordance with the governing rules.
The period is the period of 6 months beginning on the date immediately after the date of completion of the reasonable steps mentioned in subsection (2).

section.name: s146
section.heading: Transfer of accrued benefits of member of master trust scheme or industry scheme (other than a casual employee who is a member of an industry scheme)

subsection.leadIn: If accrued benefits of an employee are held in a contribution account in a master trust scheme and the employee ceases to be employed by the participating employer concerned in the scheme, the employee may elect to have those benefits transferred to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: another account in the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an account in another master trust scheme nominated by the employee; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an existing account of the employee in an industry scheme.

subsection.leadIn: If accrued benefits of an employee are held in a contribution account in an industry scheme and the employee ceases to be employed by the participating employer concerned in the scheme, the employee may elect to have those benefits transferred to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an account in a master trust scheme nominated by the employee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an existing account of the employee in another industry scheme.

subsection.content: If an employee who is a member of a master trust scheme or an industry scheme ceases to be employed by the participating employer concerned in the scheme and subsequently becomes employed by another employer, the employee may also elect to have the employee’s accrued benefits in the scheme transferred to the contribution account in the registered scheme in which the new employer is participating in relation to that employee.

subsection.leadIn: An election under subsection (1) is effective—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an account referred to in paragraph (a) of that subsection, when written notice of the election is given to the transferor trustee concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an account referred to in paragraph (b) or (c) of that subsection, when written notice of the election is given to the transferee trustee concerned.

subsection.content: An election under subsection (2) is effective when written notice of the election is given to the transferee trustee concerned.
An election under subsection (3) is effective when written notice of the election is given to the transferee trustee concerned or to the employee’s new employer.
As soon as practicable after the new employer has received a notice of election given under subsection (6), that employer must give written notice of the election to the transferee trustee concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The former employer must, by written notice given within 30 days after the cessation of employment of the casual employee concerned, inform the approved trustee of the registered scheme concerned— (29 of 2002 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of the employee’s cessation of employment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of the date on which the employment ceased.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (8) is taken to have been complied with if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information to be included in the notice referred to in that subsection is included in the remittance statement that the former employer lodged with the approved trustee of the registered scheme concerned immediately following the casual employee’s cessation of employment; and (29 of 2002 s. 14)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that remittance statement is lodged with the approved trustee within 30 days after the cessation of employment.

subsection.name: 9A
subsection.leadIn: The former employer must in respect of a relevant employee (other than a casual employee)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the remittance statement that the former employer is required to lodge with the approved trustee of the registered scheme concerned in respect of the contribution period that ends immediately following the employee’s cessation of employment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by written notice given to the approved trustee of the registered scheme concerned no later than the date on which that remittance statement is required to be lodged,

subsection.continued: inform the approved trustee—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: of the employee’s cessation of employment; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: of the date on which the employment ceased. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

subsection.name: 9B
subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (8) or (9A) is not complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the approved trustee of the registered scheme concerned is satisfied that the former employer cannot be located or refuses to comply with subsection (8) or (9A),

subsection.continued: the approved trustee may accept a written notice given by the employee concerned as evidence of the employee’s cessation of employment and the date of cessation. (1 of 2008 s. 25)

subsection.name: 9C
subsection.content: The notice referred to in subsection (9B) must be given by way of a statutory declaration in a form approved by the Authority. (1 of 2008 s. 25)

subsection.leadIn: If an employee fails to notify an election in accordance with this section within 3 months after the approved trustee of the registered scheme concerned has been notified, by the employee’s former employer or by the employee, that the employee has ceased to be employed by the former employer— (1 of 2008 s. 25)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the employee is taken at the end of that period to have elected to have the employee’s accrued benefits held in the contribution account concerned in the scheme transferred to a separate personal account in the same scheme; and (11 of 2009 s. 16)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the transferor trustee concerned is taken at the end of that period to have been notified of the election.

subsection.content: This section does not apply to a casual employee who is a member of an industry scheme.

This section shall not apply to or in relation to an election mentioned in section 12A(6A) and (6B) of the Ordinance or any concomitant transfer of the accrued benefits of an employee. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

section.name: s147
section.heading: Transfer of accrued benefits of casual employee who is a member of industry scheme

subsection.leadIn: If accrued benefits of a casual employee are held in a contribution account in an industry scheme and the employee ceases to be employed by the participating employer concerned in the scheme, the employee may elect to have those benefits transferred to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an account in a master trust scheme nominated by the employee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an existing account of the employee in another industry scheme.

subsection.content: If a casual employee who is a member of an industry scheme ceases to be employed by the participating employer concerned in the scheme and subsequently becomes employed by another employer, the employee may also elect to have the employee’s accrued benefits in the scheme transferred to the contribution account in the registered scheme in which the new employer is participating in relation to that employee, but only if that registered scheme is not the industry scheme in which those benefits are currently held.
An election under subsection (1) is effective when written notice of the election is given to the transferee trustee concerned.
An election under subsection (2) is effective when written notice of the election is given to the transferee trustee concerned or to the employee’s new employer.
As soon as practicable after the new employer has received a notice of election given under subsection (4), that employer must give written notice of the election to the transferee trustee concerned.

A casual employee who fails to make an election under this section is taken to have elected not to have the employee’s accrued benefits held in the contribution account concerned in the industry scheme transferred under this section but to retain the benefits in that account.

section.name: s148
section.heading: Transfer of accrued benefits of self-employed person

subsection.leadIn: If accrued benefits of a self-employed person are held in a contribution account in a master trust scheme, the person may, at any time, elect to have those benefits transferred to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an account in another master trust scheme nominated by the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an existing account of the person in an industry scheme; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an account in an industry scheme to which the person is eligible to belong.

subsection.leadIn: If accrued benefits of a self-employed person are held in a contribution account in an industry scheme, the person may, at any time, elect to have those benefits transferred to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an account in a master trust scheme nominated by the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an existing account of the person in another industry scheme; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an account in another industry scheme to which the person is eligible to belong.

subsection.content: If a self-employed person who is a member of a master trust scheme or an industry scheme subsequently becomes employed by an employer, the person may also elect to have the person’s accrued benefits in the scheme transferred to the contribution account in the registered scheme in which the employer is participating in relation to the person.
An election under subsection (1) or (2) is effective when written notice of the election is given to the transferee trustee concerned.
An election under subsection (3) is effective when written notice of the election is given to the transferee trustee concerned or to the person’s employer.
As soon as practicable after the employer has received a notice of election given under subsection (5), that employer must give written notice of the election to the transferee trustee concerned.

subsection.leadIn: If a self-employed person who is a member of a master trust scheme ceases to be self-employed, the person must, by written notice given not later than the next contribution day for the person following the cessation, inform the approved trustee of the scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of the person’s cessation of self-employment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of the date on which the self-employment ceased.

subsection.leadIn: If a self-employed person who is a member of a master trust scheme fails to notify an election in accordance with this section within 3 months after the approved trustee of the scheme concerned has been notified that the person has ceased to be self-employed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is taken at the end of that period to have elected not to have the person’s accrued benefits held in the contribution account concerned in the scheme transferred under this section but to retain the benefits in that account; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the approved trustee is taken at the end of that period to have been notified of the election.

section.name: s148A
section.heading: Transfer of accrued benefits derived from mandatory contributions in respect of current employment to personal accounts

subsection.content: This section does not apply to a case in which an employee has ceased to be employed as referred to in section 145, 146 or 147.

subsection.leadIn: If accrued benefits of an employee are held in one or more than one sub-account referred to in section 78(6)(b) within a master trust scheme or an industry scheme, the employee may, at any time, subject to subsection (4), elect to have all accrued benefits in the sub-account, or in any one or more than one of those sub-accounts, transferred to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a personal account of the employee within the same registered scheme nominated by the employee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a personal account of the employee within another registered scheme, which is a master trust scheme or an industry scheme, nominated by the employee.

subsection.content: If accrued benefits of an employee are held in one or more than one sub-account referred to in section 78(6)(b) within an employer sponsored scheme, the employee may, at any time, subject to subsection (4), elect to have all accrued benefits in the sub-account, or in any one or more than one of those sub-accounts, transferred to a personal account of the employee within a master trust scheme or an industry scheme, nominated by the employee.

subsection.leadIn: An employee may make an election under subsection (2) or (3) in respect of the employee’s sub-account within a registered scheme (or if accrued benefits of the employee are held in more than one such sub-account, whether or not within the same registered scheme, in respect of each of those sub-accounts)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: only once in every calendar year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: more than once in every calendar year in accordance with the governing rules of the registered scheme from which, or within which, the accrued benefits are transferred if those governing rules so provide.

subsection.leadIn: An election under subsection (2) or (3) is effective—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a personal account within a registered scheme referred to in subsection (2)(a), when written notice of the election is given to the transferor trustee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a personal account within a registered scheme referred to in subsection (2)(b) or (3), when written notice of the election is given to the transferee trustee.

section.name: s148B
section.heading: Transfer of accrued benefits derived from mandatory contributions in respect of former employment or former self-employment to contribution accounts or personal accounts

subsection.content: This section does not apply to a case in which an employee has ceased to be employed as referred to in section 145, 146 or 147.

subsection.leadIn: If accrued benefits of an employee are held in one or more than one sub-account referred to in section 78(6)(c) within a master trust scheme or an industry scheme, the employee may, at any time, elect to have all accrued benefits in the sub-account, or in any one or more than one of those sub-accounts, transferred to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: another contribution account of the employee within the same registered scheme nominated by the employee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contribution account of the employee within another registered scheme, nominated by the employee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a personal account of the employee within the same registered scheme nominated by the employee; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a personal account of the employee within another registered scheme, which is a master trust scheme or an industry scheme, nominated by the employee.

subsection.leadIn: If accrued benefits of an employee are held in one or more than one sub-account referred to in section 78(6)(c) within an employer sponsored scheme, the employee may, at any time, elect to have all accrued benefits in the sub-account, or in any one or more than one of those sub-accounts, transferred to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: another contribution account of the employee within the same registered scheme nominated by the employee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contribution account of the employee within another registered scheme, nominated by the employee; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a personal account of the employee within a master trust scheme or an industry scheme, nominated by the employee.

subsection.leadIn: An election under subsection (2) or (3) is effective—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a contribution account within a registered scheme referred to in subsection (2)(a) or (3)(a), when written notice of the election is given to the transferor trustee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a contribution account within a registered scheme referred to in subsection (2)(b) or (3)(b), when written notice of the election is given to the transferee trustee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a personal account within a registered scheme referred to in subsection (2)(c), when written notice of the election is given to the transferor trustee; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to a personal account within a registered scheme referred to in subsection (2)(d) or (3)(c), when written notice of the election is given to the transferee trustee.

section.name: s149
section.heading: Transfer of accrued benefits in personal accounts to contribution accounts or other personal accounts

subsection.leadIn: If accrued benefits of a member of a master trust scheme or an industry scheme are held in one or more than one personal account of the member within the scheme, the member may, at any time, elect to have all accrued benefits in the account, or in any one or more than one of those accounts, transferred to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a contribution account of the member within the same registered scheme nominated by the member;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contribution account of the member within another registered scheme, nominated by the member;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: another personal account of the member within the same registered scheme nominated by the member; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a personal account of the member within another registered scheme, which is a master trust scheme or an industry scheme, nominated by the member.

subsection.leadIn: An election under subsection (1) is effective—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a contribution account within a registered scheme referred to in paragraph (a) of that subsection, when written notice of the election is given to the transferor trustee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a contribution account within a registered scheme referred to in paragraph (b) of that subsection, when written notice of the election is given to the transferee trustee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a personal account within a registered scheme referred to in paragraph (c) of that subsection, when written notice of the election is given to the transferor trustee; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to a personal account within a registered scheme referred to in paragraph (d) of that subsection, when written notice of the election is given to the transferee trustee.

section.name: s149A
section.heading: Transfer of accrued benefits in TVC account in registered scheme

subsection.content: If a scheme member holds a TVC account in a registered scheme, the member may, at any time, elect to have all accrued benefits in the account transferred to another TVC account of the member in another registered scheme which the member is eligible to join.
An election under subsection (1) is effective when written notice of the election is given to the transferee trustee.

section.name: s149B
section.heading: Transfer of accrued benefits in TVC account in employer sponsored scheme

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of an employer sponsored scheme is an employee of a participating employer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accrued benefits are held by the member in a TVC account in the scheme.

subsection.content: The member must, when the member ceases to be employed by the participating employer, elect to have all accrued benefits in the TVC account transferred to another TVC account of the member in a master trust scheme or an industry scheme.
An election under subsection (2) is effective when written notice of the election is given to the transferee trustee.

subsection.leadIn: If a member fails to notify an election in accordance with this section within 3 months after the approved trustee of the employer sponsored scheme concerned has been notified, by the member’s participating employer or by the member, that the member has ceased to be employed by the participating employer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the member is taken at the end of that period to have elected to have all accrued benefits in the scheme transferred to a TVC account in a master trust scheme nominated by the transferor trustee concerned and administered by either that trustee or another approved trustee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the transferor trustee is taken at the end of that period to have been notified of the election.

section.name: s150
section.heading: Transfer by participating employer of employee’s accrued benefits
section.leadIn: If a member of a registered scheme is an employee of a participating employer in the scheme, the employer may elect to have the accrued benefits held in the contribution account in the scheme in respect of the member’s employment with that employer transferred to another registered scheme in which the employer is a participant by giving written notice of the election to the transferee trustee in the event of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the winding up of the first-mentioned scheme under section 34 or 34A of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the restructuring of the first-mentioned scheme under section 34B of the Ordinance; or (29 of 2002 s. 14)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the employer providing notice, personally or through the transferee trustee, of his intention to cease participation in the first-mentioned scheme in respect of that member. (L.N. 223 of 2000)

section.name: s150A
section.heading: Transfer of accrued benefits where section 12A(6A) and (6B) of the Ordinance is applicable
section.leadIn: Where section 12A(6A) and (6B) of the Ordinance is applicable, the new employer may only elect to have the employee’s accrued benefits in the scheme transferred to a registered scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in which the new employer is a participant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by giving written notice of the election to the trustee of the last-mentioned scheme within the permitted period.

section.name: s151
section.heading: Form of election
section.content: An election under this Part must be in a form specified or approved by the Authority.

section.name: s153
section.heading: Duty of approved trustee on being notified of election

subsection.content: A transferee trustee must, as soon as practicable after being notified of an election made under this Part, give written notice of the election to the transferor trustee. For that purpose, the transferee trustee must complete the appropriate portions of the election form and serve the completed form on the transferor trustee.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), the completed form must be served by the transferee trustee on the transferor trustee in the form of an electronic record to an electronic system designated under section 6KA(1) of the Ordinance for use for the purposes of subsection (1) except where—

paragraph.name: a
b
