paragraph.content: the specified person of the registered scheme to which the accrued benefits are transferred, and that of the registered scheme from which the accrued benefits are transferred, are the same person. (16 of 2012 s. 25)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: A fee of the amount prescribed by the regulations is payable for use of the electronic system for the purposes of subsection (1). (16 of 2012 s. 25)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1A) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the electronic system is suspended under section 6KA(5) of the Ordinance from being used for the purposes of subsection (1A); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the suspension takes effect in relation to the transferee trustee or the transferor trustee. (16 of 2012 s. 25)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1A)—
subsection.def: electronic record (電子紀錄) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553);

def.name: SpecifiedPerson
def.leadIn: specified person (指明人士), in relation to a registered scheme, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person appointed or engaged by the approved trustee of the scheme to handle for that trustee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a transfer of accrued benefits of a member of another registered scheme to the scheme in accordance with an election made under this Part; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a transfer of accrued benefits of a member of the scheme from the scheme, whether to another registered scheme or another account within the scheme, in accordance with an election made under this Part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the absence of such an appointment or engagement, the approved trustee of the scheme. (16 of 2012 s. 25)

subsection.content: Within 30 days after being notified of an election as referred to in subsection (1), or if an election is made by an employee who ceases to be employed by the participating employer concerned in a registered scheme, within 30 days after the last contribution day in respect of the employment that has ceased, whichever is the later, the transferor trustee must take all practicable steps to ensure that all the accrued benefits concerned are transferred in accordance with the election.

A transferor trustee who is notified of an election under section 146(4)(a) or (10)(b), 148A(5)(a), 148B(4)(a) or (c) or 149(2)(a) or (c) must, within 30 days after being so notified, or if an election is made by an employee who ceases to be employed by the participating employer concerned in a registered scheme, within 30 days after the last contribution day in respect of the employment that has ceased, whichever is the later, arrange for the accrued benefits concerned to be transferred to a separate account within the same registered scheme in accordance with the election.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: A transferor trustee who is taken to have been notified of an election under section 145(8)(b) must, within 30 days after the end of the period referred to in that section, arrange for the accrued benefits concerned to be transferred to the personal account referred to in section 145(8)(a). (11 of 2009 s. 19)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.content: A transferor trustee who is taken by a particular date to have been notified of an election under section 149B(4)(b) must, within 30 days after that date, arrange for the accrued benefits concerned to be transferred to a TVC account referred to in section 149B(4)(a). (7 of 2019 s. 22)

A person who makes an election under this Part must give to the transferor trustee, and the transferee trustee (if any), such information as is requested by the trustee to enable the transfer to be made.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (2), (3) and (3A)— (11 of 2009 s. 19)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are subject to sections 156 and 157; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are not complied with unless all of the accrued benefits concerned are transferred in accordance with the election made or taken to have been made.

subsection.content: Subsection (3B) is subject to section 157. (7 of 2019 s. 22)
Subsection (3B) is not complied with unless all the accrued benefits concerned are transferred in accordance with the election. (7 of 2019 s. 22)

section.name: s157
section.heading: Approved trustee to comply with Authority’s requirement not to give effect to election etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if a transferor trustee is notified of an election made under this Part or an election to transfer scheme assets and, at the time of the notification— (L.N. 223 of 2000; 40 of 2021 s. 83)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority has served on the transferor trustee a notice requiring that trustee to arrange for an auditor to investigate and to prepare a report under section 30 of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority has served on that trustee a notice notifying the trustee that the Authority intends to conduct an investigation under section 32 of the Ordinance. (40 of 2021 s. 83)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Authority may, by written notice given to the transferor trustee, require the trustee not to give effect to the election. (40 of 2021 s. 83)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: On receiving the notice given under subsection (1A), the transferor trustee must not give effect to the election until the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has given its written consent for the trustee to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has notified the trustee of the results of the valuation of the scheme assets carried out in relation to the investigation or the report. (40 of 2021 s. 83)

subsection.content: Within 30 days after the Authority has given its written consent for the transferor trustee to give effect to the election, or has notified the transferor trustee of the results of the valuation of the scheme assets, that trustee must take all reasonably practicable steps to ensure that all of the accrued benefits concerned are transferred in accordance with the election and the results of that valuation of the scheme assets.

section.name: s157B
section.heading: Register of members of registered schemes who have established and maintained personal accounts within master trust schemes or industry schemes

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must establish and maintain a register of members of registered schemes who have established and maintained personal accounts within master trust schemes or industry schemes for the purposes of enabling—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who made a request under subsection (4) to ascertain in accordance with that subsection any information contained in the register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority to notify under subsection (5) a member of a registered scheme of any information contained in the register.

subsection.content: The register may be in the form determined by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The register must, in relation to each member of a registered scheme who has established and maintained a personal account, specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the member’s name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the member’s Hong Kong Identity Card number or travel document number;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of personal accounts established and maintained by the member;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the name and business address of the approved trustee of the master trust scheme or industry scheme within which the personal account, or each of the personal accounts, is established and maintained; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the name and telephone number of the contact person designated by the approved trustee, or each of the approved trustees, for the purpose of providing information relating to the personal account concerned.

subsection.leadIn: If requested by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person (the relevant person);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the authorized representative of a person; (1 of 2015 s. 38)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: a person entitled in priority to the administration of the estate of a deceased person; or (1 of 2015 s. 38)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the personal representative of a deceased person,

subsection.continued: the Authority must, as soon as reasonably practicable, provide, without charge, to the person who made the request any information contained in the register about the personal accounts (if any) established and maintained within any master trust scheme or industry scheme by the relevant person, the person who authorized the representative to make the request or the deceased person.

subsection.content: If the Authority considers appropriate, it may, on its own initiative, notify a member of a registered scheme in writing of any information contained in the register about the personal accounts (if any) established and maintained within any master trust scheme or industry scheme by the member.

section.name: s158
section.heading: Definition

subsection.leadIn: In this Part— (1 of 2015 s. 39)
subsection.def: claim (申索) means a claim for the payment of the accrued benefits of a scheme member or a former scheme member in accordance with section 15 of the Ordinance; (1 of 2015 s. 39)
registered Chinese medicine practitioner (註冊中醫) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549). (1 of 2015 s. 39)

subsection.content: A member who has an illness that is likely to reduce the life expectancy of the member to 12 months or less has a terminal illness for the purposes of this Part. (1 of 2015 s. 39)

division.name: D1
division.heading: Claims for Payment of Accrued Benefits

section.name: s159
section.heading: Claim for payment on attaining retirement age

subsection.content: A member of a registered scheme who has reached the retirement age may lodge with the approved trustee of the scheme a claim for payment of the member’s accrued benefits in accordance with this section. The claim must be in a form specified or approved by the Authority.
The claim must be accompanied by evidence satisfactory to the trustee that the member has reached the retirement age.

section.name: s160
section.heading: Claim for payment on attaining early retirement age

subsection.content: A member of a registered scheme who wishes to be paid the member’s accrued benefits under section 15(2) of the Ordinance must, in addition to complying with that subsection, lodge with the approved trustee of the scheme a claim for payment of the member’s accrued benefits in accordance with this section. The claim must be in a form specified or approved by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The claim must be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: evidence satisfactory to the trustee that the member has reached the early retirement age specified in Schedule 7 to the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statutory declaration as required by section 15(2) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s161
section.heading: Claim for payment on death

subsection.content: If a member of a registered scheme has died, a personal representative of the member may lodge with the approved trustee of the scheme a claim for payment of the member’s accrued benefits in accordance with this section. The claim must be in a form specified or approved by the Authority.
A claim made by a person who purports to be the personal representative of the relevant scheme member must be accompanied by evidence satisfactory to the trustee of the person’s status as such.

section.name: s162
section.heading: Additional classes of persons entitled to be paid accrued benefits

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 15(3) of the Ordinance, a member of a registered scheme who has not reached the retirement age is, subject to this Part, entitled to be paid by the approved trustee of the scheme, as a lump sum, the whole of the member’s accrued benefits in the scheme if the member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has permanently departed from Hong Kong or is about to depart from Hong Kong permanently; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is totally incapacitated; or

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: has a terminal illness; or (1 of 2015 s. 40)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is a member to whom subsection (2) applies.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to a member if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the member’s accrued benefits kept in the scheme as at the date of the claim for payment of those benefits made by him under section 165 do not exceed $5,000; and (1 of 2008 s. 27)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as at the date of the claim, at least 12 months have elapsed since the contribution day in respect of the latest contribution period for which a mandatory contribution is required to be made to that scheme or to any other registered scheme by or in respect of the member; and (1 of 2008 s. 27)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the member does not have accrued benefits kept in any other registered scheme.

section.name: s163
section.heading: Claim for payment on ground of permanent departure from Hong Kong

subsection.content: A member of a registered scheme who, before reaching the retirement age, wishes to be paid the member’s accrued benefits in the scheme on the ground that the member has departed, or is about to depart, from Hong Kong permanently, must lodge with the approved trustee of the scheme a claim for payment of the member’s accrued benefits in accordance with this section. The claim must be in a form specified or approved by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The claim must be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statutory declaration by the claimant that the claimant departed, or will depart, from Hong Kong permanently on a specified date; and (1 of 2008 s. 38)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: evidence satisfactory to the approved trustee of the scheme that the claimant is permitted to reside in a place other than Hong Kong.

subsection.content: A person who has been paid accrued benefits from a registered scheme on the ground that, on a specified date, the person has departed, or was about to depart, from Hong Kong permanently is not, before reaching the retirement age, entitled to be paid the member’s accrued benefits from the same or another registered scheme on the ground that, on a later date, the person purports to have departed, or to be about to depart, from Hong Kong permanently.

If accrued benefits held in an account of a member of a registered scheme have been paid to the member on the ground that, on a specified date, the member has departed, or was about to depart, from Hong Kong permanently, the member is not, before reaching the retirement age, precluded from making a further claim on the ground of permanent departure on that specified date if the claim is for the payment of other accrued benefits of the member held in another account in that scheme, or for the payment of other accrued benefits of that member in another registered scheme.
Subsections (2) and (3) apply to a further claim referred to in subsection (6). (1 of 2008 s. 38; 40 of 2021 s. 89)

section.name: s164
section.heading: Claim for payment on ground of total incapacity

subsection.content: A member of a registered scheme who, before reaching the retirement age, wishes to be paid the member’s accrued benefits in the scheme on the ground of total incapacity must lodge with the approved trustee of the scheme a claim for payment of the member’s accrued benefits in accordance with this section. The claim must be in a form specified or approved by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: If a claim is made by a scheme member of a registered scheme who was, immediately before becoming totally incapacitated, a relevant employee, the approved trustee of the scheme may pay the member’s accrued benefits to that member, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the member can provide the trustee with a medical certificate, in a form specified or approved by the Authority and issued by a registered medical practitioner or registered Chinese medicine practitioner, certifying that the member is permanently unfit to perform the kind of work specified in the certificate for a reason so specified; and (16 of 2006 s. 33)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the member satisfies the trustee that the member was engaged in that kind of work under a contract of employment immediately before becoming totally incapacitated; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the member can provide the trustee with a declaration by the member, in a form specified or approved by the Authority, stating that that contract of employment for that particular kind of work has been terminated. (1 of 2015 s. 41)

subsection.leadIn: If a claim is made by a scheme member of a registered scheme who was, immediately before becoming totally incapacitated, a self-employed person, the approved trustee of the scheme may pay the member’s accrued benefits to that member, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the member can provide the trustee with a medical certificate, in a form specified or approved by the Authority and issued by a registered medical practitioner or registered Chinese medicine practitioner, certifying that the member is permanently unfit to perform the kind of work specified in the certificate for a reason so specified; and (16 of 2006 s. 33)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the member satisfies the trustee that the member was engaged in that kind of work as a self-employed person immediately before becoming totally incapacitated.

subsection.leadIn: If a claim is made by a scheme member of a registered scheme who was, immediately before becoming totally incapacitated, unemployed, the approved trustee of the scheme may pay the member’s accrued benefits to that member, but only if the member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: can provide the trustee with a medical certificate, in a form specified or approved by the Authority and issued by a registered medical practitioner or registered Chinese medicine practitioner, certifying that the member is permanently unfit to perform the kind of work specified in the certificate for a reason so specified; and (16 of 2006 s. 33)

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: can provide the trustee with a declaration by the member, in a form specified or approved by the Authority, stating that that contract of employment for that particular kind of work has been terminated. (29 of 2002 s. 14; 1 of 2015 s. 41)

subsection.leadIn: If a claim is made by a scheme member of a registered scheme who, immediately before becoming totally incapacitated, ceased to be a self-employed person, the approved trustee of the scheme may pay the member’s accrued benefits to that member, but only if the member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: can provide the trustee with a medical certificate, in a form specified or approved by the Authority and issued by a registered medical practitioner or registered Chinese medicine practitioner, certifying that the member is permanently unfit to perform the kind of work specified in the certificate for a reason so specified; and (16 of 2006 s. 33)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: satisfies the trustee that the member was last engaged in that kind of work as a self-employed person before becoming totally incapacitated. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

subsection.content: A reference in this section to a medical certificate issued by a registered Chinese medicine practitioner does not include a medical certificate so issued before the commencement* of section 33 of the Certification for Employee Benefits (Chinese Medicine) (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2006 (16 of 2006). (16 of 2006 s. 33)

section.name: s164A
section.heading: Claim for payment on ground of terminal illness

subsection.content: A member of a registered scheme who, before reaching the retirement age, wishes to be paid the member’s accrued benefits on the ground of terminal illness must lodge with the approved trustee of the scheme a claim for payment of the member’s accrued benefits in accordance with this section.
The claim must be in a form specified or approved by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: If a claim is made by a scheme member of a registered scheme who has a terminal illness, the approved trustee of the scheme may only pay the member’s accrued benefits to that member if the member can provide a medical certificate, in a form specified or approved by the Authority, that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is issued by a registered medical practitioner or registered Chinese medicine practitioner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: states that, in the practitioner’s opinion, the member falls within section 158(3); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is dated not earlier than 12 months before the date on which the claim is lodged.

section.name: s165
section.heading: Claim for payment of small balance

subsection.content: A member of a registered scheme who wishes to be paid the member’s accrued benefits before reaching the retirement age and who claims to be a member to whom section 162(2) applies must lodge with the approved trustee of the scheme a claim for payment of the member’s accrued benefits in accordance with this section. The claim must be in a form specified or approved by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The claim must be accompanied by a statutory declaration by the member that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the member does not intend to become employed or self-employed; and (1 of 2015 s. 43)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as at the date of the claim, at least 12 months have elapsed since the contribution day in respect of the latest contribution period for which a mandatory contribution is required to be made to that scheme or to any other registered scheme by or in respect of the member; and (1 of 2008 s. 28)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the member does not have accrued benefits kept in any other registered scheme.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving a claim made by a scheme member under this section, the trustee must pay the member’s accrued benefits to that member if satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the member’s accrued benefits kept in the scheme as at the date of the claim do not exceed $5,000; and (1 of 2008 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as at the date of the claim, at least 12 months have elapsed since the contribution day in respect of the latest contribution period for which a mandatory contribution is required to be made to that scheme or to any other registered scheme by or in respect of the member; and (1 of 2008 s. 28)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the member does not have accrued benefits kept in any other registered scheme.

section.name: s165A
section.heading: Claim for payment by committee of estate appointed under Mental Health Ordinance

subsection.content: This section applies if a committee of the estate is appointed in relation to the property and affairs of a member of a registered scheme.

subsection.leadIn: The committee of the estate may, as if it were the member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: lodge with the approved trustee of the registered scheme a claim for payment of the accrued benefits of the member; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continue with a claim initiated by the member.

subsection.content: This section does not apply in relation to a claim made under section 161.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: committee of the estate (產業受託監管人) means a committee of the estate appointed under section 11 of the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136).

section.name: s166
section.heading: Approved trustee to ensure payment of accrued benefits within certain periods

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1A) and (1B) apply if— (1 of 2015 s. 45)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the claimant satisfies the trustee that the claimant is entitled to be paid those benefits.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: If the benefits are paid in a lump sum, the trustee must ensure that the benefits are paid to the claimant not later than whichever is the later of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 30 days after the date on which the claim is lodged;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 30 days after the contribution day in respect of the last contribution period that ends before the claim is lodged. (1 of 2015 s. 45)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: If the benefits are paid by instalments, the trustee must, unless otherwise agreed between the trustee and the claimant, ensure that each instalment is paid to the claimant no later than 30 days after the date on which the claimant instructs the trustee to pay that instalment. (1 of 2015 s. 45)
This section is subject to section 167.

section.name: s167
section.heading: Approved trustee to comply with Authority’s requirement not to make payment etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if a member of a registered scheme has lodged with the approved trustee of the scheme a claim for payment of the member’s accrued benefits in accordance with this Part or if the approved trustee has received a request for other payment of scheme assets out of the scheme and, at the time of the lodgement— (L.N. 223 of 2000; 40 of 2021 s. 90)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority has served on the trustee a notice requiring the trustee to arrange for an auditor to investigate and to prepare a report under section 30 of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority has served on the trustee a notice notifying the trustee that the Authority intends to conduct an investigation under section 32 of the Ordinance. (L.N. 223 of 2000; 40 of 2021 s. 90)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Authority may, by written notice given to the approved trustee, require the trustee not to make the payment. (40 of 2021 s. 90)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: On receiving the notice given under subsection (1A), the approved trustee must not make the payment until the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has given its written consent for the trustee to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has notified the trustee of the results of the valuation of the scheme assets carried out in relation to the investigation or the report. (40 of 2021 s. 90)

subsection.leadIn: Within 30 days after the Authority has given its written consent for the trustee to make the payment, or has notified the trustee of the valuation of the scheme assets, the trustee must— (40 of 2021 s. 90)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the accrued benefits payable to the member (including the arrears and contribution surcharge (if any) paid to the trustee), and determine those benefits by reference to the valuation (if any); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: pay to the member the accrued benefits so determined.

section.name: s168
section.heading: Approved trustee to ensure claimant provided with benefit payment statement
section.leadIn: When the approved trustee of a registered scheme pays accrued benefits to a claimant in accordance with this Part, the trustee concerned must ensure that the claimant is provided with a benefit payment statement containing the following information— (1 of 2015 s. 46)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the trustee, the name of the scheme and the account number of the account from which the payment is made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name and address of the scheme member concerned;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the total amount of the accrued benefits paid to the claimant and the date on which the benefits were paid to the claimant;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.leadIn: if any contribution or contribution surcharge was outstanding at the time of the payment—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the fact that a contribution or surcharge is outstanding; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount of the contribution or surcharge if known to the trustee; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the contribution or surcharge was irrecoverable, the fact that it is irrecoverable and the amount concerned if known to the trustee; and (1 of 2015 s. 46)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other information as may be specified for the purposes of this section by guidelines. (1 of 2015 s. 46)

section.name: s169
section.heading: Payment of outstanding contribution or contribution surcharge after payment of accrued benefits
section.content: If, after paying accrued benefits to a claimant in accordance with section 166, the approved trustee of a registered scheme receives an outstanding contribution or contribution surcharge for the benefit of the claimant, the trustee must pay the contribution or surcharge to the claimant as soon as practicable after receiving it.

section.name: s169A
section.heading: Treatment of accrued benefits that are unclaimed or that have not been paid

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to any accrued benefits of a scheme member in a registered scheme that have not been claimed or paid in accordance with the Ordinance or the governing rules (specified benefits).
For a registered scheme that is not an employer sponsored scheme, the approved trustee of the scheme must continue to retain the specified benefits in the scheme.
Subject to section 12A of the Ordinance and the governing rules, the specified benefits retained in a registered scheme continue to vest in the scheme member concerned.

section.name: s172C
section.heading: Register of scheme members who have unclaimed benefits to be kept

subsection.content: The Authority must establish and maintain a register of scheme members of a registered scheme who have unclaimed benefits in the scheme.
The register may be in such form, and contain such information, as the Authority may determine.
The register is to be kept at the head office of the Authority in Hong Kong.
The register is to be made available for inspection to enable a person who may be entitled to benefits in a registered scheme to ascertain whether he has any unclaimed benefits in the scheme.
Any member of the public is entitled, without charge, to inspect the register during ordinary business hours of the Authority.

section.name: s175
section.heading: Offences
section.content: An approved trustee who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with section 164(2) or (4), 164A(3), 165(3), 167 or 169 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

section.name: s176
section.heading: Definitions

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: administrator (管理人) means a person or persons appointed in accordance with this Part to act as an administrator of the compensation fund or, if no such person is appointed, means the Authority;

net asset value (淨資產值), in relation to the assets of a registered scheme, means the amount by which the total assets of the scheme exceed its total liabilities as shown in the balance sheet, made out in accordance with section 81, in respect of the immediately preceding financial period of the scheme.

subsection.content: If the Authority is the administrator, a provision of this Part requiring the administrator to consult the Authority is to be construed as if the requirement has been omitted.

division.name: D1
division.heading: Establishment and Administrator of Compensation Fund

section.name: s177
section.heading: Establishment of compensation fund

subsection.content: There is established for the purposes of section 17 of the Ordinance a compensation fund to be known as the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Compensation Fund.
The administrator of the compensation fund may fix any period of 12 months to be the financial year of the compensation fund.
The administrator of the compensation fund may, after consulting the Authority, vary the financial year of the compensation fund.

section.name: s178
section.heading: Appointment of administrator of compensation fund

subsection.content: The Authority may appoint one or more competent persons to act as the administrator of the compensation fund.
The appointment of a person under this section is subject to terms and conditions and for a period specified by the Authority in the document by which the person is appointed.

section.name: s179
section.heading: Functions of administrator
section.leadIn: The functions of the administrator are as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to administer the compensation fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to make good losses in respect of accrued benefits caused by misfeasance or illegal conduct as determined by the Court.

section.name: s180
section.heading: What compensation fund comprises
section.leadIn: The compensation fund consists of the following—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: all other money lawfully paid into the compensation fund.

section.name: s181
section.heading: Compensation fund to be kept in separate bank account
section.leadIn: The administrator must ensure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that at least one separate account is opened at a bank located in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that all money paid to the compensation fund is credited to the account; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that all money so credited is kept in the account until invested or applied in accordance with this Part.

section.name: s182
section.heading: Administrator may invest surplus funds
section.content: The administrator may, after consulting the Authority, invest money held in the compensation fund that is not immediately required for the purposes of the compensation fund in any manner in which trustees may invest trust funds.

section.name: s183
section.heading: What payments may be made from compensation fund

subsection.content: The administrator may pay from the compensation fund only payments of the kind specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The payments referred to in subsection (1) are as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of all claims (including costs) allowed by the Court in accordance with section 17B of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all legal and other expenses incurred in investigating or defending claims made under this Part;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the expenses incurred by the administrator in administering the compensation fund, including remunerating persons employed by the administrator in relation to the compensation fund;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: all other money payable out of the compensation fund in accordance with this Part.

section.name: s184
section.heading: Accounts and audit of compensation fund

subsection.leadIn: The administrator must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep proper accounting records of all transactions entered into in respect of the compensation fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 3 months after the end of each financial year of that fund, prepare financial statements in respect of that fund for that year.

subsection.content: The administrator must appoint an accounting practice unit to audit the accounting records kept, and the financial statements prepared, in respect of the compensation fund.

subsection.leadIn: The auditor appointed by the administrator must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: audit the accounting records of the compensation fund and the financial statements prepared in respect of the compensation fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prepare a report on those records and statements; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not later than 2 months after those financial statements are prepared, deliver the report to the administrator.

subsection.content: The administrator must, within 14 days after each report was delivered to them, give to the Authority a copy of the report in accordance with this section, together with the relevant financial statements.
Subsection (4) does not apply if the Authority is the administrator.

The administrator must, on being requested to do so by a member of the public, make available to the member a copy of the financial statements prepared in respect of the compensation fund for its immediately preceding financial year and a copy of the auditor’s report on those statements.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Legal Proceedings to Establish Claims for Compensation

section.name: s185
section.heading: Application to Court
section.leadIn: An application to the Court for the purposes of section 17B of the Ordinance must specify the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the registered scheme concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of loss of accrued benefits in the scheme due to misfeasance or illegal conduct;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the value of scheme assets net of such losses in paragraph (b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: particulars of the investigation of the claim conducted under section 17A(4) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other information relevant to determining the application.

section.name: s186
section.heading: Administrator to pay compensation to approved trustee

subsection.content: If the Court makes an order under section 17C of the Ordinance for the award of compensation, the administrator must pay the compensation to such person as is specified in the order.

subsection.leadIn: The compensation must be paid to the trustee within 3 months after either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the end of the period within which an appeal may be made against the determination of the Court; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an appeal against the determination is lodged within that period and not subsequently withdrawn, the date on which the matter is finally determined.

section.name: s187
section.heading: Compensation to include interest

subsection.content: If the Court makes an order under section 17C of the Ordinance for the award of compensation, the administrator must add interest to the compensation.

subsection.leadIn: The interest is to be calculated—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the same rate as allowed for a judgment debt from time to time under section 49 of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4); and (31 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on and from the day on which they found that the loss was incurred until the day on which payment is made in accordance with section 186.

section.name: s188
section.heading: Amount of levy payable for compensation fund
section.content: For the purposes of section 17 of the Ordinance, the prescribed rate of the levy payable by the approved trustee of a registered scheme is 0.03% of the net asset value of the scheme assets.

section.name: s189
section.heading: Approved trustee to pay levy to administrator of compensation fund
section.content: Subject to section 191A, the approved trustee of a registered scheme must, before the deadline for each financial period of the scheme, pay to the administrator of the compensation fund the amount of levy for the immediately preceding financial period. The amount is to be calculated at the rate prescribed by section 188.

section.name: s190
section.heading: Consequences of failure to pay compensation fund levy
section.content: If an amount of levy is not paid before the deadline referred to in section 189, the Authority may, by proceedings brought in a court of competent jurisdiction, recover the amount as a debt due to the Authority.

section.name: s191
section.heading: Authority to publish rate of levy and other particulars

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must publish in the Gazette or in some other publications a notice specifying—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the rate of levy prescribed under section 188; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period within which the approved trustee of a registered scheme must pay the levy in accordance with section 189. (L.N. 122 of 2012)

subsection.content: The Authority may include in the notice any other information relating to the compensation fund that it thinks appropriate.

section.name: s191A
section.heading: Exemption of approved trustee from payment of compensation fund levy

subsection.leadIn: If a report prepared under section 184(3)(b) for a financial year of the compensation fund shows that the net asset value of the fund exceeds $1.4 billion as at the end of that financial year, the Authority must by notice (exemption notice) published in the Gazette exempt the approved trustee of a registered scheme from paying the levy in accordance with section 189 for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the financial period of the registered scheme beginning on or after a date specified in the exemption notice, which date must not be later than 2 months after publication of the exemption notice in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each subsequent financial period of the registered scheme.

subsection.content: The exemption notice must be published in the Gazette as soon as practicable after a copy of the report is given to the Authority under section 184(4) or, if the Authority is the administrator, after the report is delivered to the administrator under section 184(3)(c).

The Authority is not required to grant the exemption under subsection (1) if the Authority has reason to believe that the net asset value of the compensation fund would likely fall below $1 billion as at or before the end of the next financial year of the fund and has consulted the Financial Secretary on its intention of not granting the exemption.
An exemption granted under subsection (1) remains in force until it is revoked under section 191B(1).
If an exemption granted under subsection (1) is in force, the Authority is not required to grant another exemption under that subsection.
An exemption notice is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s191B
section.heading: Revocation of exemption

subsection.content: If a report prepared under section 184(3)(b) for a financial year of the compensation fund shows that the net asset value of the fund is below $1 billion as at the end of that financial year, the Authority must by notice (revocation notice) published in the Gazette revoke the exemption granted under section 191A(1).

The revocation notice must be published in the Gazette as soon as practicable after a copy of the report is given to the Authority under section 184(4) or, if the Authority is the administrator, after the report is delivered to the administrator under section 184(3)(c).

The Authority is not required to revoke the exemption under subsection (1) if the Authority has reason to believe that the net asset value of the compensation fund would likely exceed $1.4 billion as at or before the end of the next financial year of the fund and has consulted the Financial Secretary on its intention of not revoking the exemption.

subsection.leadIn: If the exemption is revoked under subsection (1), the approved trustee of a registered scheme must pay the levy in accordance with section 189 for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the financial period of the registered scheme beginning on or after a date specified in the revocation notice, which date must not be later than 2 months after publication of the revocation notice in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each subsequent financial period of the registered scheme.

subsection.content: The revocation of the exemption does not revive the obligation to pay any levy not payable under the exemption.
A revocation notice is not subsidiary legislation.

division.name: D1
division.heading: Voluntary Winding Up of Employer Sponsored Schemes

section.name: s192
section.heading: Definitions
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: application (申請) means an application made under section 34(2) of the Ordinance to the Authority for its consent to the voluntary winding up of an employer sponsored scheme;
scheme assets (計劃資產) includes the funds of each constituent fund of the registered scheme concerned.

section.name: s193
section.heading: Circumstances in which employer sponsored scheme may be wound up voluntarily
section.leadIn: The circumstances in which an employer sponsored scheme may be wound up under section 34 of the Ordinance are as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the only participating employer or the only remaining participating employer ceases to participate in the scheme or gives notice to the approved trustee of the scheme that the employer intends to cease to participate in the scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the only participating employer or the only remaining participating employer is a natural person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if there is a change of ownership of the business of that employer, whether by transfer or otherwise; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the person dies; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: on the occurrence of an event that entitles a creditor to present a bankruptcy petition against the person; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: if the person is, under the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136), found by the Court to be of unsound mind and incapable of managing himself or herself and his or her affairs; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the only participating employer or the only remaining participating employer is a body corporate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if there is a change of ownership of the body corporate, whether by acquisition of the company’s shares, a transfer of the assets of the body corporate or otherwise; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on the commencement of the winding up of the body corporate;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where the only participating employer or the only remaining participating employer is a partnership, if the partnership is dissolved (without being reconstituted because of the death, retirement or withdrawal of a partner or the admission of a new partner).

section.name: s194
section.heading: Application for Authority’s consent

subsection.content: Participating employers are prescribed as a class of persons for the purposes of section 34(2) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 34(3) of the Ordinance, the information that must be included in an application is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement specifying the reasons for the winding up of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement specifying the assets and liabilities of the scheme as at a date not earlier than 7 days before the application was made.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 34(3) of the Ordinance, the documents that must accompany an application are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statutory declaration that complies with subsection (4); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a winding up proposal that complies with subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: The statutory declaration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must be to the effect that, as a result of having conducted an inquiry into the affairs of the scheme, the approved trustee of the scheme is satisfied either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that all existing liabilities (including obligations to scheme members) can be met from the scheme assets; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that there are no scheme assets, and no liabilities (including obligations to scheme members) that have to be met from the scheme assets; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must be signed—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the trustee is or includes a company, by at least 2 directors of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the trustee consists wholly of natural persons, by at least 2 of those persons, one of whom must be an independent trustee.

subsection.leadIn: The winding up proposal must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not there are any scheme assets and, if there are, what arrangements have been made for the realization and disposal of scheme assets; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether or not there are any members of the scheme and, if there are, what arrangements (if any) have been made for the transfer of the accrued benefits of scheme members to another registered scheme.

section.name: s195
section.heading: Consent of Authority to winding up of employer sponsored scheme

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may consent to the voluntary winding up of an employer sponsored scheme without appointing a liquidator if, on receiving an application, the Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there are no scheme assets to be realized or disposed of; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there are any such assets, appropriate arrangements have been made for their realization and disposal; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there are no remaining scheme members; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if there are remaining scheme members, appropriate arrangements have been made for those members’ accrued benefits to be transferred to another registered scheme acceptable to the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may consent to the voluntary winding up of an employer sponsored scheme subject to the appointment of a liquidator if, on receiving an application, the Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there are scheme assets, and appropriate arrangements have not been made for their realization and disposal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there are remaining scheme members, and appropriate arrangements have not been made for those members’ accrued benefits to be transferred to another registered scheme acceptable to the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: In giving its consent to the voluntary winding up of an employer sponsored scheme, the Authority may impose such reasonable conditions as to the conduct of the winding up as it considers appropriate. However, if the Authority proposes to appoint a liquidator to conduct the winding up of the scheme, it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must consult the applicant before the appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, as a condition of giving that consent, require the participating employer concerned to produce to the Authority a performance guarantee with respect to the payment of the liquidator’s fees and the expenses incurred in winding up the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: The performance guarantee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be issued in writing by an authorized financial institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must impose an obligation on the authorized financial institution to indemnify the liquidator against any loss sustained by the liquidator as a result of a failure by the participating employer concerned to pay the liquidator’s fees and the expenses incurred in winding up the scheme.

subsection.content: The winding up of an employer sponsored scheme commences on the date on which notice of the consent is given to the applicant under subsection (6) or, if a later date is specified in the notice, on that later date.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after giving its consent, the Authority must give written notice of the consent to the applicant and, if the applicant is not the approved trustee of the scheme concerned, to that trustee. The notice must specify—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the Authority has appointed a liquidator to conduct the winding up, the name and address of the liquidator and the terms and conditions of the liquidator’s appointment; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date on which the winding up is to commence.

subsection.leadIn: Within 7 days after being given notice of the Authority’s consent to the winding up of the scheme, the applicant must publish in at least 2 newspapers circulating in Hong Kong a notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the effect that the scheme is being wound up and that the Authority has given its consent to the winding up under section 34 of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specifying any conditions imposed by the Authority in granting its consent to the winding up; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if a liquidator has been appointed to conduct the winding up, specifying the name and address of the liquidator; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: specifying the date on which the winding up commenced.

subsection.continued: One of the newspapers must be a newspaper that is printed in the Chinese language and the other newspaper or one of the other newspapers must be a newspaper that is printed in the English language.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant must, within 7 days after the date on which the notice is published, serve a copy of that notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if there are any remaining scheme members, on each of those members; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the applicant is not the approved trustee of the scheme, on that trustee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the applicant is not the participating employer concerned, on that employer.

section.name: s196
section.heading: Appointment of liquidator

subsection.content: On appointing a liquidator to conduct the voluntary winding up of an employer sponsored scheme, the Authority must give written notice of the appointment to the liquidator.
If the office of the liquidator becomes vacant for any reason, the Authority may appoint another person to fill the vacancy.

section.name: s197
section.heading: Effect of winding up employer sponsored scheme

subsection.content: After the commencement of the voluntary winding up of an employer sponsored scheme, a person can no longer become a member of the scheme and an employer can no longer become a participant in the scheme.

If any mandatory contributions or voluntary contributions are paid to the scheme after 3 months from the commencement of the winding up of the scheme, the approved trustee of the scheme or, if a liquidator has been appointed to conduct the winding up, the liquidator must transfer those contributions to the Authority to be dealt with in a manner consistent with the Ordinance.

section.name: s198
section.heading: Effect of appointment of liquidator

subsection.leadIn: On the appointment of a liquidator to conduct the winding up of an employer sponsored scheme—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the approved trustee, and any persons concerned with the administration of the scheme (including any service provider appointed or engaged by that trustee for the purposes of the scheme) cease to be responsible for the administration of the scheme and, except as directed or authorized by the liquidator, cease to have any function to exercise or perform in relation to the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: A liquidator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must take all reasonably practicable steps to take possession of the scheme assets as soon as practicable after being appointed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may require any person to whom this subsection applies to pay, deliver or transfer to the liquidator, within such reasonable period as the liquidator may specify, any scheme assets in the possession of that person.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies to the following persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the approved trustee of the scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any service provider appointed or engaged for the purposes of the scheme;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other person who, in the opinion of the liquidator, appears to be concerned with the administration of the scheme, whether directly or indirectly;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the participating employer concerned;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any employee or agent of a person referred to in paragraphs (a) to (d).

subsection.content: A person who, except at the direction or with the authority of the liquidator, purports to exercise or perform a function in relation to the administration of an employer sponsored scheme after the appointment of a liquidator in respect of the scheme commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement of a liquidator made under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, in any document given to the liquidator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes a statement that the person knows to be false or misleading in a material respect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: recklessly makes a statement which is false or misleading in a material respect,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

section.name: s199
section.heading: Powers of liquidator on winding up

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the beneficial interests of the members with respect to their accrued benefits in an employer sponsored scheme, a liquidator appointed in respect of the winding up of the scheme may exercise all or any of the following powers—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the power to realise the scheme assets by public auction or private contract, with the power to transfer those assets to any person (including the power to sell them in parcels);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the power to bring or defend any legal proceedings in the name of the approved trustee of the scheme and on behalf of the trustee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the power to enter into a compromise or arrangement with respect to any debt, claim or liability relating to the scheme assets;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: the power to do such other things as may be necessary for winding up the scheme, including the power to transfer the scheme assets to another registered scheme and, to pay or transfer members’ accrued benefits, in accordance with the Ordinance.

subsection.content: The liquidator may, from time to time, request the Authority to give directions to the liquidator with respect to the conduct of the winding up of the scheme concerned.
The Authority must give directions to the liquidator in response to a request made under subsection (2).

section.name: s200
section.heading: Duty of liquidator to report to Authority etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, from time to time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the liquidator to report to the Authority on matters relating to the winding up of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give directions to the liquidator as to the conduct of the winding up of the scheme.

subsection.content: The liquidator is required to comply with a requirement or direction made or given by the Authority under subsection (1).
The Authority may remove from office a liquidator who fails, without reasonable excuse, to comply with the requirement or direction.
The liquidator must ensure that the liquidator’s fees and the expenses incurred in winding up the scheme are borne by the participating employer concerned.

section.name: s201
section.heading: Disposal of scheme assets on winding up

subsection.leadIn: In a voluntary winding up of an employer sponsored scheme, the scheme assets are to be applied in the following order of priority—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if, at the commencement of the winding up, there are any remaining scheme members whose accrued benefits have not previously been transferred to another registered scheme or paid in accordance with the Ordinance, the transfer or payment of those benefits in accordance with arrangements approved by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: Any surplus that remains after satisfying all outstanding liabilities referred to in subsection (1) is to be distributed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in accordance with the governing rules of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if those rules do not make provision for the distribution of such a surplus, to the participating employer concerned.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Winding Up of Registered Schemes Generally

section.name: s202
section.heading: Appointment of liquidator
section.leadIn: A person may be appointed as liquidator under section 34 or 34A of the Ordinance only if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has consented in writing to the appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a certified public accountant as defined by section 2 of the Professional Accountants Ordinance (Cap. 50), or is an approved trustee; and (23 of 2004 s. 56)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is not an undischarged bankrupt.

section.name: s203
section.heading: Circumstances in which persons are exempted from operation of the Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 4(3)(a) of the Ordinance, the circumstances in which a person is exempt from the Ordinance are when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: permission is given to the person to land or remain in Hong Kong for the purposes of employment under the conditions of stay imposed in accordance with section 11 of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period during which the person is given permission to remain in Hong Kong does not exceed 13 months. (2 of 2002 s. 21)

subsection.content: If the original period during which the person is given permission to remain in Hong Kong for the purposes of employment is extended in accordance with section 11 of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115), and the original period and the extended period together exceed 13 months, the person ceases to be exempt from the Ordinance from the end of 13 months after the beginning of the original period. (2 of 2002 s. 21)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 4(3)(b) of the Ordinance, the circumstances in which a person is exempt from the Ordinance are when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: permission is given to the person to land or remain in Hong Kong for the purposes of employment under the conditions of stay imposed in accordance with section 11 of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is a member of a provident, pension, retirement or superannuation scheme established outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to employment includes a reference to self-employment.

section.name: s203A
section.heading: Defence for offence relating to section 78, 164(2) or (4), 164A(3), 165(3), 167 or 169

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under section 94, for failing to perform a duty imposed under section 78 (non-performance), to establish that the non-performance was only because of the failure of the system operator of the electronic MPF system to discharge the system operator’s duties.

It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under section 175, for failing to comply with a relevant provision (non-compliance), to establish that the non-compliance was only because of the failure of the system operator of the electronic MPF system to discharge the system operator’s duties.

subsection.leadIn: A person charged with an offence mentioned in subsection (1) or (2) is taken to have established a matter that needs to be established for the purpose of the relevant defence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue with respect to the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant provision (相關條文) means section 164(2) or (4), 164A(3), 165(3), 167 or 169.

section.name: s204
section.heading: Appeal period
section.content: For the purposes of section 35(1) of the Ordinance, the prescribed period is 2 months after the date on which the Authority gives written notice of its decision.

section.name: s205
section.heading: Prescription of financial penalty

subsection.content: The provisions specified in column 2 of Schedule 4 are prescribed for the purposes of sections 45B and 45C of the Ordinance.
The amounts of financial penalties set out in columns 4, 5 and 6 of Schedule 4 are financial penalties prescribed in relation to the provisions in column 2 of Schedule 4.

section.name: s206
section.heading: How notices or other documents are to be given for purposes of the Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: Unless a contrary intention appears from the context of the Ordinance, a notice or other document to be given for the purposes of the Ordinance shall be given— (29 of 2002 s. 14; 1 of 2015 s. 49; 40 of 2021 s. 99)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a person other than a body corporate or partnership—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivering it to the person personally; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by sending it by post in a letter addressed to the person at the person’s usual place of residence or business or, if the person’s address is unknown, addressed to the person’s last known place of residence or business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a body corporate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivering it to any place in Hong Kong at which the body carries on business and handing it to a person apparently concerned with the management of, or apparently employed by, the body; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by sending it to the body by post by letter addressed to the body at its registered office in Hong Kong or at any place in Hong Kong at which the body carries on business; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a partnership—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by delivering it to any place in Hong Kong at which the partnership carries on business and handing it to a person apparently concerned with the management of, or apparently employed by, the partnership; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by sending it to the partnership by post by letter addressed to the partnership at any place in Hong Kong at which the partnership carries on business. (1 of 2015 s. 49)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: A notice or other document to be given for the purposes of the Ordinance is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, taken to have been given if it is sent by post to the last known place of business or residence of the person to whom the notice or document is required to be given. (1 of 2015 s. 49)

subsection.leadIn: Unless a contrary intention appears from the context of the Ordinance, a notice or other document is also taken to have been given for the purposes of the Ordinance if— (40 of 2021 s. 99)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is sent to the recipient by facsimile transmission or electronic mail at the recipient’s facsimile number or electronic mail address last known to the sender, or by other means specified by the recipient, and a record generated by the means of transmission establishes that the notice or document was so sent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is made available to the recipient on a website, and the recipient is notified of its availability by the operation of paragraph (a) or subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c); (40 of 2021 s. 99)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is made available to the recipient by any other electronic means (other than the means mentioned in paragraph (c)), and the recipient is notified of its availability by the operation of paragraph (a) or subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c); or (40 of 2021 s. 99)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is made available to the recipient by means of an electronic system designated by the Authority under section 6KA(1) of the Ordinance for use for the purposes of this subsection. (1 of 2015 s. 49)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: Subsection (2)(a), (b) and (ba) does not apply unless the recipient has given consent to being given the notice or document by the means described in that subsection. (1 of 2015 s. 49; 40 of 2021 s. 99)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2A), if— (1 of 2015 s. 49; 40 of 2021 s. 99)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notice or document is made available to the recipient other than by an electronic MPF system; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the recipient is a participating employer or a member (or a prospective participating employer or a prospective member) of a registered scheme,

subsection.continued: prior consent must be given in the terms specified by the Authority. (40 of 2021 s. 99)

subsection.content: This section does not apply to summonses. (1 of 2008 s. 48)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: give (給予), in relation to a notice or document, includes serve, lodge, send, deliver, provide or otherwise make available. (1 of 2015 s. 49)

section.name: s206A
section.heading: How documents are to be served for purposes of section 153(1) or 154(2A)(b)

subsection.content: This section applies to a document served for the purposes of section 153(1) or 154(2A)(b) in the form of an electronic record to an electronic system designated under section 6KA(1) of the Ordinance for use for the purposes of section 153(1) or 154(2A)(b). (1 of 2015 s. 50)

subsection.leadIn: The document is taken to have been served if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the document in the form of an electronic record is accepted by the electronic system; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the electronic system generates a record confirming the acceptance.

subsection.content: The document is taken to have been served at the time specified in the record mentioned in subsection (2)(b) as the time at which the document in the form of an electronic record is accepted by the electronic system.

section.name: s207
section.heading: Rate of contribution surcharge
section.content: The contribution surcharge is an amount equal to 5 per cent of the amount of the arrears.

section.name: s208
section.heading: Transitional provisions for 2021 Amendment Ordinance
section.content: The transitional provisions specified in Schedule 5 have effect.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Definitions

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule—
subsection.def: call warrant (認購權證) means a security that confers a right (but does not impose an obligation) on its holder to purchase from the issuer of the security the ordinary shares of a company or companies or corporation or corporations on or before a specified date at a specified price or prices, whether or not the issuer retains the right to elect to give a cash payment equal to the excess (if any) of the value of those ordinary shares over the exercise price without the holder of the warrant receiving those shares from the issuer; (L.N. 223 of 2000; 5 of 2002 s. 407; L.N. 145 of 2006)
collective investment scheme (集體投資計劃) has the meaning assigned to it by the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); (29 of 2002 s. 14)
constituent fund (成分基金) means a constituent fund of a registered scheme;

def.name: EffectiveExposure
def.leadIn: effective exposure (有效風險) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in relation to financial futures contracts, the full value of the contracts; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to other kinds of securities and investments, the market value of the securities and investments;

subsection.def: hedging (對沖) has the meaning given by subsection (3);
index-tracking collective investment scheme (緊貼指數集體投資計劃) means a collective investment scheme which has the sole investment objective of tracking a particular market index; (29 of 2002 s. 14)

put warrant (認沽權證) means a security that confers a right (but does not impose an obligation) on its holder to sell to the issuer of the security the ordinary shares of a company or companies or corporation or corporations on or before a specified date at a specified price or prices, whether or not the issuer retains the right to elect to give a cash payment equal to the excess (if any) of the exercise price over the value of those ordinary shares without the holder of the warrant delivering those shares to the issuer; (L.N. 223 of 2000; 5 of 2002 s. 407; L.N. 145 of 2006)

def.name: Warrant
def.leadIn: warrant (認股權證) means a security that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confers a right (but does not impose an obligation) on its holder to subscribe for the ordinary shares of the issuer of the warrant on or before a specified date at a specified price or prices; or (5 of 2002 s. 407)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a call warrant; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is a put warrant. (5 of 2002 s. 407; L.N. 145 of 2006)

subsection.content: For the purposes of the definition of effective exposure in subsection (1), “delta” is the expected increase or decrease in the market value of the financial option contract given a 1 unit change in the value of the underlying investment. (E.R. 4 of 2019)

For the purposes of this Schedule, a financial futures contract, a financial option contract, a currency forward contract or a put warrant is acquired for hedging purposes if it is of a kind that will have the effect of reducing the impact on existing assets of a constituent fund, or on assets acquired for the fund at the same time as the contract or warrant is acquired, of a possible reduction in the value of those assets.

For the purposes of this Schedule, a security is to be listed on an approved stock exchange or an approved futures exchange if the requirements specified by the Authority for this purpose are complied with in relation to the security. (L.N. 145 of 2006)

section.name: s2
section.heading: General restrictions—spread of investments

subsection.content: The total amount invested in securities and other permissible investments (excluding an investment permitted under section 11 of this Schedule) issued by any one person must not exceed 10 per cent of the total funds of a constituent fund. (L.N. 145 of 2006)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), where the funds of a constituent fund are invested in a relevant investment, the amount invested in the relevant investment is also to be taken into account in the manner specified by the Authority for the purposes of this subsection when ascertaining the total amount of the funds invested in the securities and other permissible investments issued by the person who issues the underlying investment of the relevant investment. (L.N. 145 of 2006)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: Where the repayment of principal or the payment of interest in respect of a debt security issued by a person is guaranteed by another person, the debt security is, for the purposes of subsection (1), to be regarded as also issued by the other person. (L.N. 145 of 2006)
Not more than 10 per cent of the shares of a particular class, or the total amount of debt securities, issued by one person may be acquired for the purposes of a constituent fund. (L.N. 145 of 2006)

Notwithstanding subsections (1) and (2), where part or all of the funds of a constituent fund are invested in accordance with section 6(b)(i), (ii) or (iii) of this Schedule, then subsections (1) and (2) shall not apply to that part or all of the funds of the constituent fund so invested. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

Notwithstanding subsections (1) and (2), where a constituent fund has the sole investment objective of tracking a particular market index, then those subsections shall not apply to the constituent fund if the approved trustee has the prior approval of the Authority that those subsections shall not apply to the constituent fund. (29 of 2002 s. 14)
In granting an approval mentioned in subsection (4), the Authority may impose such conditions with respect to the constituent fund concerned as the Authority considers appropriate. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: has decided that it is appropriate to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: amend any conditions imposed under subsection (5) or this subsection with respect to a constituent fund; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: impose conditions with respect to a constituent fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: has given to the approved trustee concerned—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: not less than 30 days’ advance notice of its decision, specifying its grounds; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an opportunity to make written representations as to why the conditions should not be amended or imposed,

subsection.continued: then the Authority may, by written notice served on the approved trustee—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: amend any conditions imposed under subsection (5) or this subsection with respect to the constituent fund; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: impose conditions with respect to the constituent fund. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: RelevantInvestment
def.leadIn: relevant investment (有關投資項目) means a permissible investment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the value of which is determined by reference to the value of another investment; and

paragraph.name: b

def.name: UnderlyingInvestment
def.leadIn: underlying investment (基礎投資項目), in relation to a relevant investment, means an investment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by reference to the value of which the value of the relevant investment is determined; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which is specified, or belongs to a class of investment specified, by the Authority as an underlying investment for the purposes of this definition. (L.N. 145 of 2006)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Restrictions on borrowing and lending of securities

subsection.content: Securities must not be borrowed for the purposes of a constituent fund (whether for the purposes of selling the securities short or any other purposes).

subsection.leadIn: Securities held in respect of a constituent fund may be lent only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the lending is in respect of fully-paid up shares listed on an approved stock exchange; and (5 of 2002 s. 407)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the requirements in section 52 of this Regulation are complied with.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Restrictions on borrowing of money
section.leadIn: Money may be borrowed for the purposes of a constituent fund only if it is borrowed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for the purpose of enabling accrued benefits to be paid to or in respect of scheme members, and then only if—

subparagraph.name: i
