subparagraph.content: the amount borrowed (together with any other borrowings made for the same purpose) does not exceed 10 per cent of the market value of the fund at the time of the borrowing; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the borrowing is not part of a series of borrowings; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the period of the borrowing does not exceed 90 days; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for the purpose of settling a transaction relating to the acquisition of securities or other investments in respect of the fund, and then only if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amount borrowed (together with any other borrowings made for the same purpose) does not exceed 10 per cent of the market value of the fund at the time of the borrowing; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the borrowing is not part of a series of borrowings; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the period of the borrowing does not exceed 7 working days; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: at the time the decision to enter into the transaction was made, it was unlikely that the borrowing would be necessary.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Restrictions on acquiring securities that carry an unlimited liability

subsection.content: A security involving the assumption of a potential liability that is unlimited must not be acquired for the purposes of a constituent fund.
A liability must not be incurred in respect of a constituent fund in excess of the total value of the accrued benefits of the scheme members in relation to the fund.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Permissible investments: general restrictions
section.leadIn: The funds of a constituent fund may be invested only—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in investments that satisfy the requirements of sections 7 to 16 of this Schedule; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that satisfies the requirements of Part 4 of this Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: B
ii
subparagraph.content: an index-tracking collective investment scheme approved by the Authority for the purposes of section 6A of this Schedule; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a combination of an approved pooled investment fund falling within subparagraph (i) and an index-tracking collective investment scheme falling within subparagraph (ii). (29 of 2002 s. 14)

section.name: s6A
section.heading: Permissible investments: index-tracking collective investment scheme
section.leadIn: The funds of a constituent fund may be invested in an index-tracking collective investment scheme which is— (L.N. 145 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: authorized by the Securities and Futures Commission, within the meaning of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: listed on a stock exchange approved by the Authority for the purposes of this section; and (L.N. 145 of 2006)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approved by the Authority for the purposes of this section.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Permissible investments: debt securities

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ExemptAuthority
def.leadIn: exempt authority (獲豁免當局) means—

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: the Central People’s Government; (L.N. 130 of 2022)

paragraph.name: aab
paragraph.content: the People’s Bank of China; (L.N. 130 of 2022)

paragraph.name: aac
paragraph.content: the Agricultural Development Bank of China; (L.N. 130 of 2022)

paragraph.name: aad
paragraph.content: the China Development Bank; (L.N. 130 of 2022)

paragraph.name: aae
paragraph.content: The Export-Import Bank of China; (L.N. 130 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Government; (L.N. 130 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: a company all of the shares of which are owned beneficially by the Government; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a government, the central or reserve bank of a country or territory, or a multilateral international agency all with the highest possible credit rating determined by a credit rating agency approved by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The funds of a constituent fund may be invested in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a debt security issued by an exempt authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a debt security in respect of which the repayment of the principal and the payment of interest is unconditionally guaranteed by an exempt authority; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a debt security that satisfies a minimum credit rating set by the Authority, based on the credit rating of the security as determined by a credit rating agency approved by the Authority for the purposes of this Schedule; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a debt security listed on an approved stock exchange, being a security issued by, or guaranteed by, a company or corporation whose shares are listed on that exchange or another approved stock exchange. (L.N. 223 of 2000; 5 of 2002 s. 407; 29 of 2002 s. 14; L.N. 145 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: Section 2 of this Schedule does not apply in relation to a debt security of a kind referred to in subsection (2)(a) or (b) and the following provisions apply instead—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: all of the funds of a constituent fund may be invested in debt securities of the same issuer so long as they comprise at least 6 different issues and are of a kind referred to in either of those paragraphs.

subsection.leadIn: The funds of a constituent fund may be applied for the purposes of entering into a repurchase agreement, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the agreement is in respect of a debt security of a kind referred to in subsection (2)(a), (b), (c) or (d); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the requirements in section 51 of this Regulation are complied with.

subsection.def: For the purposes of this section, debt security (債務證券) does not include a document issued by a person as evidence of a deposit, within the meaning of section 11 of this Schedule, that is placed with that person. (L.N. 145 of 2006)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Permissible investments: equities and other securities

subsection.leadIn: The funds of a constituent fund may be invested in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fully-paid up shares listed on an approved stock exchange other than the shares of a company which is a collective investment scheme; (5 of 2002 s. 407)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an index-tracking collective investment scheme approved by the Authority for the purposes of section 6A of this Schedule; or (29 of 2002 s. 14)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: securities listed on an approved stock exchange that are approved, or are of a kind approved, by the Authority. (L.N. 145 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: Not more than 10 per cent in total of the funds of a constituent fund may be invested in the following— (L.N. 145 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: an authorized unit trust or authorized mutual fund of a kind to which Part 4 of this Schedule does not apply but which is approved by the Authority for the purposes of this Part. (5 of 2002 s. 407)

section.name: s9
section.heading: Permissible investments: convertible debt securities

subsection.leadIn: The funds of a constituent fund may be invested in— (L.N. 145 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a convertible debt security listed on an approved stock exchange and convertible to shares listed on that exchange or another approved stock exchange; or ( 5 of 2002 s. 407; 29 of 2002 s. 14; L.N. 145 of 2006)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a convertible debt security that satisfies the minimum credit rating requirements for a debt security.

subsection.def: For the purposes of this section, convertible debt security (可轉換債務證券) does not include a document issued by a person as evidence of a deposit, within the meaning of section 11 of this Schedule, that is placed with that person. (L.N. 145 of 2006)

section.name: s10
section.heading: Permissible investments: warrants
section.leadIn: The funds of a constituent fund may be applied for the purposes of acquiring a warrant, but only if—

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: the warrant is listed on an approved stock exchange or an approved futures exchange; (L.N. 145 of 2006)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: the underlying ordinary shares to which the warrant may be converted are listed on an approved stock exchange; (L.N. 145 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the warrant does not (except when the warrant is purchased for the specific purpose of hedging) contain a put warrant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after acquisition of the warrant, no more than 5 per cent of the total funds of the constituent fund will be invested in warrants.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Permissible investments: deposits

subsection.leadIn: The funds of a constituent fund may be placed on deposit with— (L.N. 145 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized financial institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an eligible overseas bank,

subsection.continued: but only in accordance with this section.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The funds of a constituent fund must not be placed on deposit with a branch outside Hong Kong of an authorized financial institution incorporated outside Hong Kong that is not a re-domiciled entity unless the authorized financial institution satisfies a minimum credit rating set by the Authority, based on the credit rating of the authorized financial institution as determined by an approved credit rating agency. (L.N. 145 of 2006; 14 of 2025 s. 239)

The funds of a constituent fund must not be placed on deposit with an authorized financial institution or an eligible overseas bank if the total amount so placed would be more than 10 per cent of the issued capital and reserves of the institution or bank. (L.N. 145 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: Funds of a constituent fund must not be placed on deposit with an authorized financial institution or an eligible overseas bank if the total amount of funds so placed would exceed— (L.N. 145 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the total market value of the constituent fund is less than $8,000,000, 25 per cent of that fund; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, 10 per cent of that fund.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: Notwithstanding subsection (3), where a constituent fund has a total market value of less than $8,000,000, then that subsection shall not apply to the constituent fund if the approved trustee has the prior approval of the Authority that that subsection shall not apply to the constituent fund. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.content: In granting an approval mentioned in subsection (3A), the Authority may impose such conditions with respect to the constituent fund concerned as the Authority considers appropriate. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

subsection.name: 3C
subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: has decided that it is appropriate to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: amend any conditions imposed under subsection (3B) or this subsection with respect to a constituent fund; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: impose conditions with respect to a constituent fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: has given to the approved trustee concerned—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: not less than 30 days’ advance notice of its decision, specifying its grounds; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an opportunity to make written representations as to why the conditions should not be amended or imposed,

subsection.continued: then the Authority may, by written notice served on the approved trustee—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: amend any conditions imposed under subsection (3B) or this subsection with respect to the constituent fund; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: impose conditions with respect to the constituent fund. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

subsection.content: Funds of a constituent fund must not be placed on deposit with a group of associated authorized financial institutions or eligible overseas banks (or a combination of them) if the total amount of funds so placed would exceed 25 per cent of the total market value of the constituent fund. (L.N. 145 of 2006)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: Notwithstanding subsection (4), where a constituent fund has a total market value of less than $8,000,000, then that subsection shall not apply to the constituent fund if the approved trustee has the prior approval of the Authority that that subsection shall not apply to the constituent fund. (L.N. 145 of 2006)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, where the funds of a constituent fund are invested in a certificate of deposit that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issued by an authorized financial institution or an eligible overseas bank; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: acquired from a person other than the authorized financial institution or eligible overseas bank,

subsection.continued: such amount of the funds as is equal to the market value of the certificate of deposit is to be regarded as having been placed on deposit with the authorized financial institution or eligible overseas bank. (L.N. 145 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Deposit
def.leadIn: deposit (存款) means a loan of money that is repayable with or without interest or premium, either on demand or at a time or in circumstances agreed by or on behalf of the person making the payment and the person receiving it, but does not include a loan of money—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: upon terms referable to the provision of property or services or the giving of security; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specified by the Authority as not being regarded as a deposit for the purposes of this definition,

def.continued: and references to placing funds on deposit shall be construed accordingly. (L.N. 145 of 2006)

section.name: s13
section.heading: Permissible investments: securities to be listed
section.leadIn: The funds of a constituent fund may be applied for acquiring securities that are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of a kind to which section 7(2)(d), 8(1), 9(1)(a) or 10 of this Schedule would apply if they were listed on an approved stock exchange or an approved futures exchange; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be listed on an approved stock exchange or an approved futures exchange.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Futures contracts and option contracts: restrictions on acquisition

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this section, the funds of a constituent fund may be applied for acquiring a financial futures contract or a financial option contract only—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for hedging purposes; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for any other purpose, but only if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the acquisition does not result in the constituent fund becoming leveraged; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the effective exposure of the fund in financial futures contracts and financial option contracts as a result of the acquisition of the contract does not exceed 10 per cent of the market value of the fund.

subsection.content: A financial futures contract must not be acquired for a constituent fund unless it is traded on an approved futures exchange. (5 of 2002 s. 407; L.N. 145 of 2006)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: A contract described in paragraph (a) or (b)(i) of the definition of financial futures contract in section 2 of this Regulation must not be acquired for a constituent fund unless investing in the specified security or securities concerned is permitted under this Schedule at the time when the contract is entered into. (L.N. 145 of 2006)
A financial option contract must not be acquired for a constituent fund unless it is traded on an approved futures exchange or an approved stock exchange. (5 of 2002 s. 407; L.N. 145 of 2006)

A financial futures contract or a financial option contract may be acquired for the purposes of a constituent fund only if the approved trustee of the scheme and the investment manager appointed for the purposes of the fund have special qualifications approved or specified by the Authority for the purposes of this section.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a constituent fund is leveraged if the effective exposure of the fund exceeds the market value of the fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the effective exposure, in relation to a constituent fund, means the sum of the effective exposures of all investments of the fund.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Currency forward contracts: restrictions on acquisition

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this section, the funds of a constituent fund may be applied for acquiring a currency forward contract only—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for hedging purposes; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purpose of settling a transaction relating to the acquisition of securities.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2A), a currency forward contract may be acquired for a constituent fund only if it is acquired— (L.N. 145 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from an authorized financial institution or an eligible overseas bank; and (L.N. 145 of 2006)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period of the contract is not more than 12 months.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: A currency forward contract must not be acquired from a branch outside Hong Kong of an authorized financial institution incorporated outside Hong Kong that is not a re-domiciled entity unless the authorized financial institution satisfies a minimum credit rating set by the Authority, based on the credit rating of the authorized financial institution as determined by an approved credit rating agency. (L.N. 145 of 2006; 14 of 2025 s. 239)

section.name: s16
section.heading: Permissible investments: minimum Hong Kong dollar currency exposure

subsection.content: At least 30 per cent of a constituent fund must be held in Hong Kong dollar currency investments, as measured by the effective currency exposure.

subsection.leadIn: The percentage referred to in subsection (1) is to be calculated—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by dividing the total effective currency exposure of Hong Kong dollar currency investments by the total market value of the constituent fund (disregarding the value of any collateral securities given as referred to in sections 51 and 52 of this Regulation); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by multiplying the resulting amount by 100.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: effective currency exposure (有效貨幣風險), in relation to a constituent fund, means the proportion of the fund that is effectively invested in investments of a particular currency denomination as compared with the market value of the fund;

def.name: HongKongDollarCurrencyInvestment
def.leadIn: Hong Kong dollar currency investment (港元貨幣投資項目) means an investment that is denominated in Hong Kong dollars and of which the value is not linked to a foreign currency and, in particular, includes any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cash in Hong Kong dollars and deposits in Hong Kong dollars, other than deposits in relation to which the repayment of principal or the payment of interest is, directly or indirectly, affected by fluctuations in exchange rates for a foreign currency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: debt securities of a kind referred to in section 7(2)(a), (b) or (c) or 9(1)(b) of this Schedule that are denominated in Hong Kong dollars and in relation to which— (L.N. 145 of 2006)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the repayment of principal and the payment of interest are to be made in Hong Kong dollars; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: securities of a kind referred to in section 7(2)(d), 8(1) or 9(1)(a) of this Schedule that are listed or to be listed on a recognized stock market; (5 of 2002 s. 407; L.N. 145 of 2006)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: warrants of a kind referred to in section 10 of this Schedule that are listed or to be listed on a recognized stock market; (5 of 2002 s. 407; L.N. 145 of 2006)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: financial option contracts, of a kind referred to in section 14(3) of this Schedule that are traded on a recognized futures market or a recognized stock market with reference to underlying securities or an index of securities of a kind referred to in paragraph (c); (5 of 2002 s. 407)

paragraph.name: f
g
h
paragraph.content: receivables in Hong Kong dollars;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: payables in Hong Kong dollars;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: approved pooled investment funds that are denominated in Hong Kong dollars, but only if each of those funds has a total value of Hong Kong dollar currency investments equal to the total market value of the fund, as measured by the effective currency exposure;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: other approved pooled investment funds.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, the effective currency exposure, in relation to the Hong Kong dollar currency investments of a constituent fund, is the amount by which the aggregate of all amounts specified in subsection (5) exceed the aggregate of all amounts specified in subsection (6).

subsection.leadIn: The following amounts are the amounts firstly referred to in subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an amount equal to 30 per cent of the market value of the approved pooled investment funds referred to in paragraph (k) of the definition of Hong Kong dollar currency investment in subsection (3) that are held in respect of the constituent fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an amount equal to the market value of the investments referred to in paragraphs (a) to (e) and (j) of that definition that are held in respect of that fund; (32 of 2000 s. 48)

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: an amount equal to the receivables referred to in paragraph (h) of that definition that relates to that fund.

subsection.leadIn: The following amounts are the amounts secondly referred to in subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an amount equal to the market value of the currency forward contracts referred to in paragraph (g) of the definition of Hong Kong dollar currency investment in subsection (3) that are held in respect of the constituent fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an amount equal to the amount of the payables referred to in paragraph (i) of that definition that relates to that fund.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Pooled investment funds

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the funds comprising a constituent fund may be invested in a pooled investment fund, which may in turn be invested in 1 or more other pooled investment funds.

subsection.leadIn: A pooled investment fund in which funds are invested as referred to in subsection (1) must comply with the following requirements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fund must be authorized by the Securities and Futures Commission in accordance with the requirements relating to collective investment schemes under Part IV of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) and approved by the Authority for the purposes of this Regulation; (5 of 2002 s. 407)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the bases for all charges (including investment management charges, initial charges, annual and other periodic fees, surrender charges, surrender penalties and other deductions that may apply to that fund) must be disclosed to the holders of interests in the fund;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: if the fund provides a guaranteed return of capital or of income on capital (or both), there must be full disclosure of main features of the guarantee, including a clear description of how the return is to be determined and the extent of any discretion that may be exercised in making such a determination;

paragraph.name: e
f
g
paragraph.content: the trustee of the fund, and any investment manager or custodian appointed by the trustee in relation to the fund, must comply with such of the requirements of this Regulation as relate to an approved trustee of a registered scheme, and to an investment manager or custodian appointed by such an approved trustee, in so far as those requirements are relevant to the fund;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the financial statements, investment reports and auditor’s reports of the fund must be lodged with the Authority and additional information relating to those statements and reports must be provided to the Authority whenever the Authority requests;

paragraph.name: i
j
paragraph.content: if the fund is invested in another fund and the manager of the fund, or an associate of that manager, manages the other fund, no additional initial charges may be imposed in relation to the management of that other fund;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the fund must be governed by the law of Hong Kong.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Unit trusts and mutual funds

subsection.content: The funds of a constituent fund may be invested in a unit trust or mutual fund, but only if it is an authorized unit trust or an authorized mutual fund.

An authorized unit trust or an authorized mutual fund that provides for a guaranteed amount to be paid to investors who hold units in the unit trust, or shares in the mutual fund, at a specified date in the future must have a guarantor that is an authorized financial institution that complies with subsection (3).

For the purposes of subsection (2), an authorized financial institution complies with this subsection only if it satisfies capital adequacy or reserve requirements imposed in respect of investment guarantees by the Monetary Authority.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Insurance policies

subsection.leadIn: The funds of a constituent fund may be invested in an insurance policy, but only if the policy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is within class G or H insurance business for the purposes of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); and (12 of 2015 s. 132)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is issued by an authorized insurer; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a policy that is within class H insurance business, operates, to the satisfaction of the Authority, as a full investment-linked policy linked to a separate pooled investment fund; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of a policy that is fully or partially investment-linked, has policy values that are, to the satisfaction of the Authority, fully unitised.

subsection.content: An authorized financial institution may act as the guarantor of an insurance policy of class G, but only if the institution complies with subsection (3).

For the purposes of subsection (2), an authorized financial institution complies with this subsection only if it satisfies capital adequacy or reserve requirements imposed in respect of investment guarantees by the Monetary Authority.
The underlying investments of an insurance policy of the same series must be kept in a separate pooled investment fund.

The insurer may act as the investment manager of the fund referred to in subsection (4) only if the insurer is a corporation licensed to carry on, or an authorized financial institution registered for carrying on, a business in asset management under Part V of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571). (5 of 2002 s. 407)
An investment management contract relating to a registered scheme must be in writing and must be governed by the law of Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The contract must also—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: oblige the investment manager to disclose to the approved trustee particulars (including the form, method of calculation and amount) of all emoluments and other benefits received or to be received by the manager as a result of being the investment manager for the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: oblige the investment manager to report in writing to the approved trustee at intervals of not more than 3 months the amounts of brokerage and commissions charged in respect of dealings with securities relating to the scheme and to include in the report particulars of the persons who charged those amounts; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require that any payment made to the approved trustee or investment manager by a third party, either directly or indirectly, will be credited to the scheme if the payment is derived from the acquisition or disposal of scheme assets; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: oblige the investment manager—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to include in an annual report to the approved trustee a description of the manager’s business practices with respect to the provision of goods and services to the manager by a broker or dealer in consideration of directing to the broker or dealer business relating to transactions involving the acquisition or disposal of scheme assets; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to specify in the report the value of those goods and services; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: state whether or not the contract restricts the right of the investment manager to act as an investment manager or in any other capacity for any other person and, if not, specify the capacity in which the investment manager may act for another person; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: state what period of notice must be given by any of the parties to the contract in order to terminate the contract; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: provide for the contract to be terminated if the company constituting the investment manager is commenced to be wound up or is dissolved without being wound up; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: oblige the investment manager to be bound by, and to comply with, the statement of investment policy applicable to the scheme; and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: state whether or not the contract allows the investment manager to delegate any of the manager’s functions in respect of the scheme and, if it does, specify which of those functions may be delegated; and

paragraph.name: j
k
paragraph.leadIn: state whether or not, and if so under what conditions, the funds of the scheme may be applied for the purposes of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subscribing for debt securities from an underwriter or sub-underwriter; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: purchasing or subscribing for the issue of securities offered to the public by prospectus; and

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.leadIn: include provisions that will enable the approved trustee to require the investment manager from time to time to give to the trustee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: appropriate information as to the investment of the funds of the scheme and the return on those investments; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: such information as is necessary to enable the trustee to assess the capacity of the investment manager to manage those investments in a proper manner; and

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: specify whether or not the contract prohibits any of the parties to the contract from entering into any other kinds of contracts and, if so, specify those other kinds of contracts; and

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.leadIn: oblige the investment manager, and any delegate of that manager, to exercise—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the duty of care, skill, diligence and prudence reasonably to be expected of a prudent person who is acting in a similar capacity to the manager or delegate and is familiar with the management of the investment of the funds of a provident fund scheme; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the duty to make use of all relevant knowledge and skill that the manager or delegate may be reasonably expected to have because of the business or occupation of the manager or delegate; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the duty to ensure that the funds of the scheme are invested in different investments so as to minimise the risk of losses to those funds, unless in particular circumstances it is prudent not to do so; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the duty to act in the interest of scheme members and not in the interest of the manager or delegate; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the duty to act in accordance with the governing rules of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: oblige the investment manager, and any delegate of that manager, to do everything within their power to enable the trustee to comply with section 47 of this Regulation; and

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.leadIn: oblige the investment manager to report to the trustee as soon as is practicable—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: material contraventions of the investment manager’s obligations; and

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.leadIn: oblige the investment manager to report to the approved trustee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any relationship that the investment manager has with a service provider appointed or engaged for the purposes of the scheme because either of them is an associate of the other; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any arrangement whereby fees, commissions or other payments are received from, paid to or shared with any third party to the contract as a result of being appointed as investment manager for the scheme,

paragraph.continued: and to disclose to the trustee the amounts of those fees, commissions or payments; and

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: require the investment manager to provide information necessary to enable the approved trustee to perform the trustee’s duties with respect to the scheme; and

paragraph.name: s
t
paragraph.content: if the investment manager, or a delegate of the manager, fails to comply with a direction given, guideline issued or requirement made by the approved trustee with respect to the investment of the funds of the scheme, oblige the manager to compensate the scheme for any loss that is attributable to the failure, except where the failure is a result of an event that was not under the control of the investment manager or that manager’s delegate or could not have been foreseen; and

paragraph.name: u
paragraph.content: oblige the investment manager to rectify as soon as practicable any failure to comply with a direction given, guideline issued or requirement made by the approved trustee with respect to the investment of the funds of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: if the investment manager contravenes the Ordinance, oblige the investment manager to take into account the interests of scheme members before entering into any transaction to rectify the contravention, and to compensate those members for any loss attributable to the contravention.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The agreement must require the scheme assets—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be recorded and controlled in such manner as may be customary and prudent in the circumstances; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be entrusted to the custodian for safe keeping; and (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: entrusted to the custodian—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: where the scheme assets are in registered form, to be—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: registered in the name of the custodian or its delegate; or

subparagraph.name: B
ii
subparagraph.content: where the scheme assets are in bearer form, to be held in the physical possession of the custodian or its delegate; and (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to be segregated from the custodian’s and its delegates’ assets. (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000)

section.name: s2
section.content: Subject to section 11 of this Schedule, the agreement must require the scheme assets to be recorded separately from all other assets of the custodian and trustee, including any assets held by the custodian or trustee for the benefit of a participating employer or any other person. (L.N. 223 of 2000)

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: The agreement must require that the scheme assets are not to be made subject to any encumbrance except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where the encumbrance is created for the purpose of securing an amount borrowed to enable accrued benefits to be paid to or in respect of scheme members, and then only if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amount borrowed (together with any other borrowings made for the same purpose) does not exceed 10 per cent of the market value of the scheme assets at the time of the borrowing; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the borrowing is not part of a series of borrowings; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: at the time the borrowing was made, it was unlikely that the period of borrowing would exceed 90 days; or (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the encumbrance is created for the purpose of securing an amount borrowed to settle a transaction relating to the acquisition of scheme assets, and then only if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amount borrowed (together with any other borrowings made for the same purpose) does not exceed 10 per cent of the market value of the scheme assets at the time of the borrowing; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the borrowing is not part of a series of borrowings; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: at the time the borrowing was made, it was unlikely that the period of borrowing would exceed 7 working days; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: at the time the decision to enter into the transaction was made, it was unlikely that the borrowing would be necessary; or (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the encumbrance is created for the purpose of securing a claim for payment of fees for the safe custody or administration of the scheme assets by a central securities depository or a delegate of a custodian; or (L.N. 223 of 2000; 1 of 2008 s. 14)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where the encumbrance is created for the purpose of acquiring a financial futures contract pursuant to section 14 of Schedule 1 or a currency forward contract pursuant to section 15 of Schedule 1; or (L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: where the encumbrance is created by the operation of law in Hong Kong or in a place outside Hong Kong. (L.N. 223 of 2000)

section.name: s4
section.content: The agreement must require that the scheme assets can be applied only for the purpose of the registered scheme and that any encumbrance created or granted over scheme assets is void to the extent to which it is inconsistent with this Schedule.

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: Subject to section 11 of this Schedule, the agreement must require the scheme to be indemnified by the custodian— (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for any direct losses incurred by scheme members that are attributable to fraudulent, dishonest or negligent acts or omissions committed by the custodian or its employees in connection with the performance of the custodian’s obligations under the agreement; and (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for any direct losses attributable to fraudulent, dishonest or negligent acts or omissions committed by delegates of the custodian to the same extent as if the custodian had committed those acts or omissions itself. (29 of 2002 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 11 of this Schedule, the agreement must require the custodian to report to the trustee any of the following events as soon as practicable after they occur— (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: material breaches of the custodian’s obligations.

subsection.content: Subject to section 11 of this Schedule, the agreement must also require the custodian to lodge with the trustee periodically (but not less than once during each financial period of the scheme concerned) a report stating whether or not any material events have occurred during the period to which the report relates and, if any such events have occurred during that period, specifying details of those events. However, details of a material event do not have to be included in such a report if the event has already been reported under subsection (1). (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000)

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: Subject to section 11 of this Schedule, the agreement must require the custodian to provide to the trustee within 4 months after the end of each financial year of the custodian— (L.N. 222 of 2000; L.N. 223 of 2000)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement as to whether or not each delegate of the custodian satisfies the same eligibility requirements as those applicable to the custodian and, if not, a statement specifying the extent to which those requirements are not satisfied; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the custodian is a company, a copy of the balance sheet and profit and loss account of the custodian with respect to that financial year, together with a copy of the auditor’s report with respect to those documents.

section.name: s8
section.content: The agreement must require the custodian to maintain accurate records of the scheme assets and allow the approved trustee (including its agents and the auditors appointed in respect of the scheme) to have access to those records.

section.name: s9
section.content: The agreement must require the custodian, when exercising its functions in relation to the scheme concerned, to apply the same degree of care, skill, diligence and prudence as may be reasonably expected of a prudent person who has custody of scheme assets.

section.name: s10
section.content: The agreement must be in writing and provide that it is to be governed by the law of Hong Kong. However, a subcustodial agreement does not have to be governed by the law of Hong Kong if the relevant assets are kept in a place outside Hong Kong.

section.name: s11
section.leadIn: The Authority may, subject to such conditions as the Authority thinks fit, by notice in writing (published in such manner as the Authority thinks fit) waive or modify the provisions of section 2 of this Schedule, and, in the case of a delegate of a custodian, section 2, 5, 6(1)(a) or (2) or 7(a) of this Schedule, where the Authority is of the opinion that the provisions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause undue hardship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are incapable of or precluded from being complied with by virtue of a law in a place outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: are not in the interests of relevant scheme members. (L.N. 222 of 2000)

section.name: s12
section.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: scheme assets—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: comprising cash held by a custodian which is an authorized financial institution, an eligible overseas bank or an approved overseas bank may be held by any such custodian in its capacity as a bank; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: may be deposited by the custodian and its delegates with, and held in, any central securities depository on such terms as such central securities depository customarily operate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any encumbrance created over the scheme assets of a registered scheme that is, at the time of creation, consistent with the exception under section 3 of this Schedule shall remain valid throughout the period for which the borrowing concerned remains outstanding. (L.N. 222 of 2000)
