Approved trustee to apply for Authority’s consent in respect of person who has become substantial shareholder without Authority’s prior consent (18 of 2008 s. 34)
Substantial shareholder not to exercise voting right (18 of 2008 s. 34)
Approved trustee to terminate appointment of officer (18 of 2008 s. 34)
a daily penalty of $1,000 for each day on which the failure to terminate the appointment of the officer continues
Shadow director not to give instructions to directors of approved trustee (18 of 2008 s. 34)
Director to notify Authority of contravention of section 42E(9) (18 of 2008 s. 34)
Duty of approved trustee with respect to investing in financial futures contracts and financial option contracts
Requirements with respect to provision of information to scheme members
Requirements with respect to provision of annual benefit statements to scheme members
Approved trustee to assist employers and scheme members
Requirements with respect to changes of approved trustee’s business particulars
Approved trustee to ensure presence of independent trustee at meetings
Approved trustee to report events of significant nature
Amendments to the governing rules of registered scheme not to take effect without Authority’s approval
Amendments to offering documents require Authority’s approval (2 of 2002 s. 21)
Approved trustee to review service providers’ reports
Requirements with respect to financial period of registered scheme
Approved trustee to prepare statement of accounting policies
Approved trustee to prepare financial statements
Auditor’s report to be attached to financial statements
Approved trustee to comply with sections 86 and 87 before deadline
Approved trustee to publish consolidated report
Approved trustee to give copy of consolidated report to scheme members
Keeping of register of scheme members
Keeping of other records of registered scheme
Periods for which accounting and other records are to be kept
Requirements with respect to removal of auditor of registered scheme
Approved trustee to lodge trustee’s return with Authority
Requirements in section 22A of the Ordinance
Requirements with respect to varying a relevant period for the purposes of sections 112, 113 and 116
Approved trustee to report on control objectives and internal control measures
Approved trustee to report on compliance with capital adequacy requirements
Approved trustee to lodge monthly return with Authority
Participating employer to provide remittance statements
Approved trustee to take actions required by Authority (1 of 2008 s. 69)
Participating employer and self-employed person to comply with requirement of a notice served under section 136
Participating employer to give monthly pay-records to scheme members
Participating employer to respond to inquiries relating to registered scheme
Self-employed person to notify trustee of change of particulars
Participating employer to notify trustee of certain information
Participating employer to give document or information to employee (40 of 2021 s. 102)
Participating employer to give notice to trustee under sections 145(5), (6) and (7A), 146(7), (8) and (9A), 147(5) and 148(6) (1 of 2008 s. 26)
Approved trustee to transfer accrued benefits to master trust scheme (40 of 2021 s. 102)
Self-employed person to give notice to trustee under section 148(7)
Duty of approved trustee on being notified of election of transfer of accrued benefits
Approved trustee to comply with Authority’s requirement not to give effect to election (40 of 2021 s. 102)
Approved trustee to ensure payment of accrued benefits within certain period
Approved trustee to comply with Authority’s requirement not to make payment (2 of 2002 s. 21; 40 of 2021 s. 102)
Approved trustee to ensure claimant provided with benefit payment statement (1 of 2015 s. 51)
Requirements with respect to treatment of unclaimed accrued benefits or accrued benefits that have not been paid (40 of 2021 s. 102)
Approved trustee to pay levy to administrator of compensation fund
$5,000 or 10 per cent of the amount to be paid, whichever is the greater
Applicant to publish notice on Authority’s consent to the voluntary winding up of employer sponsored scheme and to serve copy of notice on remaining scheme members etc.
Requirements with respect to the effect of winding up employer sponsored scheme

part.text: The short descriptions specified in column 3 of this Schedule are used for the purposes of reference only and are not intended to affect the operation of the provisions specified in column 2 of this Schedule.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: effective day (規定生效日), in relation to a pre-existing scheme, means the day specified under section 19N(1) of the Ordinance for the scheme;
relevant requirement (相關規定) has the meaning given by section 19O(2) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Transitional arrangement relating to control objectives to be maintained for each pre-existing scheme—section 39

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 52 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 39 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to control objectives of a pre-existing scheme, to the extent that section 34DC(1) applies to the approved trustee of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation;

def.name: Section34DC1
def.leadIn: section 34DC(1) (第34DC(1)條)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means section 34DC(1) of the Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes section 34DC(1) of the Ordinance that applies because of section 7 of Schedule 17 to the Ordinance.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to provision of tax deductible voluntary contributions summaries with respect to TVC accounts to scheme members—section 56A

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 55 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 56A as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 56A) applies to a pre-existing scheme in relation to a contribution summary for a financial year of the scheme unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the relevant requirement takes effect on—

subparagraph.content: a day either before the beginning of the financial year or in the financial year; or
a day falling within the specified period mentioned in the pre-amended section 56A.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(9) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 16A of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 56A applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to notification to scheme members—section 59(1)

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 57(2) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 59(1) as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 59(1)) applies to a pre-existing scheme if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme, and the inquiry or request concerned was received by the approved trustee of the scheme before the effective day.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(10) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 19 of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 59(1) applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to service provider’s duty to report certain matters to Authority—section 75(1)(aa)(iii)

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 59 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 75 (to the extent that it relates to subsection (1)(aa)(iii)) as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 75) applies to a service provider in relation to a pre-existing scheme if, on or after the commencement date, the service provider, in the course of performing the service provider’s obligations relating to the scheme, becomes aware that the approved trustee of the scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was not complying with section 34DC(1) of the Ordinance (section 34DC(1)) before the commencement date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not complying with section 34DC(1) that applies to the approved trustee because of section 7 of Schedule 17 to the Ordinance.

subsection.content: Because of subsection (1), the reference to section 75 in section 76 includes the pre-amended section 75.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to service provider’s duty to report certain matters to Authority—section 75(1)(f)

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 59 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 75 (to the extent that it relates to subsection (1)(f)) as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 75) applies to a service provider in relation to a pre-existing scheme if, on or after the commencement date, the service provider, in the course of performing the service provider’s obligations relating to the scheme, becomes aware that the approved trustee of the scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: had not complied with section 135 before the commencement date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not complied with section 135 that applies to the approved trustee because of section 15 of this Schedule.

subsection.content: Because of subsection (1), the reference to section 75 in section 76 includes the pre-amended section 75.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Transitional arrangement relating to auditor’s duty to report on financial statements etc.—section 102

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 60 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 102 as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 102) applies in relation to a financial period of a pre-existing scheme if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as at the time specified in subsection (2)(e)(i) of the pre-amended section 102; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as at any of the dates specified in subsection (2)(e)(ii) of the pre-amended section 102,

subsection.continued: the approved trustee of the scheme is required to comply with section 34DC(1) of the Ordinance (whether or not because of section 7 of Schedule 17 to the Ordinance).

subsection.content: Because of subsection (1), the reference to section 102 in section 106 includes the pre-amended section 102.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to auditor’s duty to report certain matters to Authority—section 103(1)(ab)(ii)

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 61 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 103 (to the extent that it relates to subsection (1)(ab)(ii)) as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 103) applies to an auditor of a pre-existing scheme if, on or after the commencement date, the auditor, in the course of performing the auditor’s duties under Part 8, becomes aware that the approved trustee of the scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was not complying with section 34DC(1) of the Ordinance (section 34DC(1)) before the commencement date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not complying with section 34DC(1) that applies to the approved trustee because of section 7 of Schedule 17 to the Ordinance.

subsection.content: Because of subsection (1), the references to section 103 in sections 104 and 106 include the pre-amended section 103.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to auditor’s duty to report certain matters to Authority—section 103(1)(g)

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 61 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 103 (to the extent that it relates to subsection (1)(g)) as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 103) applies to an auditor of a pre-existing scheme if, on or after the commencement date, the auditor, in the course of performing the auditor’s duties under Part 8, becomes aware that the approved trustee of the scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: had not complied with section 135 before the commencement date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not complied with section 135 that applies to the approved trustee because of section 15 of this Schedule.

subsection.content: Because of subsection (1), the references to section 103 in sections 104 and 106 include the pre-amended section 103.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to annual statements required to be lodged under section 22A of Ordinance—section 110

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 63 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 110 as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 110) applies to a pre-existing scheme in relation to a financial period of the scheme unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the financial period ends on—

subparagraph.content: the effective day; or
a day after the effective day.

subsection.content: Because of subsection (1), the reference to section 110 in section 102 includes the pre-amended section 110.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Transitional arrangement relating to approved trustee’s duty to lodge monthly return with Authority—section 117

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 64 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 117 as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 117) applies to the approved trustee of a pre-existing scheme in relation to a monthly return for a calendar month unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the relevant requirement takes effect on—

subparagraph.content: a day either before the beginning of the calendar month or in the calendar month; or
a day falling within the period mentioned in the pre-amended section 117.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to approved trustee’s duty to ascertain certain particulars—section 125

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 67 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 125(1) as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 125(1)) applies to the approved trustee of a pre-existing scheme unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant requirement has taken effect.

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of the amendment provision, section 125(3) as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 125(3)) applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme in relation to a self-employed person and a financial period of the scheme unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the relevant requirement takes effect—

subparagraph.content: on the first day of the financial period (relevant day);
before the relevant day; or
on a day falling within the last 30 days of the financial period.

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 102(11) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: item 48 of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee to which subsection (1) applies, to the extent that the pre-amended section 125(1) applies to the approved trustee because of that subsection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that item applies to the approved trustee to which subsection (2) applies, to the extent that the pre-amended section 125(3) applies to the approved trustee because of that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Transitional arrangement relating to relevant income of self-employed person who does not produce evidence of that income—section 128

subsection.content: This section applies to a self-employed person relating to a pre-existing scheme, and a financial period of the scheme, if section 125(1) or (3) as in force immediately before the date of commencement* of section 67 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (commencement date) applies to the person in relation to the financial period because of section 12 of this Schedule.
Despite the commencement of section 68 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, section 128 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the person in relation to the financial period.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to approved trustee’s duty to check calculations of mandatory contributions—section 132

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 71 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 132 as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 132) applies to the approved trustee of a pre-existing scheme in relation to a mandatory contribution payable by a participating employer if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme, and the contribution was received before the effective day.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(11) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 49 of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 132 applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to approved trustee’s duty to inform Authority of failure to pay mandatory contribution—section 135

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 72 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 135 as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 135) applies to the approved trustee of a pre-existing scheme in relation to a mandatory contribution payable by a participating employer or self-employed person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme, and the contribution day falls on a day before the effective day.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(11) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 52 of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 135 applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to Authority’s notice to defaulter and approved trustee’s duty to inform Authority of non-payment—section 136

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of sections 65 and 73 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provisions), sections 119 and 136 as in force immediately before the commencement date apply to or in relation to a pre-existing scheme if a notice is given by the approved trustee of the scheme to the Authority under the pre-amended section 135.

subsection.leadIn: If the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme has not received all arrears and contribution surcharges within the payment period as described in section 136(5) as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 136(5)), the approved trustee must inform the Authority of the fact in accordance with the pre-amended section 136(5) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the last day of the payment period falls on—

subparagraph.content: the effective day; or
a day after the effective day.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(11) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 53 of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 136(5) applies to the approved trustee because of this section.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provisions come into operation;

def.name: PreamendedSection135
def.leadIn: pre-amended section 135 (原有第135條) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 135 as in force immediately before the commencement date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 135 as it applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme because of section 15 of this Schedule.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to approved trustee’s duty to check calculations of arrears and contribution surcharge—section 137

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of sections 65 and 74 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provisions), sections 119 and 137 as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended provisions) apply to the approved trustee of a pre-existing scheme in relation to an amount received by the approved trustee as arrears or contribution surcharge if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme, and the amount was received before the effective day.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(11) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 55 of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended provisions apply to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provisions come into operation.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Transitional arrangement relating to crediting of payments—section 138

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 74 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 138 as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section) applies to the approved trustee of a pre-existing scheme in relation to a payment described in subsection (1) of the pre-amended section if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme, and the payment was made to the approved trustee before the effective day.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to approved trustee’s duty to notify scheme member of member’s options of transfer—section 152

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 79 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 152 as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 152) applies to the approved trustee of a pre-existing scheme in relation to a scheme member who has ceased to be employed by a participating employer or ceased to be self-employed if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme, and—

subparagraph.content: the approved trustee has been notified, before the effective day, that the member has ceased to be employed by a participating employer or ceased to be self-employed; and
the 30-day period mentioned in the pre-amended section 152 ends before the effective day.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(14) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 62 of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 152 applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to approved trustee’s duty to give transfer statement to scheme member—section 154

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 81 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 154 as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 154) applies to a pre-existing scheme in relation to a transfer of the accrued benefits of a member of the scheme if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme, and the transfer was completed before the effective day.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(14) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, items 64 and 64A of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before the commencement date apply to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 154 applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to confirmation of transfer to new scheme—section 155

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 81 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 155 as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 155) applies to a pre-existing scheme (relevant scheme) in relation to a transfer of the accrued benefits of a member of another registered scheme to the relevant scheme if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the relevant scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the relevant scheme, and the transfer was completed before the effective day.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(14) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 65 of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the relevant scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 155 applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Transitional arrangement relating to transfer of outstanding sums received by transferor trustees—section 157A

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 84 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 157A as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of a pre-existing scheme unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant requirement has taken effect.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Transitional arrangement relating to claim for payment on death—section 161(3)

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 88(2) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 161(3) as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of a pre-existing scheme unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant requirement has taken effect.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to claim for payment on ground of permanent departure from Hong Kong—sections 163 and 175

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 89(2) and (3) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 163 as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 163) applies to the approved trustee of a pre-existing scheme in relation to the payment of accrued benefits of a member of the scheme if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme, and—

subparagraph.content: the claim was lodged with the approved trustee before the effective day.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of sections 97 and 102(17) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, section 175 as in force immediately before the commencement date and item 68 of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before that date apply to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 163 applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to approved trustee’s duty if scheme member cannot be located—section 170

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 93 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 170 as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 170) applies in relation to the accrued benefits of a member of a pre-existing scheme unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant requirement has taken effect.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(20) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 72 of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 170 applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to approved trustee’s duty if claimant cannot subsequently be located—section 171

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 93 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 171 as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 171) applies to or in relation to the accrued benefits of a member of a pre-existing scheme unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant requirement has taken effect.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(20) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 73 of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 171 applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to approved trustee’s duty to notify scheme member who has reached retirement age of their entitlement—section 172

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 93 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 172 as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 172) applies to or in relation to the accrued benefits of a member of a pre-existing scheme unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant requirement has taken effect.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(20) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 74 of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 172 applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to approved trustee’s duty when scheme member whose accrued benefits are retained in scheme cannot be located—section 172A

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 93 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 172A as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 172A) applies to or in relation to accrued benefits of a member of a pre-existing scheme unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant requirement has taken effect.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(20) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 74A of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 172A applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to approved trustee’s duty to submit to Authority particulars of scheme members who have unclaimed benefits—section 172B

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 93 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 172B as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 172B) applies to the approved trustee of a pre-existing scheme if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme and, but for the commencement of the amendment provision—

subparagraph.content: the approved trustee would have been required to submit a quarterly report under the pre-amended section 172B within the period specified in the guidelines; and
the end day of the specified period would have fallen on a day before the effective day.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(20) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 74B of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 172B applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to disposal of unclaimed benefits in employer sponsored scheme—section 173

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of sections 78 and 95 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provisions), section 173 as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 173) applies to a pre-existing scheme in relation to accrued benefits of a member of the scheme that were treated as unclaimed benefits under the relevant provision if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme, and the 6-month period mentioned in section 173(1) as in force immediately before the commencement date begins before the effective day.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(20) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 75 of Schedule 4 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 173 applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provisions come into operation;

def.name: RelevantProvision
def.leadIn: relevant provision (相關條文)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means section 170, 171, 172 or 172A as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes a pre-amended section that applies because of section 25, 26, 27 or 28 of this Schedule.
